name: Sit in the Peaceful Garden of the Chickadee Cottage in LoHi
description:
Enjoy the famous Colorado weather and unplug in indoor & outdoor living.
Our charming cottage has a serene ambiance throughout every area.
Spend a sunny afternoon out on the hammock or enjoy the garden parlor sofa relax, read, or play a game, sink into the shared hot tub, practice yoga on the deck.
We are located next to downtown and in the neighborhood of lower highlands,
Short walks to superb coffee shops, restaurants, microbrews, distilleries, dispensaries & downtown. We are 420 outdoors only. LGBT Friendly, allergy-free, fragrance-free & pet-free. Ozone sterilized.

Chickadee Cottage is the largest of our guest cottages.

LOCATION:
The cottage is located in the center of Lower Highlands (LOHI) next to the Navajo Street Arts District along with the Bug Theater. Check out the Bugs listing to see what's going on - plays/film/comedy nights. No need to cab it because we are in the midst of it all.

COTTAGE DESCRIPTION:
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is located in the center of Lower Highlands (LOHI) next to the Navajo Street Arts District. Catch a show at the iconic Bug Theater. Wandering the neighborhood to discover breweries, distilleries and bars for local drinks, tuck into a family owned taqueria or explore more formal dinning experience. We are a vibrant neighborhood in Denver where you can see and do but just a quick walk thru the park to downtown, or a mile drive to RiNo. We are just 2.5 mile walk or dirve to Meow Wolf.

host_about:
We are artists and tinkerers.
 
We enjoy many activities here in Denver -  cooking, growing fruits and vegetables are some that we get to do here at the cottages along with mixed media projects and furniture building. 

We are always up to some new outdoor project when the Colorado weather permits and hunker down inside by the fire in the winter keeping our hands busy with knitting, card making or some other project we can dream up.   In fact the most recent outdoor project is for an outdoor parlor that will be winter friendly. 

Giovanni and I have grown in our collaborations and embrace our age and abilities  for self governance in employment - Giovanni had moved into documentaries and I have been spending more time in the commercial film community. 

We have been in the lower highlands for over a decade now and have marveled in the changing landscape and exciting times for new restaurants, breweries and galleries.  We still love to take advantage of the great walks thru the neighborhood and down by the river as often as we can.

name: Lodo / RiNo LOFT  via airport train
description: Modern 1,000 square foot loft in the heart of RiNo, the hottest neighborhood in Denver right now.  Breweries, coffee shops, restaurants - all close. The 500 sq ft. patio has panoramic views of the Rockies.  3 blocks away from airport train stop.
neighborhood_overview: Ten brewpubs within walking distance, two great restaurants within two blocks and dozens more restaurants/bars/coffee shops within 4-5 blocks.   It's close to downtown without all the traffic & congestion.

name: Comfortable  - and a great value!
description:
Large guest room in my home, where I also live. I have breakfast foods for nightly* guests to help themselves to. If 3 people share this room, one sleeps on the couch in the room.

*as opposed to weekly or monthly. Weekly and monthly guests are also welcome to help themselves to breakfast food their first of couple of days.
neighborhood_overview: I love the diversity of my neighborhood and its proximity to shopping and restaurants.  I live on a beautiful parkway.

host_about:
I am friendly and I love meeting people from all over the world.   I have received guests from over 33 different countries so far, in 14 years of being an Airbnb host.  I'm easy going and easy to get along with.  Staying with me can be like staying with a friend of a friend, in that I am glad to try to take care of your needs, and give you pointers about Denver, or also happy to leave you alone and grant you all the privacy you want (tell me.)  I have no pets, but occasionally I dog sit for my grandpuppy.  I speak French well, Spanish so so, and I remember a bit of German. 

As a traveler, I love to go places, stay a while, and interact with locals.  I love using Airbnb to travel and like to stay with hosts who also live in the property.  I enjoy just walking around, getting a feel for a city, trying its foods, meeting people and visiting museums (more than only just seeing the big tourist attractions.)  I think I am adaptable and an easy and appreciative guest.   I love to speak French, practice my Spanish and even try to resurrect my long-forgotten German.  I always like to try to learn to say at least please and thank you in the language of any place I visit.

name: private
description: This room is in the basement.  It does not have its own entrance, but is fairly private.   Please read the full room description (esp. hearing footsteps above.)  I want my guests to be happy and have no surprises.  Also, please have some info in your Airbnb profile.

name: Baker Studio: Private-full kitchen-W/D-walkable
description: Private studio with separate entrance in historic neighborhood. Great for a few nights or months! Less than 10 min to Denver Health Medical Center, downtown, Broncos Stadium, Ball Arena, Performing Arts, Coors Field.  Walkable to breweries, coffee shops, restaurants, SoBo, and Santa Fe Arts District.  One block to the Moss and two  blocks to the Space Gallery (wedding venues).  Easy access to major freeways and RTD.  Fast WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, easy street parking.
neighborhood_overview: Walking through the Baker historical neighborhood you will find a little bit of everything -- grand Victorian houses, quaint duplexes, small single-story homes, and newly-built condos.  It's an easy walk to restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, the shops and Mayan theater on Broadway, and the Santa Fe Arts District with gallery openings the first Friday of each month.

name: Alexandra's King Bed Room Long-term Only
description: Thank you for visiting my King Bed Room site! This room is upstairs in my home. The bathroom is immediately adjacent, and it is shared with host and the laundry room. King Bed Room guests have the option of adding a twin-size trundle bed for an additional $15 per night.  Guests have keys, so there is no curfew. Parking on the street is unrestricted for up to 72 hours by using parking permit (available for $20 deposit).
neighborhood_overview: I love my Uptown neighborhood, which is within 2 to 3 miles of just about everything there is to do in Central Denver. There are six nearby grocery stores, from the basic to the gourmet, in walking distance. There are a number of liquor and fine wine stores, multiple coffee shops and Internet cafes, Denver's many beautiful parks, and numbers of great and some renowned restaurants and eateries for breakfast, brunch, lunch, tea, dinner, and dessert. Churches, many beautiful and historical, abound, and many offer some of the most beautiful music and the most interesting services and dialogues around. Shopping opportunities, too, are many and varied, from the adjacent Downtown area, to nearby Cherry Creek Shopping Center and Cherry Creek North, to various outlet malls and stores further afield. Good antique and flea market venues are found throughout the Denver Metro area. Entertainment venues are close by. They include sports venues for the Denver Broncos, Nuggets, Outlaws, and Barbarians

Denver native, former teacher, musician, chaplain.  Spent 4 years in Bolivia and speak Spanish.  I love my home and its location so close to everything.  My neighborhood keeps growing upscale, but my home remains surprisingly quiet!  My single family home is a true oasis in the city. 

Seven wonderful grandchildren and their parents make my life a blessing. 

I have really enjoyed welcoming and getting to know my guests from all over the world and the USA, and look forward to many more!

name: LoHi Secret Garden at Mulberry at Denver Cottages
description:
Enjoy our oasis in the city and stay at one of the founding Airbnb rentals.
We love to enjoy the famous Colorado weather and believe in indoor & outdoor living. We are located next to downtown and in the revitalized neighborhood of lower highlands.
Short walks to coffee shops, restaurants & microbrews, dispensary, Bug Theater & downtown.
We are 420 (outdoors only), LBGTQ friendly, allergy-free, fragrance-free & pet-free. UVC w/ Ozone sterilization.
neighborhood_overview:
For those who are interested in our local brews - we are within walking distance to three new breweries as well as a short drive to several other breweries.

**We are in an up-and-coming neighborhood & construction going on everywhere around us as well as all-around in Denver. Please be advised that there can be building sounds sometimes.


there is some history behind the cottages -
they were built in the 1890s and used to belong to a horse and carriage business that shuttled workers down to Union Station. our neighborhood has always been a working-class neighborhood starting with the Italians and then has welcomed many other waves of immigrants.

The Lower Highlands district is a thriving area due to the of proximity and the number of attractions that you can walk or bike to.

Bike paths are plentiful and you could tour the whole city on them.
you can rent a bike with a swipe of your credit card- Denver has a bike renta

name: Midland Lofts 209: In the Heart of Downtown
description: This condo is right in the heart of Downtown Denver in the Central Business District. Just one block away is the 16th Street Mall with Free Shuttle and Denver Pavilions (shopping mall, movie theater, restaurants/bars, bowling alley, etc). Colorado Convention Center, Denver Center for the Performing Arts, shops, bars, clubs, and restaurants, and lightrail station are all within steps. There can't be enough said for the location! No need for a car but Uber/Lyft, scooters and e-bikes are near.

name: Treetop View Room East City Park 1-2 months
description:
Located in the desirable district neighborhood of east-central Denver, lovely views and quiet surroundings. City Park across 2 short blocks that includes Museum of Nature and Science & Zoo.
I share my home with an always sweet and friendly kitty who is hypoallergenic! Shiloh is a mix of Siberian and Maine Coon . View him in my photos.
neighborhood_overview:
It's a established older neighborhood with lots of character. Tree lined Parkways and boulevards featuring large homes with historical architecture.
It's own charming small business districts. Diverse culturally and has a feel of genuine community.

name: Highland Snug - Down
description:
The Highland Snug - Down is on the lower level of our condo at the center of Lower Highland (LoHi). It provides an excellent live/work environment, steps from the most exciting neighborhood in Denver. The Snug has a walk score of 90.

Additional rent options are as follows:

$87.75/day for 3+ months
$85.50/day for 6+ months
$83.25/day for 9+ months
$80.00/day for 12 months

$50/month additional for a cat and $100/month additional for a dog.
neighborhood_overview: The Lower Highland (LoHi) section of the Highland neighborhood lies just west of downtown Denver, next to Coors Field, Pepsi Center, Confluence park and the newly renovated Union Station transportation hub.  Many exciting and innovative restaurants are located in Highland, including Root Down, Dimestore Delibar, Linger, Maine Shack and Littleman Ice Cream.

name: Washington Park Stunning Townhouse
description:
Beautiful Townhouse located blocks to Washington Park (Wash Park) quick and easy access to downtown.



Easy walk to Light Rail, Whole foods and park. Amazing property with great deck with Mtn views. Attached Garage, interior is spectacular. Great place to get away in Denver and enjoy the park and the city.
neighborhood_overview:
ABOUT THE NEIGHBORHOOD/LOCATION:

- Its Wash Park – just look up wash park and Denver and you will get lot of information for this location.

- It is a premier location for the city, with great access to Denver’s most highly rated park, easy access to downtown and Cherry Creek.

- Restaurants, bars and other stores very close, but not close enough to affect noise or any level of inconvenience or crime.

TRANSPORTATION & PARKING:
- Light Rail is 3 blocks away and run’s directly downtown in less than 15 mins or to DTC in less than 15 mins.

- Walk (or run around) fabulous Wash Park – only blocks away

- Easy to get to the house from the airport, easy to locate.

- There is an attached 1.5 Car Garage in the bottom of the house, for 1 car. Additional parking is easy to find and free on the street.

- Very close to other great destinations, like Platt park, Sushi Den and other great restaurants, bars

name: Private room in the nest - w/bathroom
description: Private small room with own bath on the 2nd floor of a historic building in Baker. Walkable to 5 different coffee shops, shopping, theater, bars, galleries, ice cream, restaurants, distilleries & breweries. All the toast and jam you can eat. This is a cozy internationally influenced home in Denver with a long time Denver resident host. I am an entrepreneur, artist and traveler. I love meeting and hosting guests, but also can give you plenty of space. There is a large but sweet dog in the home.
neighborhood_overview:
The place is in Baker District, within walking distance is the Santa Fe Arts district and the south Broadway district.

The Santa Fe arts district to the west has 1st Friday events, many many galleries, several breweries and a few very good Mexican Restaurants, one of which has one of the best patios in Denver, El Noa Noa, and the other, El Tacos de Mexico, just won a James Beard award for classic places.

To the east is the South Broadway area which is filled with shopping, restaurants, bars, a vintage movie theater, ice cream, salons, Walgreens, a yoga studio, thrift stores, coffee shops, book stores & several breweries. Restaurants range from pizza by the slice, to a few notable dining establishments that won’t disappoint.

There is also a rec center 1 block away with a swimming pool, weight machines and basket ball courts that one can purchase limited use passes to. Across the street is a city park with a playground and basketball courts and lots

name: Private room In the heart of Denver
description:
Business License #: 2017-BFN-0005776 .

We LOVE our neighborhood. We live in an 1892 Victorian duplex in a historic neighborhood in Capitol Hill. We remodeled 20 years ago, so there's some old and some new. Our location is ideal if your activities are based in central Denver-you won't need a car if that's the case.
neighborhood_overview: We're close to Cheesman Park, Botanical Gardens and  to City Park (with zoo and Museum of Nature and Science and the Convention Center.  If you're  willing to walk a few more blocks you can also  access to Denver Art Museum, Kirkland Museum, Clifford Still Museum, the 16th Street Mall. You can sample at least 10 different restaurants/coffee shops within one block - and many more are within five blocks.

name: Creative Haven in Artist’s Abode
description: This two-bedroom, two-bath house is filled with treasures, trinkets, art, and oddities from around the world. Features a spacious front yard, patio, cozy corners, large kitchen, and unique curios from near and far. Curious adventure seekers and art aficionados will delight at this special space!
neighborhood_overview: The Clayton neighborhood is a rapidly changing area. A historically Black neighborhood of Denver, in the last decade the neighborhood has been experiencing significant gentrification. Many people in the Clayton area actively participate in neighborhood initiatives to help build relationships and engage in mutual aid efforts with our neighbors. For visitors to the neighborhood, a smile and a kind greeting can go a long way to connecting with folks you might encounter on your walk to the local coffee shop!

description:

Across the street is East High School and the brand new Denver Recreational Center with daily passes available.

We are located 2 blocks from DenverFilm Center Sie Theatre, Tattered Cover Bookstore, City Park, and several bars and restaurants.

Across from City Park is the Denver Museum of Nature and Science. Six blocks N are the Botanic Gardens, and a mile further is the Cherry Creek shopping district.

host_about:
I have been lucky to have traveled extensively, volunteered worldwide and because where you lay your head at night can be such an impactful part of your travels, I'm always looking for opportunities to create a welcoming and comfortable place, whether you are vacationing, stopping on your way through or working remotely.   

I grew up in the Midwest, lived in Chicago for several years, and now love the mountains as much as I love all my favorite destinations, from cities (San Francisco, Chicago, London) to mountain towns (Aspen, Crested Butte and Telluride) to international bucket list destinations (Mt. Kilimanjaro, Mombasa, Marrakesh).

I believe that travel is the key to understanding different people and different cultures, and I have learned that people are fabulous all over the world! 

Our goal is to make your experience feel tranquil, rejuvenating and special. Like you're home (but not!)  Feel free to follow me on IG: @vjarstad and on FB: Valerie Jarstad.

name: Cozy Central Loft -Walkable to Everything - 2BR
description:
Amazing location on a quiet street, yet a block away from shops, restaurants, and a large park. The loft is in a peaceful area of a busy neighborhood. Very central to all of Denver. Put away your car keys and explore this awesome little nook of the Mile High City.

Inside the place are hardwoods, high ceilings, and a cozy environment to relax. Inside the large bathroom there is a washer/dryer and great water pressure for showers. The kitchen is stocked for cooking, baking. Home away from home!
neighborhood_overview: This loft is at the edge of Denver. We are close to dozens of dining options; from an award winning cocktail bar to a ramen shop. We've got classy French cuisine and fancy beverages, and we've got a kid-friendly pizza restaurant. Nearby are breweries, wine bars, tapas and rooftop views. In town for sports event? Nearby: Broncos stadium, Coors Field for Rockies games, and the Pepsi events center are all super close.

name: Urban Retreat with Private Bath
description: Indulge in a room that is exceedingly comfortable, dreamy and private. The room with bath is in a stylish townhome in Denver's Lowry neighborhood. Guests share with the host use of the kitchen, laundry, patios and wireless Internet.
neighborhood_overview:
Developed in recent years on a former Air Force base, the Lowry neighborhood is a mixed-use community that retains many historic buildings. Sidewalks and pedestrian paths connect several parks. Spruce House, as I call the place, is located about a one-quarter-mile walk (or drive) from the town center, which includes restaurants, coffee houses, a grocery store, shops and other commercial outlets, as well as a bus stop. The Wings Over the Rockies museum is also nearby, as are a public library, post office and gyms. The Eating Recovery Center is just steps away.

Lowry is less than 10 minutes by car from the Cherry Creek shopping area and the United Airlines Flight Training Center, less than 15 minutes from the Anschutz medical campus, less than 20 minutes from downtown and approximately one-half hour from Denver International Airport.

Our house is in an upscale neighborhood, convenient location close to public transportation and off-street parking. the ceilings are low, so extra tall people (over 6'1") will be inconvenienced.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is upscale.  We live near the 17th Avenue parkway with mansions and lovely gardens.  A 1/2 mile away on East Colfax are entertainment venues, ethnic food, urban shopping and coffee houses. Its a 20 minute ride to downtown Denver where there is an array of urban excursions to be had. There is a gas station a block away, a drug store 2 blocks away and 2 large grocery stores 4 blocks away.

host_about:
My husband, Chris and I are empty nesters.  I am a landscape oil painter and a graphic designer and he is in logistics. I transplanted to Denver in 1979 from Bucks County PA and Chris moved here in 1984 from Buffalo NY. In our blended family we have four grown-up children and five wonderful grandchildren.  

We enjoy simple evenings, a card game with good friends, blues/rock music, great ethnic food and mountain drives / hikes. We don't drink or party at all anymore; just appreciate life, belly laughs, friends, family, each other and our spoiled puppy, Rufus.  

I am always busy working, socializing, hiking, painting, and cooking. We have simple taste and prefer road trips and staying at other Airbnbs, to tourist traps and luxury hotels. We watch a lot of football (we are Buffalo Bills fans) and hockey and are addicted to tv sagas on Netflix. I love art and come from a long line of artistic people.

Our motto is "One day at a time."

name: ZEN! Location! Cute,Quiet,nosmoking,CLEAN!
description:
**The community fee is for Wifi and linens. Guests who bring their own bed and bath linens will receive a $40 refund.
Our cozy and comfortable one bedroom apartment has a fireplace and air conditioning. It is bright and cool in the summer and warm in the winter. Located in Denver's top neighborhood, it is a 1.1 mile walk, bike, scoot or ride less than a mile to downtown and most all city attractions.

30 Night Minimum Required- No Exceptions
Maximum Vacancy between guests is 5 nights.
neighborhood_overview:
THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN DENVER: My house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood, with free parking. It is also a short 1 mile walk to the center of Downtown. There is no car needed for a full vacation with a huge variety of entertainment, food, parks... Walk out the front door and two doors down and you are at restaurant row. At your feet are seven restaurants and a casual bar. Within one block distance is Humboldt Farm Fish Table (a top-rated restaurant in Denver), 7-11, and Qdoba. Walk another block and you will find Starbucks, coffee shops, fast food, bars, restaurants, sushi, and shops.

Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights. We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Lincoln Park, and LoDo.

name: DENVER SUITE MOUNTAIN VIEW GREAT LOCATION
description: DENVER SUITE WITH A MOUNTAIN VIEW: live in the very heart of downtown and enjoy a beautiful and peaceful mountain view!  Fully furnished 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom suite with an open plan living/dining room furnished with contemporary leather furniture and original artwork.  Perfect for an extended stay for a small family or a business traveler.
neighborhood_overview:
IDEAL LOCATION: Walk out of this suite, take the elevator down, step through the lobby and you are THERE, truly in DOWNTOWN! The Performing Arts Center is just a half-block away. The Convention Center is just two blocks away as is historic Larimer Square, with all of its restaurants, cafes, bars, deli/coffee shops. On the corner is Sam's Diner, open early and late which offers up a true slice of city life and great people watching.

Everything else is an easy walk, including the Pepsi Center, Platte Valley, Union Station, the Denver Art Museum, the Clyfford Still Museum, Museum of Contemporary Art, Coors Field baseball stadium. Confluence Park (REI, river walk and kayaking) Elitch Gardens Theme Park as well as Tattered Cover bookstore and many other sporting and cultural attractions.

name: Private apt in Berkeley, MTN Views!
neighborhood_overview: Our homes are situated in the Berkeley neighborhood which is filled with beautiful parks,  lovely vistas, exceptionally outstanding restaurants and charming boutiques. This is a park like property with lots of room and every space on Airbnb has a private entrance,  bathing facilities and cooking facilities.   It is also very easy to access all the practical services from grocery stores to hairdressers  to cleaners to beauty treatments,  yoga and pet services. It is about 10 minutes by car to the downtown performing arts center and it takes just under an hour to reach the Loveland skiing/ snowboarding area ( which we love.) Convenience,  comfort and the charm of a small town all amazingly close to the delights of downtown Denver and wonders of the Rockies.

name: Suite of rooms in Capitol Hill
description:
CLOSE TO 3 HOSPITALS AND BEAUTIFUL CHEESMAN PARK!!!

This is a cute little suite of 2 rooms, one medium sized bedroom and a small attached alcove at the back. The rooms face south so there's lots of bright sunshine streaming in during the day, block out curtains at night. Cheesman Park and the Denver Botanical Garden are 1.5 blocks away. Fifteen blocks from downtown Denver, approximately 1.5 miles from Cherry Creek, 1 block from 2 major bus routes. Lots of shopping and nightlife nearby.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the heart of Capitol Hill.  The neighborhood was developed during the Victorian era, so the houses here are beautiful.  I love the old-growth trees and the lovingly tended gardens all throughout the neighborhood.  In addition, just about everything of interest in Denver is only minutes away, great restaurants and pubs, music venues, parks, libraries, museums and the Denver Botanic Garden.

name: Platt Park Urban Getaway: entire house, families!
description: Beautiful 3-story Bungalow in Platt Park, 5 blocks east of the S Pearl Street historic shopping district and 3 miles south of downtown (via car or RTD Lightrail train), 1.5 miles from Cherry Creek Shopping district, and an hour drive from mountains.  This listing is for the entire house + yard; this is NOT just a guest suite or basement space!
neighborhood_overview: The Platt Park neighborhood is one of the most popular in Denver because of its cozy residential feel that also offers a fun main street (S. Pearl St.) with shops, restaurants, coffee bars and a weekly farmers' market.  We are close to light rail stations, Denver University and Wash Park.  It's hard to find a neighborhood that offers the safety and comfort of a quiet residential area while being so centrally located and boasting easy access to the highway and downtown.  We absolutely LOVE living here, and you will love it too!

name: Spacious 1928 Bungalow near Sloan's Lake.
description:
This 1928 bungalow has 5 bedrooms, 2 full baths, 2 TV spaces, great outside patio with grill and gas fire pit and trampoline.

Room to socialize and to find privacy with 2400 sq ft. Easy access to I 25, and I 70, the Broncos Stadium, downtown, bike trails, Red Rocks, Sloans' Lake and the light rail. New Restaurants and breweries all walkable.

There is also space and 🛜 to work from “home”.

Off street parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is on the west side of Denver and is a rapidly changing neighborhood. Walkable to several new venues, restaurants, breweries, a public house and lake activities. Along with the basics of a supermarket and Target.
We have quick access to I-25 and I-70 and highway 6. Making access to Red Rocks, Blackhawk, the mountains, Broncos Stadium, and downtown very easy.
We are located 2 blocks north of the light rail, 2.5 blocks south of Sloans Lake.

host_about: Hello Future Guests! We love Denver and hope you will too. We have been providing our home for Airbnb guests for almost 8 years. We have been Superhosts for most of that time.  We are users of Aibnb when we travel and love staying in other wonderful homes.  We love hiking, swimming, biking, art, knowledge, and fun.   One of us likes decorating, especially with street art and one of us is very handing at fixing up our home. One of us likes sewing, quilting, jewelry making, and cooking. From San Diego to New York City, our grandchildren are the reason we have such a kid friendly home.  We have a labradoodle who sheds minimally and who travels with us.  Come stay with us and have a super vacation!

name: 2BR - West Highlands Sweet Retreat!
description: Our recently updated West Highland Sweet Retreat is just 2 blocks from Sprouts, 24 hour fitness and Tennyson Shopping District!   We have added a 55” Smart TV in the Living Room and each room also has TV’s with streaming capability!  This is the perfect location for visiting grandparents, family and friends!  Easy access to major highways and Downtown as well as major sporting events and concerts! Sorry, we are strictly non-smoking, non-partying, no pets.  We like to keep our neighbors happy!
neighborhood_overview: We love the diversity of the neighborhood, the abundant victorian homes that can still be found throughout adjoining neighborhoods, the proximity to cultural events, sporting events,  boutique shops, unique restaurants and being in a state where microbrews can be sampled at many of the nearby bars! Did we mention that skiing is only an hour away!

host_about:
My spirit dog was a Siberian Husky and my Native American animal guide is the Otter. That explains a lot! 

Five Indispensables: 
-- Family (four generations that include my three talented children who continue to amaze me and four beautiful grandchildren)
-- Community (culture friends, book club companions, skiing and hiking pals, work colleagues, Zumbuddies)
-- Learning (languages, history, technology)
-- Play (music, dance, tennis, travel)
-- Work (writing, teaching, demazing business conundrums)

Favorite Travel Destinations 
-- Rocky places (preferably vertical and/or volcanic): Iceland, Colorado, Ecuador, Peru, Sicily)
-- Architectural and art meccas: Florence, Monreale, Paris, Barcelona, Quito, Washington DC, San Francisco, Erice, Agrigento, Machu Picchu, Budapest, Prague, Riga
-- National Parks: RMNP, Bryce, Zion, Muir Woods, Point Reyes, Yosemite, Yellowstone, Tsitsikana, Mesa Verde, Lake Quinault

Life Mantra: "Just keep swimming . . . " (Thanks, Dory!)

Life Philosophy: (Thanks, William Blake)
"To see a World in a Grain of Sand,
And a Heaven in a Wildflower,
Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand,
And Eternity in an hour."

name: Cozy Creole Cottage by Sloan's Lake
description: Enjoy your stay in this eclectic 1890s cozy creole cottage 1/2 block off of Sloan's Lake and close to downtown Denver, light rail,  and bus route. This 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom cottage is 1200+ sq ft and completely remodeled and furnished with love. Enjoy a stroll around Sloan's Lake or explore quaint Edgewater and check out Joyride Brewery, US Thai, the Electric Cure and more. Highlands Square and the shops/restaurants on Tennyson are all within a mile or two! Easy access to public transportation.
neighborhood_overview: This location is ideal! You can enjoy the peace and quiet of a neighborhood within the city of Denver. The cottage is close to public transportation of any kind. You can catch a bus at either end of the street corner in to downtown and beyond. We are about 1 mile from the nearest Park-N-Ride and light rail. And, you can also walk to restaurants in Edgewater like Joyride, Edgewater Inn (good pizza), US Thai (best in town!) and Sloan’s Bar and Grill, O'Dell's Brewery (and rooftop) and The Patio on Sloan's Lake, and Edgewater Public Market (and so much more)! You are also close to 32nd/Lowell, which is the heart of the Highlands shopping and dining area, and within biking distance from LoHi, LoDo museums and other hip and well-known Denver neighborhoods. If coming from the airport you should expect anywhere from 30-45 minutes depending on time of day and exit I-70W on Sheridan Ave exit.

My hobbies include in no order: exercising, decorating, volunteering and mentoring, shopping, eating out at great (new and old) restaurants and being in nature. name: Beautiful Private Basement Suite near Downtown
description: Beautifully remodeled basement suite in lovely Victorian home in central Denver.
neighborhood_overview: Many historical homes with a beautiful park nearby. Tons of ethnic restaurants, museums, and places of interest within walking distance from our address. There are 4 breweries within a mile; another 6 breweries within 2 miles. Excellent music venues are close by; 2 (Fillmore and Ogden Theater) are a couple blocks away. Public transportation and bike rentals are convenient from our location.

name: Denver Washington Park Front Home
description:
Beautifully renovated 2,650 s/f home. Contemporary architecture with many skylights and right across the street from Denver's most popular park Washington Park.

We very close to Old South Gaylord St, DU/University of Denver, Cherry Creek Mall and shops. We are only about 3 miles from Old South Pearl St which has many shops and restaurants as well.
neighborhood_overview: Washington Park is where you take visitors when you’re trying to show Denver off. In a city full of green space—more than 270 at last count—Wash Park stands out as one of the largest and most beloved. It calls to both retirees who value walkability and active, young families who want to meet up with friends  while their kids explore the expansive central playground and then stroll back to their remodeled early 20th century Victorian homes, brick bungalows, or more opulent new builds. The neighborhood’s prime location, low crime rank, and high-scoring Steele Elementary School are big draws, as is its proximity to Historic South Gaylord Street.

I have lived all over the U.S. and in Japan for 4 years (in the Navy in the 80's), and have been in Denver for the past 25 years. My husband Dano is a Colorado native who lived in Hawaii for about 8 years.  We have two adult children and have had terrier dogs in the past.  We love to travel, explore, meet different people and learn new things.  We especially love the tropics and water sports.  My work background includes Accounting, Internet, Project Management & Real Estate.  

Dano has always been an entrepreneur and started the first windsurfing school in Denver right after high school.  His work background includes Sales, Marketing and Business Development in the industries of Sports/Recreation, Internet & Graphic Design, Real Estate.  

Our favorite travel destinations so far are Hawaii, the Caribbean, California (Laguna beach, San Fran/Marin area), and Mexico (Cozumel, Tulum, Yucatan Peninsula).  Future plans are to visit Thailand, Japan, Aruba, Costa Rica and Australia.

name: European style pension, Cheesman Park
description:
WARM, WELCOMING VICTORIAN NEAR CHEESMAN PARK!

Check out this warm welcoming "home away from home" vibe, books, art, plants galore, the place has a European style pension feel. Comfy private room incl. work station w/shelves, pullout lower shelf, large screen monitor. 2 easy chairs, walk-in lit closet. Attached alcove to stretch out yoga mat.
Cool bars, restaurants, music venues, museums nearby. One block from fabulous Cheesman Park, 15 blocks to downtown Denver, 2 bus routes very close by,
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the heart of Capitol Hill.  The neighborhood was developed during the Victoria Era, so the properties here are beautiful.  I especially love the old-growth trees and the lovingly tended gardens all throughout the neighborhood.  Most importantly, just about everything of interest in Denver is only minutes away: downtown Denver and the Convention Center, great restaurants and pubs, music venues, parks, libraries, museums, it's all close by.

name: Peaceful Retreat in Congress Park
description: Make yourself comfortable in this beautifully appointed colonial style home in the heart of Congress Park.  Steps away from Denver's stunning Botanic Gardens, City Park, Congress Park, Cherry Creek North and National Jewish Hospital.
neighborhood_overview:
Congress Park is a quaint little neighborhood in the center of Denver. It's tree lined streets, neighborhood restaurants and cafes and it's proximity to several of Denver's beautiful parks and gorgeous parkways make it the ultimate walkable neighborhood.

Also close by is National Jewish Hospital which make this home great for people who are visiting this state of the art hospital.

name: Best Location HUGE 1 bedroom loft
description: Guests love this spacious 1-bedroom, 1.5 bathroom loft in the heart of Downtown Denver. Blending style and comfort, the space boasts 15-foot ceilings and extra large windows and unique décor. The location is one of the best in Denver—you’ll find convenience stores, restaurants, the Colorado Convention Center, bars, great shopping, coffee shops, and more within a 5-minute walk. Our charming space accommodates up to 4 guests with a queen bed and sleeper sofa.

A perfect getaway!

name: Skylight,No car needed,Cozy,quiet,no smoking,CLEAN
description:
This is a long term furnished rental with a flat rate pricing for 30 night minimum stays.

**Our Resort fee is for linens. The amount equals approximately $60 per month. The resort fee may be reimbursed if guest brings his own bedding and bath towels.
neighborhood_overview:
THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN DENVER: My house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood, with free parking. It is also a short 1 mile walk to the center of Downtown. There is no car needed for a full vacation with a huge variety of entertainment, food, parks... Walk out the front door and two doors down and you are at restaurant row. At your feet are three restaurants (Paxti Pizza, Next Door, Olive and Finch, Limon) and many others. Within one block distance is Humboldt Farm Fish Table (a top-rated restaurant in Denver), 7-11, and Qdoba. Walk another block and you will find Starbucks, coffee shops, fast food, bars, restaurants, sushi, and shops.

Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights. We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Lincoln Park, and LoDo.

name: Architect Owned Unique Retreat in the Art District
description:
This 2-bedroom retreat has been impeccably restored by a local female artist and architect, with the exposed brick walls offering a thoughtful reminder of the home's 19th-century origin.

The 580sf main level features a study nook with overhead storage, an open-concept living room with a cozy gas fireplace, and a small-but-mighty chef's kitchen equipped with brand new quartz countertops, a lovely organic lime wash backsplash, and high-end appliances.
neighborhood_overview:
This unique and welcoming brick home is in the Lincoln Park neighborhood in the eclectic Santa Fe Art District in Denver. The area is known for its brightly colored storefronts, fancifully painted alleyways, street art, diverse cultural scene, and abundant ethnic restaurants.

This space is co-hosted by local experiential hospitality startup The Sursy: the company behind the shoppable design and experience. Use #staysursy to share your stay and follow along!

neighborhood_overview:

description: Recently remodeled 2 bedroom, clean, garden level basement apartment in FANTASTIC location.  Less than one block off City Park and steps from the Denver Zoo, Denver Museum of Nature & Science, Denver Botanic Gardens, and several local coffee shops, bars, and restaurants (walk score=83). Live like a Denverite in the Bluebird District of City Park!
neighborhood_overview:
A distinctly urban neighborhood emerging from a colorful and gritty past, the Bluebird District is an eclectic business and entertainment district at the center of historic Colfax Avenue where edgy meets entrepreneurial and independent meets community.

Distinctly urban neighborhood: The neighborhoods on and along Colfax Avenue have seen struggles, and success, because of the dense urban mix inherent in their design. A diverse offering of housing uses and types, a mix of commercial offerings and operations and Colfax’s use as a primary transportation thoroughfare make it distinctly urban, and the Bluebird District is a microcosm of this.

The Bluebird District: The name “Bluebird District” has gained tremendous recognition since its inception a few years ago, after the historic Bluebird Theatre that anchors the district. Survey results confirm that the Bluebird District name has established itself as one of the most recognizable on Colfax, with nearly 70% of respond

name: Cozy Eastbridge Home walk to everything!
description: This new home is bright, light and open with all the modern conveniences. There is a brand new shopping/dining area just 4 blocks from the house with a high end King Soopers and three of the newly named "Top 25" Restaurants in the Denver area. It's just 20 minutes from downtown and the airport and surrounded by parks, trails, swimming pools, a rec. center, shopping and great restaurants. The new Stanley Marketplace is just over a mile away!
neighborhood_overview:
Just across the street, we have Bluff Lake Nature Center. Early morning walks (there is a mile dirt path around it (no bikes)) are awesome. There are beautiful birds everywhere, deer, foxes, even bald eagles in the winter. The Sand Creek trail heads NW and SE from there and you can connect it with trails to go all around the city of denver.
About 4 blocks west is one of our neighborhood's pools. You will have to buy a day pass. This summer, there will be 5 pools to chose from in the hood. A half mile from the house is the Central Park Recreation Center with a large indoor pool and workout room and cardio equipment that looks out over Stapelton's Central Park and west to the mountains. There are bike/walking trails everywhere and a 2 1/2 mile walk/ride takes you to our town center with restaurants, groceries, bars, etc. I can get downton in 15 minutes on Martin Luther King Blvd and the same to the airport via 1-70. Stapleton is a fantastic location to see all that Denver has to off

host_about:
I have been living in Denver for the past ten years. After growing up outside of Philadelphia, spending 8 years in Maine and living all over the west (MT, AK, ID), Denver has become a great place to call home. The Stapleton community is a great balance between city and suburbs. We have great restaurants and trails for biking, walking and running are everywhere. The sand creek trail is right across the street from my house and you can run, walk, bike all the way downtown to REI and beyond on it. 
I love the outdoors and Denver is very conducive to an outdoor focused lifestyle. I spend half of my time in a tiny town of 450 people in Creede, Colorado. I enjoy running and mountain biking the trails around Creede as well as floating on the Rio Grande River.

name: Historic 1800s townhouse @ downtown by Superhost
description:
Perfect for REMOTE WORK and long stays while visiting the Mile High City & the Rockies. Travel Nurse? Walking distance from DENVER HEALTH & close to downtown.

Located in the beautiful Baker Historic Neighborhood, this 2-bedroom 1897 historic townhome is right for you. Recently installed bedroom hardwood floors & new TempurPedic queen topper.
It counts w/CENTRAL AIR, back patio, Weber gas grill, high-efficiency washer & dryer, AND 8 craft breweries + a whisky distillery within a 1-mile radius!
neighborhood_overview:
In summary, my neighborhood's uniqueness is location, location, location! A close second, it's history and type of architecture.

The Baker neighborhood is a diverse, dynamic neighborhood located in the urban core of Denver, Colorado. First plotted and developed in the 1870s, Baker has played a central role in the history of Denver. Today Baker enjoys a number of qualities and characteristics that make it a vibrant urban neighborhood including a diverse urban population, preserved historic homes, proximity to Broadway’s Main Street development which promises diverse shopping, casual and fine dining, and an array of entertainment, as well as access to mass transit.

Colorado is known for its breweries, there are a lot of breweries within a 1-mile radius, easy walking/biking distance; Black Sky Brewery & Pizzeria (0.3 mi), Banded Oak Brewing (0.5 mi), Novel Strand Brewing Co. (0.5 mi), Crazy Mountain Brewery (0.5 mi), Bære Brewing (0.5 mi), TVRE Brewing (0.6 mi), Next

I am a communications professional and business owner that with the help of my valuable co-host and fiancee Kathryn will do our best to make your stay memorable.

I love this state mostly because there is always something to do! I mean, you cannot beat our beautiful backyard called the Rockies. name: Sloan's Lake Highlands Bungalow

Petite and thoughtfully appointed, 2 blocks from Sloan's Lake & around the corner from coffee, bagels, dry cleaners, liquor store and brewery.  It is a fifteen minute walk to the shops and restaurants of downtown Highlands. 10 minute drive or bus to downtown Denver.  All the amenities, including 2 adult bicycles--just come and enjoy!

Sloan's Lake is 2 blocks to the South and is a lovely 2.8 miles walk or bike ride (2 bikes included.)

name: Classic Home on Capitol Hill
description:
953 Clarkson is a classic Denver Square home built in 1904 located conveniently in the heart of Capitol Hill, Denver. The home has been upgraded over the years to provide a modern feel while still preserving the historic characteristics. Centrally located, everything you need is within walking distance. We hope you choose to stay in Denver at our comfortable home away from home!

**30-day Stay for $4,800** -- message if interested.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is one of the oldest in Denver and a great location to everything that the city has to offer! You will be blocks away from a King Soopers and Safeway for groceries, multiple liquor stores, great restaurants, coffee shops, and bars. Our favorite place to go is Cheeseman Park and we highly recommend visiting it! If you walk from the house and around the outer loop, it is approximately a 2.5 mile walk. You can easily Uber downtown but if you're wanting some exercise, it's approximately a 30-40 minute walk. We love being central to all areas of Denver (Cherry Creek, Downtown, Historic Baker District, LoHi, and the Highlands). You can easily get around to any of these areas withing 10-15 minutes driving!

description: This cool, comfortable 1BD on second floor of historic carriage house is centrally located a short walk/bike to downtown, uptown, City Park, Lodo, and hospitals. name: Modern 3bd/3bath Home, walk to RiNo Arts District
description: This vibrant new Victorian has a modern dwell feel. Daylight is abundant with tall ceilings, bamboo floors, plants and lots of local art. The house is close to all that RiNo Arts District has to offer, 1 mile to St Luke's hospital, and just 1.5 miles from downtown. Enjoy your coffee on the front patio in Aculupulco chairs, and open the patio doors to head out back to the fire pit and gas grill. Working remotely? The third bedroom has a desk creating an ideal remote work environment. No parties.
neighborhood_overview:
The Whittier neighborhood is a great residential area full of charm, which I love for the incredible diversity of people, homes, and history. The neighborhood is a mixture of all types of housing from luxurious historic homes to Section 8 housing to everything in between. Kids skateboard in the cul-de-sac, families walk to school, and dog walkers are common en route to the Fuller Dog Park (2 blocks). Several neighbors spend the better part of the day on their front porches - most folks are friendly and the neighborhood feel is palpable.

In the midst of the 5-Points Historical Cultural District, we are walking distance from many parks. In fact, there is one only two houses down. Within a ten minute walk you can pick up a bike at B-cycle and get to downtown within minutes, as well as the River North Arts District (RiNo) which has several good coffee shops, microbreweries, winery and restaurants. Not to mention City Park, the Denver Zoo, Natural History Museum, LoDo, Curtis Pa

West Highlands is a trendy, city-center neighborhood making it a perfect spot to settle into for a stay exploring our great city of Denver and nearby Tennyson St. and Sloan's Lake.

name: Mod Downtown Perfection, 3BD w/ Patio, Fast WIFI
description: Work, play and soak up local culture at this 3-bedroom renovated home in Denver’s Art District on Santa Fe. The mountains are less than an hour away, and you can get Downtown in 10 minutes by car or about 20 minutes on foot. You’ll also enjoy strolling to restaurants, coffee shops and rock star breweries. Whip up meals in the huge, updated kitchen and stream your fave content on the 48-inch Smart TV. This is your home base for exploring the Mile High City and the magnificent Rocky Mountains!
neighborhood_overview:
This is one of Denver’s most vibrant neighborhoods! When you’re not out exploring, there is so much to see within walking distance of the house. Stroll to Sunken Gardens Park and Alma-Lincoln Park. Renegade Brewing Company, a popular local microbrewery, is a 5-minute walk away. Looking for a fun and unusual diversion in the area? The Escapist, an escape room center, is within walking distance. Experience a Denver institution at the historic Buckhorn Exchange Restaurant. Grab your breakfast at Swift’s, a classic diner in the Art District on Santa Fe. We like to get our caffeine fix at Joe Maxx Coffee Co, which is in the same area. You can also tour Stranahan’s Whiskey, Colorado’s first home-grown whiskey company.

The Art District on Santa Fe is one of Colorado's designated Creative Districts, with more than 30 art galleries, studios and innovative businesses. The neighborhood's roots are evident around every corner, from colorful murals and the exhibitions at Museo de las Ame

name: Relax in Denver's Best Neighborhood Platt Park!
description: If you are staying July 23 to July 27th I have lowered the price of the property to 150.00$. Email me for details.   Stay close to downtown. This property is in south-central Denver and is close to Downtown, and is 20 minutes from Dicks Sporting Goods Park and Red Rocks. This is a family-friendly home.  This neighborhood is the best in Denver for nightlife and activities.  I live in a quiet area, if you are looking for a party house this is not the rental that you are looking for.
neighborhood_overview:
The Neighborhood: Platt Park
At the turn of the 20th century, the Platt Park neighborhood—then a separate city from Denver—was a bustling borough of five-and-dime shops and sprawling family homes connected to the city by a clanking trolley line that ran up Pearl Street. As the Mile High City grew, the neighborhood was incorporated, and Denverites migrated south to make it their home. Today, the neighborhood’s storied history is still visible on Pearl Street, where visitors can glimpse trolley tracks peeking through the asphalt overlay, and new shops and purveyors occupy the original, historic buildings.


Platt Park is a pedestrian friendly neighborhood. One block from Antique Row on Broadway with bars and retail. 5 blocks from South Pearl St.

name: Modern Guest House in Berkeley Lake
description: Just a few blocks away from great restaurants, bars, shops, parks and even a lake, this airy, well appointed guest cottage is a cozy spot to enjoy our amazing city and neighborhood. Come visit the mile high city and relax at night in our quiet urban casita. With easy access to I-70, this is also a great jumping off place to explore the mountains.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is great. And only getting better! It's set out far enough from downtown that driving and parking isn't an issue, but it's still only a 10 min ride/cab ride to all downtown has to offer. It has it's own vibrant shop/restaurant district called Tennyson st with great coffee shops, tons of restaurants--and more opening every month. Sprouts grocery store that is a 5 minute walk from the house. We also have a beautiful lake and park a couple blocks away that offers great views of the mountains and a nice path if you want to go for a run. We are located only 5 minutes off I-70 so it's nearly a straight shot to get up into the mountains.
In the summer, you can walk from the house to Lakeside Amusement Park, one of the old-style amusement parks with wooden roller coasters where you pay per ride for a fun, nostalgic afternoon.

name: Full of Character AND Comfortable !
description: This private 800 sq ft apartment is on the first floor of my home which was built in 1897. While its history can be seen in the exposed brick, cast iron tub and ornate woodwork, the space has been modernized to ensure your comfort during your stay.  WiFi, TV with Chromecast and movies, and other modern amenities will make your stay comfortable and like your own home!
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is walking distance to a historic music venue (Bluebird Theater), several bars (Atomic Cowboy, PS Lounge, Goosetown Tavern, Cerebral Brewing and others), great dining (Stella's, Billie's Inn, Blue Pan Pizza, Sully's Pizza and Denver Biscuit Company), as well as an eclectic Coffee Shop (Hooked On Colfax).

There is a full grocery store (Sprouts) 4 blocks from the house.

A great book store (Tattered Cover) is a 5 min walk away.

MEOW WOLF - check it out online a must see.

City Park, Denver Zoo and the Denver Museum of Science and Nature are about a ten minute walk - and the Denver Botanical Gardens is a quick 20 minute walk through beautiful neighborhoods.

All this, of course if you limit yourself to our neighborhood - hop the Colfax Bus and see what Denver has to offer!

Downtown/LODO, RiNo 5 minutes away, Highlands 10 minutes away , explore all the neighborhoods. Leave the car at the airport - it is super

host_about:
Originally from Massachusetts, I moved to Colorado to work as a paramedic/firefighter.  That was 24 years ago,  and I definitely consider Colorado my home.  I am now retired from the fire service.

I enjoy the diverse music scene here in Denver, and the natural beauty of Red Rocks never ceases to amaze me.   I also have a love for the beautiful outdoors and the outrageous skiing that is nestled up in the mountains outside of Denver.

Burning man is an important part of my life (19 years out to the desert!) and members of my family here and worldwide are Burners, contributing a wonderfully eclectic vibe to my world.

I also live on the property and love this little niche of Denver - I am happy to share our vibrant neighborhood with you and am excited to host you for your stay here while you explore lovely Denver!

Welcome home!

description: Enjoy your stay in a quiet, clean and modern condo in the heart of Capital Hill.  Close to concert venues, eateries/bars, parks, and Whole Foods, and the Botanic Gardens.  Ideal for business travelers, extended stays or someone wanting to test out Capital Hill living!

And the Cherry Creek bike path is easy to reach if you bike south on Corona St.

name: WIN! Best location,Quiet*Balcony,nosmoking,CLEAN!
description:
This apartment is in the best Denver Location with Private Balcony that overlooks the neighborhood! Located 1.1 miles from Downtown, walk, bike or ride. Seven eateries to choose from just two doors down, plus much more. Enjoy our plush bed or relax with a good movie or book. Walk Score 94! Bike Score 100!

** Don’t need bed & bath linens? Let us know ahead of check-in, & we will give you a $40 linen fee refund.
neighborhood_overview:
Uptown and City Park West are the Perfect Locations for experiencing all the Denver has to offer! This house is very close to everything in downtown Denver. Great value for the location. The walk score is 94 and the bike score is 100! B-cycle rentals are across the street. Walk out the front door and two doors down and you are at restaurant row. At your feet are seven great restaurants and a casual bar, Olive and Finch Bakery, 7-11, and Qdoba. Walk another block and you will find Starbucks, Einstein Bagels, coffee shops, fast food, bars, restaurants, and shops.
Bike rentals are available across the street and all over the city through Denver's state-of-the-art B-Cycle program. Walk a quarters of a mile to 16th Street Mall shopping, lower downtown Denver nightlife, cultural centers, a mile to the Colorado Convention Center and one and a half miles to the Pepsi Center. Short/cheap cab ride to everything. Street parking only. No pets and No smoking is allowed on the property.

name: House in front of Washington Park

The location of the house is just a 5-10 minute drive from Cherry Creek mall, Rino, Lodo, Downtown and other entertainment areas. Enjoy a breakfast and coffee at Wash Perk cafe which is just a 5 min walk. End the day with our new Hot Tub!

Place is great for solo travelers, couples or small families.

name: Denver's Santa Fe Arts District
description: This small home is a block from the heart of Denver's Santa Fe Arts District. Less than a Mile from downtown and the Convention Center.
neighborhood_overview:
One of the coolest and most conveniently located neighborhoods in Denver, this house is right off 6th and I-25, yet far enough from traffic to be quiet and homey.
The Santa Fe Arts District isn't as polished and gentrified as many other neighborhoods in Denver. No big chains and fast-food restaurants on Santa Fe or South Broadway, but plenty of breweries, restaurants, theatres, and more!
One caveat, the neighbors on both sides are musicians. I've never had any noise complaints from tenants, but want to warn those who may be light sleepers or sensitive to noise, this Art District home may not be right for you (especially on the first friday of the month).

name: RiNo Art, King tempurpedic, yard, 95 walk score
description:
Rare, quiet, street level, and comfortable one-bedroom with exposed brick and private back yard directly ON Larimer, the heart of the Amazingly Walkable River North (RiNo) Art District.

The house is 5 blocks from the airport train (“38th and Blake” stop). Our house has a 95 walk score and 99 bike score (lyft and lime bikes and scooters) so you don’t really need a car unless you’re driving to the mountains.
neighborhood_overview:
RiNo or River north is an amazing neighborhood which was formally an industrial warehouse district. It is filled with art galleries, studios and other creatives... it is known for it's graffiti art festival with murals visible all year round.

17+ craft breweries, distilleries, cideries and wineries in one-square-mile, Check out the “Drink RiNo” list. Within 2 blocks of the house 7 restaurants, 6 Microbreweries, a Winery, a Distillery, a recreational MJ Dispensary, and Curtis Park. Foodies search: "Where to Dine in the Hot RiNo Neighborhood".

name: Urban Nest in heart of Denver
description: Newly remodeled, charming yet modern, 1 bedroom beautifully bright basement apartment w/ exposed brick in a fantastic location. Includes  an oasis-like courtyard, hot tub, grill, & bikes. Walking distance to parks, Botanic Gardens, coffee shops, & restaurants! Furbabies are welcome!  Ideal for 2, comfortable for 3. No smoking inside/outside, including the courtyard. E-Vaping & edibles are encouraged! Private/separate basement unit and the owner lives upstairs. Only the back door is shared.
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the oldest neighborhoods of Denver. All the houses have character and charm. It is fun just to go for a walk. We live just a block from many great restaurants, and our go- to coffee shop "St Marks". There are restaurants all along 17th street! Just 5 blocks from both - City Park and Cheeseman Park, where we love to take the dogs, go for a run, rent a bike or paddle boat for an hour or so, or picnic on a summer sunday night to listen to live music. The Zoo and Botanic Gardens are in walking distance. During the summer months the Botanic Gardens hosts amazing, intimate concerts in their outdoor amphitheater. If you're here during this time you should check out their calendar. There are several other concert venues in close proximity, too. Less then a 10 minute commute to both Downtown Denver and Cherry Creek North or Cherry Creek Mall. Close to several other old town neighborhoods with small shops and tons of restaurants.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: Historic Capitol Hill Mansion
description: This private bedroom and bath is on the second floor of a historic mansion in Capitol Hill in Denver.  Located 2 blocks from the Molly Brown House, 4 blocks from the Denver Art Museum, 20 minute walk to downtown Denver. and the Convention Center.  The mansion is on the Historic Denver walking ghost tour. I am committed to a high level of cleaning for your comfort and safety.
neighborhood_overview: This the historic Molly Brown and Capitol Hill neighborhood.  My "mansion" is the south mansion of the complex, built in 1890 by Mr. Guillilly who was, at the time, the treasurer for the Denver Rio Grande Railroad.  There is a large courtyard with gardens that I have been personally tending to for five years.  The neighborhood is eclectic and safe. The walkability index is 10+. My Denver Art Museum and Botanic Gardens membership are available to my guests.

name: Bright Cap Hill Apt w/parking and free laundry.
description: I have a cute one bedroom apartment right in the heart of Capitol Hill. This is a vibrant neighborhood, blocks from the Capitol Building, 0.7 miles from the top of the free bus on 16th st, and blocks from the restaurants in uptown on 17th. Walkscore 93
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Denver, staying in historic Capitol Hill is the place to be. This neighborhood is completely walkable and loaded with beautiful old homes, fun bars, and great restaurants. You’ll be three blocks from the “restaurant row” on 17th, half a block from argonaut liquor store and natural grocer, plus just four blocks from the art museum. Within half a block you’ll find Jelly, one of Denver’s favorite breakfast establishments. Grab coffee or a cocktail at Hudson Hill, also half a block away, and then stroll over to a concert at the Fillmore auditorium. The Capitol building is four blocks away and you can see the golden dome as you walk near the condo. Enjoy Denver by living like a local.

name: Cozy 1BD-parking, yard, laundry
description: Mother-in-law suite with off-street parking and separate entrance. Full kitchen, dishwasher, stove and oven. Enjoy the patio, walk to the bars and restaurants in my neighborhood, or drive 10 minutes to downtown.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is perfect for someone who wants to be close to the city, but not have to worry about noise, traffic, or parking. There's plenty of walkable shops, bars, and restaurants. The best part is there are two grocery stores and a liquor store just 1 block away.
My house is 15 minutes from downtown, and 30 minutes from the airport, in a residential neighborhood called Montclair. There are some excellent coffee shops, restaurants, and bars within walking distance. 2 grocery stores are just a block away. There's a park a few blocks south of me with a playground for those of you with kids.
**Check out my "guidebook" for my recommended restaurants/bars/cafes!

name: Cozy Carriage Home Sante Fe Style!
description:
We are a long term rental FYI
This is a perfect space for a light-weight traveler interested in a cute place to come home to each evening, with all the basic conveniences. It's in a very cool urban neighborhood with lots to offer to foodies, creatives, art galleries and adventurers.
This studio carriage home is not a shared space and it is completely an independent unit from the main structure. Separate and private entrance. Great work space with Internet speeds over 100 mbps Xfinity service!

We are from Chicago and we enjoy the mild winters in Colorado and all the outdoor activities this state has to offer. Come and experience it yourself.  We enjoy this private coach studio we are sure you will too! 

We love deep dish pizza so we occasionally go back to Chicago to make our frequent favorite pizza stops.

We both love to ride the bicycle!

We are frequent runners and enjoy running in Washington Park. We totally recommend this park.

We are big fans of Renegade Brewery!

We recommend the First Friday of every on month on Sante Fe!

Enjoy yourself and contact us if you have any questions.

Thanks

Edwin

name: Historic Condo, Excellent Amenities
description: Welcome to my beautiful and historic condo in uptown Denver. I take a lot of pride in creating an excellent experience for my guests. Read on to find out why I think this is one of the best places to stay in the beautiful Mile High City!
neighborhood_overview:
Uptown is the best of everything Denver has to offer. A short walk away, you can experience all the best Denver has to offer: from the 16th Street Mall in Downtown Denver, to the modern cuisine of 17th Ave, and the divey, historic bars of Colfax Ave, once known as the "Longest, wickedest street in America" where the spirit of Neal Cassady (who grew up less than a mile from here) lives on in full.

Within a 2 block radius, you will find 2 grocery stores, a wine shop, coffee, liquor stores, top-rated restaurants, and a huge variety of bars. With a walk score of 92 and a bike score of 98, the numbers really speak for themselves!

name: Private Suite on Beautiful Wooded Street
description:
My house is located in the beautiful neighborhood of Park Hill, with many trees and sidewalks. Shops and restaurants in walking distance. Bus stop 1 1/2 blocks with short ride to downtown.

Suite is in the lower level of house with private entry from my garden.

Suite has private bedroom with queen bed and bath with over-sized tub/shower; along with a comfy family room. In front of the family room is the kitchenette, refrigerator, coffee maker, all in one toaster/air flyer, and washer/dryer.
neighborhood_overview:
Walk-able neighborhood, with local amenities

Within 2 blocks:
Oblio's Pizzeria and salads
Neighbors Wine Bar: full bar and food
Bistro Vendome: upscale dining
Cake Crumbs: pastries, cupcakes, sandwiches
Lucina: Italian, happy hour

1/2 mile: walking distance
Illegal Pete's
Torpedo Coffee
Esters
Famous Philly Cheese Steak & Wings
Dang's Ice Cream

2 miles east of Nature and Science Museum, Denver Zoo, and City Park

4-5 miles directly east of downtown Denver. Easily accessible via RTD bus #20, Lyft or Uber.

host_about:
I'm a retired teacher librarian at a public EC-8 school in metro Denver.  I have 2 grown sons who also live in Denver.  One is a software engineer and one is an attorney.  

I love living in a busy urban part of the city.  Art museums, Botanic Gardens, and little music spots.  I love drinking coffee or glass of wine on our back patio.

Denver is a great place to live.  Sharing it with visitors is something I really enjoy.

name: ★ Penthouse ★Balcony★ Chef's Kitch ★ Garage
description:
• Walk Score 85 (½ block to Denver's best restaurants, shopping, bars)
• Watch the sunset from the balcony w skyline views
• Ride bikes to parks or Farmers Market! Bike Score 98 ('Biker's Paradise')
• Whip up a delish meal in the chef's kitchen
• Transit Score 87 ('Excellent Transit')
• Garage parking (limited to normal sized cars, without tall roof racks)
• Safe, vibrant neighborhood
• Radiant floor heat
neighborhood_overview: A few short steps to one of Denver's noteworthy "Restaurant Row's", including Steuben's, Coperta, D-Bar, Park & Co, Humboldt,  Revival, and Watercourse Foods. Also, a first class cannabis dispensary, LivWell, is ½ block away.

I’m Allan, most people call me “AP.” I’ve lived in Colorado for the majority of my adult life and I love this state! I’m really interested in what intrigues you about Colorado and where you have been, so don’t hesitate to let me know. I’m listening!

Feel free to book or message me to ask about Colorado or the apartment, I’m happy to answer questions in advance, and encourage you to be curious.

I am a fairly well traveled Airbnb guest who knows what a host should do to create a comfortable guest experience. My favorite countries visited: Vietnam, Sweden, Italy and Thailand.

name: Lovely West Wash Park Guest House
description: This impeccably remodeled 1930's charmer is located in one of Denver's most coveted neighborhoods, Wash Park West.  Awesome location, $5 Uber to Downtown, the Convention Center, Cherry Creek - Walking distance to Wash Park (Denver's most popular park) and the Cherry Creek bike trail. Walking distance to some of Denver's best restaurants and coffee shops.  Thoughtful touches, modern, yet timeless, decor, high ceilings, light & bright. Includes Central Air Conditioning, full kitchen, washer/dryer!
neighborhood_overview:
The Vibe: Local spots where urbanites and nearby residents—mostly 20- and 30-something renters, young-families, and homeowners—hang; foodies visiting the hood’s rich and varied selection of eateries; joggers finishing their loop at the adjacent Wash Park.

Grub: Head to the French-inspired Vert Kitchen for homemade sandwiches (try the curried chicken), or a fast-casual brunch. (Or not so casual: They also sell bottles of champagne.) For Greek food—a genre that’s a little sparse in Denver—Pete’s Central One is a mainstay. Wash Park West is also a great destination for Asian cuisine, and Thai Basil, although a chain, serves up the best green curry in that neighborhood. Next door, Fontana Sushi rolls up creative specials, like the Spiderman, which adds extra crab, spicy mayo, and eel sauce to the already scrumptious Spider roll.

name: Denver Highlands - Mini Mansion: A+ Location

Close to everything. Located in the middle of the desirable Highlands and LoHi neighborhoods. This spacious home is near downtown, in the heart of the Highlands district. It's an ideal space for families, large groups, retreats or business travel. Enjoy the park across the street or walk to many bars, shops or restaurants.

Sleep 13 comfortably
neighborhood_overview:
I love my neighborhood. The house is located directly across from an awesome park and library. Electric scooters and bikes are nearby for rent to take you downtown. Located in the heart of Highlands district around the corner from 32nd and Lowell restaurants, bars and shops. Also it's only a few more minute walk to LoHi restaurants and bars! Great access to Golden, Wheat Ridge, Arvada, and Boulder is only 30 minutes away.

name: Cozy, Private, Spacious Bedroom and Bathroom
description: Whether in town for the weekend, a week, or all month long, this space has all you need for a great Denver experience. In a very walk-able neighborhood that is only a few minute bus ride into downtown, you'll find restaurants, bars and coffee shops available right outside the front door. This listing also features a comfortable, enclosed, 420-friendly patio.
neighborhood_overview: You won't lack welcoming local opportunities or refreshments here, with quality restaurants, coffee shops, and bars right outside the front door. Lyft and Uber are also popular services if you'd like a ride anywhere with no need for maps or parking fees.

name: Rock House in Berkeley neighborhood of Denver
description: Located in the Upper Berkeley neighborhood, a bohemian pocket of urban homes with its own commercial district, 9 minutes from Downtown. Private. Once inside the fenced compound, you find festival lighted patios, and a place to relax. High ceilings, skylights, hardwood floors, tons of windows & an eclectic bohemian decor exudes a cool calm. The house and it's compound create smiles and laughter & confirm you picked the right spot.
neighborhood_overview:
Denver, Colorado, United States
The Rock House is in the best location of Denver for your purposes and for the locals that live here. It sits perfectly between two of the best parks in Denver - Rocky Mountain Park and Berkeley Park. Jog, fish, walk, tennis, baseball, events, etc. All this within walking distance of the house.

Downtown is a short 10-minute ride from the property so short you feel you are practically downtown but minus the riff-raff and concrete. Lower Downtown which boasts Coors Field home of the Rockies, Pepsi Center home of the Avalanche and Nuggets, convention center, theater district, Union Station, and many spectacular restaurants/pubs/shopping and more. Typically we all as tourists believe downtown is where it's at when we start our exploration of places new to us. For the most part this is true in Denver, but not entirely. Denver is made up of many unique and eclectic neighborhoods that all have their own flavor and reasons for existence as well a

name: Modern Townhouse in Downtown with Private Balcony
description:
Experience the best of urban living in our contemporary two-story townhouse, nestled in the historic Five Points neighborhood of Denver. Our spacious 1365 sq. ft home boasts a private balcony with city views, providing the ideal spot to unwind and relax.

name: Spacious, bright and beautiful home in RiNo
description: Enjoy the spacious luxury of our contemporary,  renovated 1886 home. Perfect for couples, business travelers, and small families. Located in the popular Curtis Park/RiNo area- home to breweries, good food, good drinks, coffee shops. Central area in Denver-easy access to major highways, 10 min Coors Field and Mission Ballroom, 25 min to Red Rocks .
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the historic Five Points/Curtis Park/RiNo, our home is ideally located for easy access to most places in Denver. We are within easy walking distance to exceptional restaurants, crafted beer breweries, jazz bar, music, and the best coffee shops in Denver. Only 15 EASY WALKING blocks to downtown, 10 blocks to Coors field, 10 minutes (driving) to Denver Botanical Gardens, 5 minutes to Mission Ballroom, 1/2 hour to the airport - train station only 6 blocks away for easy access to airport and less than 5 minutes to access major highways (I-70 and I-25). Mountains nearby!

Our neighborhood is the oldest in Denver and it reflects this by the diversity of the people living here. It is home to different groups of people which is why we love it here.

name: Cozy Basement Suite near RiNo
description: Escape to a comfortable basement suite in our 1928 brick home. This urban oasis is centrally located in a residential neighborhood just northeast of downtown, near highways for traveling to the airport or mountains; and 5-10 minute driving distance from LoDo, RiNo, breweries, downtown, & other shopping, dining, & entertainment, City Park, Zoo, & Nature and Science museum. Private bathroom, free street parking, extras, large back yard and shared deck for relaxing and dining (weather permitting).
neighborhood_overview:
The Cole neighborhood is a historic residential neighborhood next door to the popular RiNo district, which is a mixed industrial arts district that has become a hub for craft breweries. You may notice construction in and around the neighborhoods as Denver is growing very rapidly and we have several big projects underway, including a highway expansion.

We are easy driving/biking distance to other neighborhoods, a lot of new restaurants, shops, art galleries, breweries, dispensaries, and music venues--notably the Mission Ballroom, which opened August 2019. Easily accessible via main streets and highways.

Many homes in our neighborhood were built in the early 1900s. The closest neighborhood bars you can walk to are Cohesion Brewery, NOLA, and Clove Pizzeria; the closest coffee shop is Rivers and Roads. Also nearby are the Whittier Cafe, Crema, and Prodigy.

For a nice walk, run, or bike ride, check out the new 39th Avenue Greenway just north of us. Walk

name: Charming Little 1890s Duplex in the Art District
description: Just relisted!!! My cute 1890s duplex home is located centrally, just a short walk from the Santa Fe Arts District and a quick ride to South Broadway or Downtown. neighborhood_overview:
My home is nestled between the oldest neighborhoods in Denver: Baker, Lincoln Park, and Sunken Gardens, perhaps more familiarly known as the neighborhood "Art District on Santa Fe." Most of the homes in the neighborhood are over 120 years old.

You are within walking distance to many art galleries and the First Friday art walk, Su Teatro, a dual-language group performing works written by Latinx playwrights. Also nearby on Santa Fe is the Museo de las Americas (9th Ave), El Taco De Mexico, El Noa Noa Mexican Restaurant (7th Ave), and the Molecule Effect for Coffee (12th Ave)

Some other well-known landmarks in Lincoln Park are Sunken Gardens Park, Lincoln Park, and Denver’s oldest restaurant, the Buckhorn Exchange: Serving up Steaks, Buffalo, Elk and the Old West since 1893. Need a vegetarian option? Try City O' City!There are a variety of restaurants on Broadway, the Golden Triangle and nearby Capitol Hill and West Washington park.

neighborhood_overview: The River North (RiNo) Art District is Denver's hottest new neighborhood!  Bordering just north of Lower Downtown (LoDo) Denver and Coors Field, this up-&-coming urban neighborhood is home to countless pieces of ever-changing neighborhood art, breweries, restaurants, art galleries, nightclubs, bars, and boutiques, with new venues opening every week!  Two of the top ten restaurants in Denver (Populist and Hop Alley) are within a block or two.  Imminently walkable and bikeable, this neighborhood is close to highways to the mountains, lower downtown, the Highlands, the Source indoor marketplace, Coors Field, Mile High Stadium, the Pepsi Center, the Convention Center, and 16th Street Mall.  Located within the Car2Go car sharing area and a B-cycle daily bicycle rental station is 3 blocks away.
