name: Hip Rino Basement Suite Near Downtown
description:
Select some vinyl to put on the record player and settle down by the fire for some retro entertainment. This remodeled 850-square-foot property comes with mid-century modern touches, and there's a shared backyard with BBQ grill.

Large kitchenette comes complete with microwave, toaster oven, single burner, large refrigerator, coffee maker, & all pots, pans, plates, utensils, etc. Head outside to the backyard and throw something on the grill for dinner.

Turn on the fan and open up the windows for a cool breeze on summer nights. Heat control in the winter.

Newly remodeled 850 sqft basement apartment, spacious and nice. The kitchenette has a fridge, toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, hot plate, sink, and all necessary plates, cups, bowls, silverware, etc. Please let us know if there is anything you need that you don't see!

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood of West Highlands is charming with lots to do all year round.

Eat & Drink

Highlands Square is the nucleus of commerce here. It’s where you’ll find a number of bars and a diverse array of cuisines, including El Camino Tavern (Mexican), Fire on the Mountain (chicken wings), Beau Thai, and Detroit-style Blue Pan Pizza. There are also myriad ways to support artisan purveyors, from the Sunday farmers’ market in the summer to St. Kilian’s Cheese Shop and Market to 48-year-old Seafood Landing fish market.

West 38th Avenue beckons with American Elm and Glo Noodle House.

Sweet tooths will be satiated at Sweet Cow Ice Cream or the Inventing Room Dessert Shop.

Thirsty? Highlands Cork and Café is a favorite among the work-from-anywhere crowd, and the European-inspired Café Zuri boasts mean brews and mouthwatering slices of walnut cake. Oasis Brewery’s patio is an ideal happy hour spot, and Three Dogs Tavern is a long-standing

name: Artists Retreat
description: Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway.
neighborhood_overview:
I love this neighborhood, it's old school Denver in a quickly-changing city. Just 1/2 mile away you can connect up to miles and miles of open-space running/walking trails.

Pablos Coffee is down a few blocks on Colfax and all the incredible food options close by due to the diversity of the neighborhood. Be sure to visit the Tattered Cover and Sie Film Center on Colfax and the Aurora Art District a few blocks to the East.

There's also tons of restaurants and shops less than a mile away at The Stanley Market Place.

🚗Be sure to read street sweeping signs if you're parking on the street from April-November!

name: Cozy apartment in a great central location
description:
This is a garden level apartment with plenty of light. The building has an awesome yard and is walking distance to the light rail and many of Denver's coolest spots.

It's walking distance to the hip Rino arts district and downtown, close to City Park with the history museum and zoo, and close to the highways to get to the mountains or other parts of the city.

There is a b-cycle station down the street to rent bikes and scooter sharing is always close by.
neighborhood_overview:
This is the historic 5 points neighborhood and adjacent to the Rino Arts district that is one of the hippest upcoming neighborhoods in Denver. It is blocks from the light rail to get around the city. City Park and Downtown are walking distance (roughly 2 miles to the center of downtown, but less than a half mile to many bar brewery and restaurant options).

Since this neighborhood was built in the late 1800s and early 1900s, there is a lot of great architecture throughout, so it is nice to just take a stroll around the neighborhood. With plenty of neighborhood restaurants and bars, you can always find a place to get some food or a drink as well.

Please feel free to ask for recommendations or more info about the neighborhood.

name: Denver's Urban Oasis + Hot Tub
description: Enjoy my stylish home in Jefferson Park, one of the coolest neighborhoods in Denver - steps from downtown, walking distance to Denver Broncos' Empower Field, nearby Meow Wolf, the Highlands, LoHi, and many of the city's best restaurants and attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
Jefferson Park is a fantastic neighborhood -- a safe one, with lots of history as well as brand new development. Within just a few blocks you'll find excellent bars and dining, including Araujo’s, Ros Siam Thai, Red Tops, Curry & Grill, Briar Commons, Chili Verde, Snarf's (and Snarfburger!), The Federal Bar & Grille, Jefferson Park Pub, Sweet Action Ice Cream, 2914 Coffee, and Sexy Pizza. It's a short walk to Broncos games at Empower Field. Great Denver attractions like Meow Wolf, the Downtown Aquarium, Children's Museum, and Jefferson and Confluence Parks are also easily reached on foot. There's a major grocery store (with one of the area’s cheaper gas stations) just two blocks away. Super easy access to I-25 and I-70, too!

Further afoot, a longer walk or fun bike ride gets you into downtown Denver, LoHi, the Highlands, West Highlands, Sloan's Lake, or the CU Denver/Metro State U campus.

name: King Suite/Private Bath. Near Downtown & RedRocks.
description: Ideal for travelers looking to enjoy Denver and the Colorado mountains in one visit. Downtown and mountain access without the downtown or mountain town prices! 5-10 minutes from Downtown, 20 minutes from Red Rocks, about an hour from Summit County. Perfect location for travelers seeking easy access to all our city and mountains have to offer. ***We have both been fully vaccinated for covid-19 and prefer our guests to be as well.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is very accessible. Our home is 8 blocks from the W train and a short distance from 6th avenue, perfect for travelers seeking easy access to both downtown and the mountains. Nearby 6th avenue will take you downtown in 10 minutes or less, to the foothills in 20 minutes and to Summit County in about an hour. Going to a game? You can take an taxi, ubur, lyft to Mile High Stadium or Coors Field for a fraction of what most people pay to park. We live very close to South Federal which has diverse and affordable restaurants in the city. New neighborhood brewpubs Hogshead, Seedstock, Wits End, Strange, Chain Reaction, Colorado Cider Company, Little Machine, Trve... to name just a few, are all within in minutes of our house. Barnum park, right down the street, has an awesome outdoor pool (Summer)
and gorgeous view of the Denver skyline. As our neighborhood is primarily residential there are not a variety of shops and restaurants within short walking distance. Our location

host_about:
Hello! I'm an avid volleyball player and play year-round. I moved to Denver from Redondo Beach, CA where I played beach doubles every weekend for 8 yrs. I guess you could say I traded the beach for the mountains. You wouldn't think there would be much volleyball in the Mile High State but there is! The mountains are so close that it was also easy to pick up snowboarding again. 

Denver is the first place I ever lived in which I truly felt home. I hope you feel the same when you step into my humble abode.

My other favorite thing to do - travel. I enjoy exploring new cultures and immersing myself in them. Best thing I've seen so far - Northern Lights in Iceland and Alaska not to mention aerial trip to Denali! I'll send you some pics of them if you like :)

I worked in hospitality for a large hotel chain for 14 years and have applied the knowledge and hotel standards to my Airbnb. I hope your experience in my home meets or exceeds expectations.

name: Cozy Central Denver Suite with Private Entrance
description:
We invite you to our contemporary basement suite in our centrally located historic Denver home. With a private side entrance and full bathroom, you'll have the space to yourself. The location provides easy and quick access to all areas of Denver. Our Business Tax ID # 343466.

Now outfitted with a new mattress as of Sept 2021!

We are practicing all recommended Airbnb cleaning guidelines. We also provide cleaning products in the suite for your use if desired.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the Congress Park neighborhood in Denver.  This centrally-located historic area provides fast and easy access to many Denver attractions.  The Denver Zoo, Denver Museum of Nature and Science, and the City Park are between 1-2.5 miles north of our place.  The Denver Botanic Gardens is just under a mile west of our place.  A variety of restaurants and coffee shops are easily within walking distance.  Quaint neighborhood shops are just two blocks away (12th Ave and Madison St), featuring a home decor/gift shop, liquor store and pharmacy, full service salon, coffee shop, ice cream shop, wine bar and pizza and Mexican restaurants.

host_about:
Hello!  We are an interracial (white/black) married couple raising two boys in the heart of Denver, Colorado. For ten months of the year Will works as a high school teacher of vocal music. For the other two months (summer break!) he enjoys taking care of our boys, gardening, doing house projects and cooking.  Jess, a former high school science teacher, is now a data coordinator for the genetic counseling department at a cancer center in the metro area. She enjoys baking sweets, papercrafting, reading, hanging out with our kids and getting together with friends.  Together we love hosting dinner parties, traveling and improving our home.  We generally prefer the arts over athletics, liberal/progressive views over conservative ones, and down-to-earth honest folks over high-maintenance people.

As a guest, we are very respectful of others' property and space.  We are moderately interactive with hosts, making conversation when suitable or needed, but also relaxing in the privacy of our room.  We are friendly, calm, and low-maintenance.

We look forward to meeting you!

Hiya! I've been hosting on Airbnb since November 2015 and I absolutely love it! I love sharing my city with travelers and making new friends from around the country and the world.  I love hosting so much on Airbnb that I do it for others! 

I've had the opportunity to make lasting friendships through Airbnb and have traveled across the country and across the world to visit people who have stayed with me. My one tip for Airbnb guests is to read the house rules of the places you book. Each host is unique and when most of the upfront communication is done through reading, you need to read EVERYTHING on the listing. Talk to you soon!

name: 1887Victorian3bed2Bath-hot tub, DownTown 420
description: Renovated Historic 1880 Victorian.  Located in Capitol Hill in Downtown Denver.  Great for groups and families.  Full Kitchen, remodelled backyard deck with new hot tub, 2 baths, 3 beds, living and dinning room with great common spaces.  10 minute walk to Lower Downtown and 16th street mall, 2 blocks from supermarket, 7 block to sprouts and Whole Foods, local bars 1 min walk, 1 min walk to 8 restaurants 1 is 5 star status. 1 min walk to marijuana store.  1 parking spot comes with.
neighborhood_overview: Besides being next to Lower Downtown, Capitol Hill is a very hip neighborhood in Denver with many amenities.  2 of Denver's most famous concert venues are 2 blocks away in the Fillmore and the Ogden.  All types of restaurants, bars and parks are close to the house.  Whole Foods, Trader Joes, the best Asian restaurant in Denver (Wokano), a relaxed neighborhood bar (Park Tavern) and an upscale restaurant where all the food comes from Colorado (Potager) are all a block and a half down the street.  Colfax is 2 blocks away were all the concerts/music venues, dive bars, late night restaurants, and tons off others.  Several beautiful parks within minutes walk, great for jogging, picnic, or just chilling out.  The botanical gardens, zoo, art museum, are very close some in walking distance all easily biked to. name: Stylish 2 story unit in Victorian Mansion
description: An 1886 Victorian brick mansion, updated with modern convenience and style. This unit spans two floors with a master suite upstairs, bath with jetted tub & skylighted shower. name: Friendly Lic 04172
description: My place is within walking distance to many dispensaries, Sloans Lake, restaurants, Joy Ride Brewery, bars and dining. You’ll love my place because it is ### friendly. No smoking cigarettes inside. Pot is legal in Colorado so you may smell a faint odor of pot just sayin. My place is 23 minutes or 14 miles from Red Rocks amphitheater, 20 minutes or 13 miles from Dicks sporting goods Park, 11 min or 7 miles from Coors Field, 9 min or three miles to downtown Denver. Guests under 18 not allowed.
neighborhood_overview:
Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!
When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to the lake, 25th St. Joyride Brewery, many dispensaries and restaurants.
You will notice the Mexican bakery, hair stylist and nail salon across the street (Sheridan) on your left before the 7-11 store. Other eateries are down along the lake on your right. Rupert's is my favorite, and is only open for breakfast and lunch.
Barbershop and one day spa are also down Sheridan just past Starbucks, as is Northern Lights dispensary. The other way on 29th is my favorite day spa A new spirit 4840 w. 29th.
Catch the #28 Eastbound bus in the covered bus shed by the lake across the street from 7-11. Fare is $2.60 and includes a transfer. This takes you downtown where you can catch the free 16th St. Mall Shuttle. Catch the #28 bus Westbound to return home on 15th St. The drivers are all very helpful as are other riders.

name: Lucia's 2bd/1ba | 30 Day+ | Dog Friendly
description: Meet Lucia, the little pup who call's this home unless she's sharing it with you. Lucia's house is not too big or small; not too close or far from downtown, the mountains, or the airport and it's in the heart of Denver.  Lucia's little house boasts big charm, great neighbors, and nearby eclectic food options and markets, Little Saigon. You’ll love the location of our little home while you're here.
neighborhood_overview:
"Named after the famed P.T. Barnum of Ringling Brother’s and Barnum Bailey’s Circus, the Barnum neighborhood is located in West Denver. Legend has it that P.T. Barnum purchased the land to house his circus animals in the winter but this neighborhood was never used for that purpose." Denver Library website

This neighborhood is a lovely place to call home. Barnum Park is just up the street and great to take a walk, enjoy the downtown cityscape, or just watch the city pass you bye.

Little Saigon is south on Federal Blvd. We recommend that get your pho "phix" at any of the various local noodle houses. Enjoy the local Asian and Mexican markets and make it an adventure!

name: Room Upstairs @ Eric's HipFunPad
description: A sweet pad located on Tennyson St in one of Denver's hottest neighborhoods with restaurants, breweries, bars, shops, coffee and parks within 6 blocks. This is a shared apartment above the owner’s e-bike shop. I sleep in the upstairs master bedroom, but you’ll only see me coming and going since I practically live in my bike shop downstairs.  Just over 3 miles to downtown. Upstairs at Eric's is relaxing with a covered patio, great sound system, chalk wall, movie projector, drum kit + more.
neighborhood_overview: There is hardly any reason to leave the neighborhood if you don't want to. This house is right on charming Tennyson Street - almost a mile long thriving cultural district with a wide variety of bars, coffee shops, restaurants, art galleries, live music venues, shops, parks and less than a block away from a Natural Foods grocery store.  There are four restaurants on this stretch listed on Westword's "100 Restaurants We Can't Live Without" issue.

host_about: I work in live entertainment production and have lived in Denver for nearly 30 years.  Most of that time in the house in my listing.  The house is a 1893 duplex built with an upstairs, 2 floor apartment and a main floor apartment.  I used to rent out the downstairs apartment, but now I live down there and only use the upstairs apartment when it's not rented out here.  My first drum kit is upstairs, and it's still my favorite of all I have owned.  Feel free to use it if you rent the Upstairs@ Erics listing.  I also rent out a private room in my main floor apartment which is shared full time with me.  Bicycles are my other passion and I enjoy converting regular bikes to electric bikes in a part time business I run from my front room.  Ask me about ebike rentals or tours! I really do enjoy sharing my comfortable space with people from all over the world on AirBnB.

We hope that you will enjoy the Rosedale neighborhood and its residential vibe while still being connected to urban attractions.

name: Private Lock-off in RiNo (400+ Positive Reviews!)
description: Large, private studio with separate entrance, located in Denver's urban- industrial River North (RiNo) neighborhood.  Located walking distances from some of Denver's best restaurants, craft breweries, coffee shops, cocktail bars, and the world-class  RiNo Art District. This home-away-from-home is perfect for weekend guests looking to take advantage of all that Denver has to offer; and for weekday guests looking for a quiet retreat during work trips just outside of downtown Denver.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in on the dividing line between the recently revitalized RiNo neighborhood and the historic Curtis Park neighborhood. The RiNo neighborhood is full of breweries, boutiques, coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, all of which are within walking distance of our home and ideal for daily fun. The Curtis Park neighborhood is mostly residential, with a number of parks and bike paths that are perfect for afternoon trips.  Because of our home's central location, you're just a short walk to Coors Field and Union Station. For those looking to explore beyond RiNo, Curtis Park and Downtown, hopping on a bike for 20 to 30 minutes, or taking a 10 minute Uber/Lyft ride, will quickly land you in Capitol Hill, City Park, Cheesman Park, Highlands, and Globeville.

name: Denver Victorian Mansion Apartment
description: Enjoy this gorgeous freshly-renovated apartment in the back of my historic 1896 Victorian Capitol Hill Mansion. Cozy, comfortable, and in the heart of the city- just blocks to some of the city's best restaurants, concert venues, coffee shops, and parks!  We just completed a full remodel of the entire apartment, and everything from the furniture to the appliances and everything in-between is brand new!
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is one of, if not THE best neighborhoods in Denver.  I've been fortunate enough to live here for the past 18 years and have enjoyed every minute of it. I am a happy, people person who believes that we can do wonderful things when we set the intention to do so. I am a Life Transformation Coach, helping people create the life of their dreams, along with a plan to achieve it. Travel
Water (beach, pool, river, hot tub, hot springs)
Bacon
Wine
People

While the space is fairly private, having your own entrance and bathroom, we are happy to share the kitchen and laundry facilities, if you are interested. We looking forward to hosting you!

name: Cute Carriage House (with bikes provided)
description: Private Carriage House with full kitchen, full bath, and lots of light - 20 ft ceilings with sky lights. Located in our backyard in a quiet neighborhood with easy parking just 2 miles East of Downtown - walk to Zoo, City Park, and neighborhood restaurants.  Or, bike (with provided bikes) to downtown, Cherry Creek, or RINO.  Easy access from Airport - just a 20 minute drive or Uber or the A-train and 7 min bus ride will bring you within 2 blocks of the Carriage House.
neighborhood_overview: We love living in Whittier.   We are walking distance to a tap room (Ephemeral) and two delicious restaurants, the Plimoth and Point Easy both just a few blocks away.  City Park, the Zoo, and the Nature and Science Museum are walking distance.  We are two miles from Downtown, which is a quick bike or bus ride/Light Rail ride away.  We are also a quick bike ride to RINO with its numerous new breweries and restaurants.

host_about: Hi, my name is Stephanie.  I retired from my job as a lawyer (doing Civil Rights work), and decided that now that I have time in my life, I would start renting the apartment in our back yard.  I enjoy everything outdoors that Colorado has to offer - skiing, biking, running, hiking, backpacking.  In 2015,  I hiked the Colorado Trail - from Denver to Durango (480 miles) and am currently section hiking the CDT.  I am an active volunteer, currently working several days a week at the local food bank.

name: Private Room & Bath Near Trails and Restaurants
description:
I’m a young professional opening up my home to visitors looking for a place to stay in the peaceful Central Park neighborhood of Denver, walking distance to popular restaurants and steps away from biking trails. My friendly, lovable dog, Shelby will happily welcome you as well.

Guests will enjoy the comfort of a private, quiet bedroom and a private modern bathroom with mountain views in a house filled with options to relax or have fun.
neighborhood_overview:
Central Park is a quiet neighborhood filled with beautiful parks and biking trails.

Stanley Marketplace is a 7 minute walk away. An 8 minute walk north will take you to a few additional popular restaurants and the grocery store as well.

name: Modern apartment in LoHi
description: This modern and spacious apartment is in the best area in Denver! It comes fully furnished with a king bed and option of adding an air mattress. Close to everything, quiet and spacious, it's perfect for couples, small families and professionals. Please note that this is located underneath our main house. We do our best to be respectful of our renters, and make a special effort to be quiet during typical sleeping hours. However, we do have two young children who sometimes have their own agendas.
neighborhood_overview: In our opinion, this is the best area in Denver. We are walking distance to Union Station and downtown, and at the doorstep of LoHi's abundant restaurants, cafes, bars, breweries, parks and shops. We have easy access to Denver's interstates and other great neighborhoods.

name: Stroll around Sloans Lake from a Beautifully Curated Home
description:
Soak up the sun on our front patio, chasing all cares away. Our immaculate mid-century home has been stylishly designed with a cool neutral color palette, enhanced with striking wooden pieces and eye-catching furnishings.

Entire property - Smart Lock Access

Send a text or call and we are always available.

This home is situated on a quiet residential street near coffee shops, restaurants, a movie theater, and a brewery. It’s just a couple of miles from downtown Denver and close to LoHi, Highlands, Berkeley and Jefferson Park.

Our home is situated on a quiet residential street in a walk able neighborhood just steps away from a beautiful lake and park (with a 3-mi loop to walk or run), coffee shops, restaurants, a movie theater, O'Dells brewery and Little Man ice cream. name: Urban Farmhouse at Curtis Park (30 Day minimum)
description: The Urban Farmhouse circa 1886 - meticulously converted in 2013. The updates afford you all the modern convenience you could ask for and charm you can only get from a building built in 1886. A true Charmer.
neighborhood_overview: Denver's oldest neighborhood, Curtis Park nestled between gritty RiNo with craft breweries, restaurants and Welton Street - all in walking distance (minimum 3 blocks away). About one mile to Denver's 16th Street Mall. One block from Curtis Park with public outdoor pool open Jun-Aug

name: Cozy Base in Vibrant Family Home (1 or 2 bedrooms)
description:
Enjoy a cozy, private guestroom in the basement of our spacious family home. With plenty of space for 1 or 2 & private bath, you'll have a warm welcome from your hosts & two whole floors separating you from the bedroom of our 10 year-old twin boys. Woohoo!
(Please note: We also have a second bedroom with a queen bed that can be added if your party needs it. Cost is 10% less than 1st bedroom, bathroom is shared with 1st bedroom, though not with our family. Please ask in your message!)
neighborhood_overview: Our urban residential neighborhood is a lively and diverse mixture of families, young couples, and the elderly. Our family is very happy here, and we embrace our urban location. We take our boys to the park, let them play outside, and say hello to all our neighbors. We also live on a very friendly block, where everyone knows each other and gets along great. Our particular area is residential and doesn't offer many restaurants or bars, but it is just a short drive from all the best spots in the city. On foot, you can visit a lovely coffee shop (Rivers and Roads), a 7-11, a liquor store, a couple of taquerias, and a nice little bar with food called Nola Voodoo Tavern.

host_about: We're a busy family of four, so y'know, always on the go...There's me, Rebecca, writer, artist, and avid cook and gardener, though I seem to spend a lot of time building marble runs and lego art with our two 9 year old boys.  There's Charlie, handy energy engineer, awesome garden and rain capture system builder.  And then there are those boys I mentioned...let's just say there's a lot of climbing on the furniture, drawing, puzzles, books, fort-building, dirt-digging, and marble-rolling in our house.  But don't worry, our two guest rooms are located far from the mayhem in our fully renovated basement, otherwise known as "the fortress of solitude". And marble rolling ceases at a reasonable hour with kid bedtime!

name: Studio in Heart of City Park--7 min to Downtown!
neighborhood_overview:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD: CITY PARK SOUTH
Walk to so many amenities!! With a quiet, safe and friendly neighborhood feel close to downtown, the house is just across the street from Denver's largest and most beautiful Park, City Park. The Denver Zoo and the Museum of Science and Nature are just across the park.

There is a full grocery store (Sprouts) on the very next block next to a Denver Bike Share station.

Enjoy 5-10 min walks through our charming neighborhood to several bars: Atomic Cowboy, PS Town, Goosetown Tavern, Cerebral Brewing, and several others

Great dining close by includes Urban Chow, Into the Wind, Stella's, Mezcal, Humble Pie, Denver Biscuit Company, as well as hip coffee shops: Hooked on Colfax, Lula Rose Coffee Shop, and others.

Also nearby is one of the hippest book stores (Tattered Cover) next to a modern Independent film Cinema (SIE)

host_about:
Hi there. We are a family from Ohio and Sweden. We have lived in Denver for the past 4 years. We love skiing, traveling, play music-instruments and hanging out with family and friends. We also love Denver, its history and walkable streets. It reminds us of many cities in Europe. 
We enjoy walking down to the movies on 16th Street Mall or drinking a cappuccino in nearby coffee-shop. If the day ends with a dinner in a nearby Indian restaurant, it is complete.
Other then that we take pride in working with and maintaining our house, one of Denver's most famous historical houses. The Cody House.

name: 2-Rm Basement Studio in Private Home for 1 Person
description: The space has all the conveniences of a regular apartment except a kitchen. However, kitchen privileges are included. The bedroom has a full size bed.  The outer room has a  sofa, chair, desk, small table with 2 chairs, fridge, microwave, cable TV, wifi. Coffee/tea provided.  Electric fireplace and lower ceiling (7-ft high) make for a cozy space, but may be an issue for tall people. Small private bath w/ shower is included, as well as washer/dryer privileges.

host_about: I am in my early thirties and have a huge appetite for living LIFE. I love to travel, love food, family and adventure. New Orleans, Miami, Puerto Vallarta...and the Bay Area are all some of my favorite destinations. I think the world is an amazing place, with too many Beautiful places all over to list. I do read, not as much as I would like to but I can go without at times...I stay busy with Real Estate in many aspects, I describe myself as a Finish Carpenter(General Contractor) by trade, Associate Broker by profession and an entrepenuer by vision. I am a very open minded individual, I like all kinds of different music (love hip hop), and have acquired a great taste for all kinds of different art. "The food" has within the last few yrs become a pasion of mine and enjoy cooking and eating out. I love ceviche, bbq, Italian food, sushi etc.....) I love to have fun with friends, watch movies, go to concerts watch shows. I like my time to count and try at all times to stay in the moment with a positive outlook on the future.

name: Chic Villa & Lush Gardens Cherry Creek Shopping
description: Relax, enjoy; entertain with friends & family in a Georgian Revival Villa. Walk to Denver's top restaurants, The Cherry Creek Mall, Washington Park. There are strong European and Mediterranean influences in this area of Denver. You can walk east to the Cherry Creek shopping district, south to Washington Park, walk north to Safeway, the 6th Avenue restaurants and shops, Oliver's butcher, Joy's Liquors, Novo Coffee Roasters, the Landmark Movie Theater, Cheeseman , walk west to fun Italian restaurants and Broadway is loaded with trendy bars and places to eat and shop. Park Cherry Creek Shopping District is the best shopping in Denver.  It has lots of trendy restaurants, bars, gyms, spas, salons, banks, movie theaters, grocery stores. The Jefferson Park neighborhood is named for the large park at the heart of the area. My home is directly on the park facing the city skyline to the East. Little Machine Brewery and Briar Commons Brewpub are both only 2 blocks from my home. 2914 Coffee, Sexy Pizza, Sartos- an upscale Italian restaurant, El Cazo and Chili Verde- upscale Mexican joints, Jefferson Park Pub, Federal Bar and Grille, Jack and Grille, Santiago's, a Safeway, and more are all within 3 blocks.

name: Retro Pad by DU in Virginia Village
description: Remodeled in 2023, this funky apartment in our home is separated from the upstairs with private keypad entrance. New kitchenette & bathroom, eating/work area, cozy living room and access to beautiful backyard. Location is steps to Light Rail, nestled between Downtown and the Denver Tech Center. As a basement unit in our house, best for low key couples, biz travelers, DU visitors, tourists, cannabis consumers, LGBTQ+ folks, honeymooners and Red Rocks concert goers. Ask to use Level 2 EV charger!
neighborhood_overview:
Virginia Village is a friendly residential neighborhood in a central location with easy access to DU to the west, Cherry Creek directly north, and the Denver Tech Center due south. There is a local park a block away and the famous Wash Park just a quick drive west. We are 8 miles to Downtown Denver - an easy ride on the Light Rail.

One of our favorite restaurants is Ester's - just a four block walk where we get great craft beer options and the best pizza around. Neighboring areas have top rated restaurants within a 10 minute drive - Sushi Den & Bird in Platte Park - Jax Fish House in Glendale - Max's Gill & Grill & Perdida in Wash Park - Cherry Creek Grill & Cherry Cricket in Cherry Creek.

name: Friendly 91 license 24390
description: My place is within walking distance to many dispensaries, Sloans Lake, restaurants, Joy Ride Brewery, bars and dining. You’ll love my place because it is 420 friendly. No smoking cigarettes inside just pot. My place is 23 minutes or 14 miles from Red Rocks amphitheater, 20 minutes or 13 miles from Dicks sporting goods Park, 11 min or 7 miles from Coors Field, 9 min or three miles to downtown Denver. Guests under 18 not allowed. Guests may opt out from participating in the 420 listing theme.
neighborhood_overview:
Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!
When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to Sloans Lake, 25th St. Joyride Brewery, many dispensaries and restaurants.
You will notice the Mexican bakery, hair stylist and nail salon across the street (Sheridan) on your left before the 7-11 store. Other eateries are down along the lake on your right. Rupert's is my favorite, and is only open for breakfast and lunch.
Barbershop and one day spa are also down Sheridan just past Starbucks, as is Northern Lights dispensary. The other way on 29th is my favorite day spa A new spirit 4840 w. 29th.
Catch the #28 Eastbound bus in the covered bus shed by the lake across the street from 7-11. Fare is $2.60 and includes a transfer. This takes you downtown where you can catch the free 16th St. Mall Shuttle. Catch the #28 bus Westbound to return home on 15th St. The drivers are all very helpful as are other riders.

name: Cozy N. Park Hill private Garden level apartment.
description: Come enjoy this cozy private Garden level basement apartment! You with have a private 790sqft apartment to  yourself! Parking is available on the property and lit at night. Not only is this home part of the lovely North Park Hill neighborhood, but it's conveniently situated on the RTD bus line which will take you directly downtown to enjoy the shopping, restaurants and nightlife that Denver has to offer. Rest comfortably here. Grocery store and restaurants walking distance from the house.
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located across the street from Fred Thomas Park (enjoy movies in the park in the summer time). Enjoy bbqs at the park and come back and enjoy your garden level apartment after a fulfilling day.
The East 29th town center is less than a quarter mile away - restaurants, bars and grocery shopping. The Northfield Shopping Center is within 2 miles of our home. The Denver Zoo is 2.5 miles away and is on the direct bus route from the house!!! Nearly a dozen breweries within 1-7 miles from the house with food trucks. Don't miss this opportunity to enjoy your stay in Denver!

name: Spacious One Bedroom near Denver's Wash park
description:
Enjoy the beautiful neighborhood of Wash park west in a clean modern 1 bedroom apartment.
Only a 10 minute walk to the eclectic shops of South Broadway. There you will find some of Denver's most unique shops, coffee stops, bars, restaurants and venues. Also only about a 10 min walk to Wash park which is one of Denver most beautiful parks.
I am happy to lend my space and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
neighborhood_overview: I am located in the Speer neighborhood just north of west wash park. Great neighborhood for all interests. South Broadway is extremely close and has a lot of good restaurants, bars and venues. Wash park is a great place to hangout on a beautiful day offering running trails, paddle board rentals, and team volleyball games. Area is very vibrant and alive, always something fun going on.

name: *16 Shower Head Steam shower! Insane mtn. views!
description:
This has been exclusively my home for the past 7 years. It still is my home but I recently remolded a private wing for guests and after being in hibernation for a few years, it is back on the market for visitors with a private entrance & completely private quarters.
This unit is by far the nicest in the building, one of the nicest in all of Denver.
The skyscraper views overlooking Rocky Mountain National Park, the 16 head steam shower, the smart toilet combine to give you Unmatched luxury.
neighborhood_overview:
"From its early beginnings during the Gold Rush era, The Mile High City has always been a gathering place for diverse and creative people. Today, Denver is an outdoor city with a vibrant, walkable downtown offering urban adventures for all ages. Within a one-mile radius, you can kayak on the Platte River; explore some of the city's best museums; shop at art galleries and boutiques; see a Broadway touring show; enjoy live music; ride a rollercoaster or cool off in a water park; and experience exciting professional sports. Downtown is also home to many of Denver's top farm-to-table restaurants and innovative craft breweries, and the Denver Beer Trail is a great guide to sampling those local brews.

name: Denver Central Park / Stapleton Carriage House
description:
We're in Denver Central Park, Stapleton. 6 miles to downtown. Walking distance to a pool, tennis courts, breweries, Stanley Marketplace, Starbucks, & local restaurants.

Our place is ideal for couples, solo adventures & business travelers.

Whether you're in town for business, visiting relatives in the neighborhood, or just touring Denver, this place is for you.

We’ll accommodate up to 4 people for guests with family members accompanying them.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in Denver’s Central Park area, formally know as Stapleton. Our neighborhood is surrounded by parks interconnected by miles of running and biking trails.
There are many excellent restaurants, bars, breweries, dispensaries, and shopping within walking distance or a short drive or light rail train.
Downtown Denver is only 5.7 miles from our house with plenty of concert venues, dancing, night life, museums, and other attractions.
We also have a fully electric all wheel drive Audi on Turo that we only rent to our AirBnB guests.

description:
Ideal for those looking to unwind in a spacious, feel good home in Denver’s best neighborhood.

A short stroll through quaint, tree-lined streets & you’ll find yourself at locally-owned coffee shops, juice bars, great restaurants & beautiful parks.

2bd/2.5 bath

neighborhood_overview:
Pacha House is located in Denver’s best neighborhood, Historic Highland’s Square. Our central location allows guests to walk to everything and experience the sophisticated charm of the Highlands.

Only one block from cafe's, restaurants, boutique shopping, dispensaries, yoga studios, and the Highland's Farmers market (every Sunday ) which offers a great variety of local produce, flowers, baked goods, self care items, etc. Highly recommended :).

Food lover?
Check out St Kilian's Cheese Shop & Mondo Vino for a charcuterie board with a well matched bottle of wine or microbrew, Bakery Four for naturally leavened bread and pastries, Novo for locally roasted coffee and friendly baristas, Blue Pan for Denver's best rated pizza, Pinche Tacos & El Camino for Mexican, Salt & Grinder for sandwiches, Himchuli for Indian and great vegetarian options, Parisi for casual Italian... all within one block.

name: Charming Home in Central Denver
description: Welcome to this newly remodeled Victorian in the heart of Denver's vibrant Congress Park neighborhood. This  5-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom home is the perfect blend of modern comfort and classic charm, great for friends & family gathering with many places to hangout, pool, trampoline, grill area, basement projector, foosball... walkable to many of surrounding restaurants and parks, 2 blocks for botanical garden. Perfect place to relax and enjoy the best of Denver.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in Congress Park, you'll be within walking distance of some of Denver's best attractions:

City Park: Just a short stroll away, City Park offers miles of walking paths, a golf course, and the Denver Zoo.

Botanic Gardens: The Denver Botanic Gardens, a lush and vibrant escape, is nearby.

Cafes and Restaurants: Explore the diverse dining options in the area, from cozy cafes to upscale eateries.

Downtown Denver: Downtown Denver is only a short drive or a quick ride on public transport, offering endless entertainment, shopping, and cultural experiences.

Public Transportation: Access to buses and light rail stations is within easy reach, making it simple to explore the city.

host_about:
Hi! 
Here are some things about us: We are a family of 4 + dog, married 15 years.

I'm (Judy) originally from Missouri, I've lived in Denver since 2001. I am employed remotely for a company as a Media Researcher and also work part-time as Bookkeeper and Estimator for our countertop fabricating shop. 

Marty (the other half) is from Wisconsin and moved to Denver in 1999. He is Director of Operations at the countertop fabricating shop that we own in south Denver.

Some of our interests:
Me: interior design, yard sales, thrift stores, making crafty things, sewing, camping, hiking, paddleboarding, eating, traveling, museums, and stocks/crypto.

Marty: snowboarding, paddleboarding, soccer, hockey, CrossFit, fishing, camping, Cornhole, anything Wisconsin Badgers, building things, playing games with the kids, and barbecues.

Zoey (age 10): catching bugs-but-not-spiders, going to the pool, slime, Tricking, back handsprings, Shaolin Kung Fu, building forts, kayaking, drawing, and playing with kid-friends.

Paxton (age 7): flipping on the trampoline, practicing his ninja skills, anything LEGO, soccer, throwing things, fishing, riding his bike, Tricking, and pestering his sister.

Kingsley, Great Dane (age 6): sunbathing, chasing squirrels, staring contests with cats, head rubs, playing fetch, long walks around the neighborhood, and car rides.

neighborhood_overview:
The Lower Highlands (commonly referred to as "LoHi") is known for its craft beer spots, cocktail bars, countless restaurants and incredible downtown views. This little nook of a neighborhood is one of Denver’s best kept secrets. Tree-lined streets, a sidewalk scene filled with boutique retail and restaurants, local cafes filled with friends and neighbors, great schools, nearby parks, strollers, dogs and pints…

Perfect for those that want to stay in a bustling neighborhood of locals while still being able to jump on a scooter and be in the middle of downtown within minutes.

I own and manage a real estate consulting company in Denver, CO.  I have a main focus on residential leasing and management and as such manage a great deal of single family homes for individual property owners.  I also provide a variety of other services encompassing real estate brokerage, including commercial leasing, on both the owner and tenant side.  I focus on smaller more quirky listings that are below the radar of other real estate firms mainly due to size of the spaces.  Most of the client I encounter are small businesses looking to leave the home office or executive suite and acquire and address and presence of their own.  

As a host I manage units for Owners that have vacation rentals or second homes that want to have a responsive person on the ground to handle things.  As much as I do not own the units I manage, I treat them as if I am an owner.  

The units I manage are also available for long term lease.  

As a guest I treat properties as if they were my own and respect the work and effort that goes into making the experience enjoyable.  I love urban centers and enjoying being in the heart of the city wherever that city happens to be.  I enjoy music, particularly classical, electronic, and jazz.  I enjoy the ability to come and go as I please with little or no impact on my host or other guests.

name: ★ Movie Theater ★ Fire Pit ★ Outdoor Space! ★
description:
3,200' smart house with luxury touches. Relax in the massage chair in front of the 120" theater screen. Tell Alexa to turn off or dim the lights. Play a game on the Xbox. neighborhood_overview:
Bordering Jefferson Park, LoHi, and Sloan's Lake, the neighborhood is a hotspot of growth. There are >20 bars & restaurants within a 5 minute walk and >100 within a 15 minute walk. Walk to >10 breweries within 15 minutes, or take your pick from local dispensaries.

Getting to the mountains or downtown is incredibly easy due to the proximity of Speer, 25, and 6th Ave., and you're only a mile from Mile High Stadium.

The area is a mixed community with lots of new builds and some older homes, giving the area a very nice vibe. Very safe to walk around day or night.

host_about:
At 4.95 / 5 overall reviews, we're one of the highest rated Superhosts in the country! Myself and my team at HostWise are focused on providing our guests with amazing stays & outstanding amenities. Every one of our properties reflects our brand - quality linens, abundant amenities, whole bean coffee, high speed internet, workspaces, and lots more! We're here as your "virtual concierge" - if you need anything, any time, just ask! Don't take our word for it; take a look at our reviews and see what our previous guests are saying about us!

How did we end up in the Airbnb hospitality business? Our founders were "road warriors" for >10 years of our lives, in the consulting industry, the music industry, traveling nursing, and more.  We stayed in a ton of different places, and learned what we loved (and what we hated!) at all of the places we've stayed over the years. We appreciated seamless check ins and check outs, friendly, unobtrusive hosts, sparking clean spaces, abundant amenities, and rapid help if we needed it. We reflect these qualities, and more, in all of our HostWise properties throughout the country. From myself and my team, we can't wait to host you at our place! 

Remember - life is too short to stay home!

name: A Denver Gem, Home in ParkHill neighborhood
description: A Denver Gem. Our 1700 sq. ft. guest wing is professionally decorated.  Walk to the park, Property located across from City Park in Park Hill. Downtown and Cherry Creek shopping area are a 10 minutes drive. Private space is not shared. The master bedroom has a king size bed. Bathroom has a shower and 2 person jetted tub.  Beautiful grounds, view of mountains/city.  Off street parking. Only one bed. Great for couples.
neighborhood_overview: No third party booking. Our home is landscaped on all 4 sides. The gardens were the a featured garden of the 2013 and 2022 Park Hill Garden Walk. We were on the garden walk again this June 2022. The grounds are beautiful regardless of the season. South Park Hill is one of the nicest historical neighborhoods of Denver. Close to bars, restaurants and shops. The Governor's private home is 5 blocks from our residence. City Park (directly across from our property) was designed by Frederick Olmstead the designer of Central Park in New York City and the Golden Gate Park in San Francisco.

name: Mountain Views, Entertainment Galore!
description: An enjoyable home for your next visit to Denver. Enjoy mountain views, watch a movie on the home theater, or kick back in a toasty hot tub surrounded by pine trees. Located near Tennyson Shopping District,Olde Towne Arvada, and Inspiration Point Park.Easy access to I-70  means just 25 minutes to the airport and 10 minutes to downtown Denver. Please note: we have two kids, and since we live upstairs you will hear some footsteps and other noise during the day, but night-time is calm and quiet.
neighborhood_overview: Situated around Inspiration Point, the highest point in the city of Denver, the neighborhood offers something for everyone. Walking around the park is a great way to take in the views of the Rocky Mountians. Clear Creek bike path is just to the North, and connects to many major bike routes. Lakeside Amusement Park is open in the Summer providing exciting and inexpensive fun for kids and adults. Dining on Tennyson is wonderful, with great cuisine for any budget.

name: Close to Everything! 5-Star Experience in LoHi
description:
Explore Denver's Hottest Neighborhood while enjoying a 2-story 1300SF townhome equipped w/ IKEA furnishings & hotel finishes! Plus 2 garage parking spaces. LoHi has it all!!

Ready for a 5-star Denver visit? Lower Highland is full of boutique hangouts in every direction. So many places to go...far from the average bar & restaurant chain. There aren't any hotels in the heart of LoHi. So take advantage of this awesome location & price. LoHi is a short Uber to all of Denver's Urban Districts!
neighborhood_overview: A few of our favorite spots within a short walk are...Linger, El Five, Mizu Izakaya, Little Man Ice Cream, Tony P's, Williams & Graham, Recess, Avanti, Ale House, Postino, Occidental, Highland Tap and Burger, Uncle, & Bar Dough. You can literally catch HH and hit 3-4 places with friends or meet new people. There are breweries, restaurants, coffee shops, yoga places, health clubs......hip urban location w/ so much right outside the front door. You can also take a  short walk to the famed Union Station and Lower Downtown. Coors Field (Baseball); Mile High (Football) and the Pepsi Center (Basketball, Hockey, Concerts) are all nearby. Looking for a workout? Check out the ClassPass App. There are studios all over LoHi.

   Life is short-ENJOY!

name: Remodeled Old-World Home in Downtown Denver
neighborhood_overview:
Five points is a beloved old neighborhood in Denver. Situated in a prime location between RiNo and LoDo. It's a great place to see shows, hop around local breweries, and enjoy local art. The Curtis Park Deli is right around the corner, British Bulldog is right down the street, and with a short walk, scooter or Uber you can be at many of Denver's best restaurants, bars, and entertainment areas.

As this house is at the heart of the city, you will hear city noises, including emergency vehicles at times during your stay. Also, it is only a few blocks from the mission, so there are quite a few homeless persons in the area. I've never experienced any issues with them in the year I've lived here.
host_about: College basketball referee living in Denver. I love to travel, hike, ski, and get out into the mountains as often as possible.

name: Modern Living in the Heart of Downtown
description: Cute studio with hardwood floors, murphy bed, views of the mountains in the heart of downtown Denver. Just steps from everything you need!
neighborhood_overview: Located one block off the 16th Street Mall, you're located in the heart downtown Denver and most everything is walkable. The mile-long, pedestrian-friendly Mall is packed with shopping, restaurants and attractions.  Explore the historic Union Station for breakfast or drinks, check out the local Tattered Cover Bookstore on the 16th Street Mall, or get into nature with the Cherry Creek bike path.

name: Sloans Lake Row Home w/ Patio & Grill!
description: Make yourself at home in this 1 bed/1 bath urban retreat, nestled just steps from Sloan's Lake hot spots. This cozy space offers all the amenities of home: A well-stocked kitchen, washer/dryer, designated workspace, and a private patio for grilling. The local brewery and cafe are just three doors down. The home is also situated between two beautiful parks — and only a mile from Mile High Stadium near downtown.
neighborhood_overview:
The Sloan's Lake neighborhood is one of Denver's newest hot spots and Sloan’s Lake is within walking distance, just a few blocks away (across Colfax).

After a stroll along the lake, head to one of the nearby restaurants or cafés: The Patio, Odell Brewing, or ChoLon — or catch a movie at the renowned Alamo Drafthouse!

The historic Edgewater neighborhood is just west of the lake with even more great local attractions, including Rupert’s, Joyride and Sloan’s Bar.

The Highlands neighborhood is a 10 minute ride, as well as the ballpark & other downtown attractions. Empower Field at Mile high, home of the Denver Broncos, is less than a mile away.

I25 is 2 miles down Colfax - Jump on 6 to Red Rocks (a quick 20 minute drive) or to the surrounding area for some beautiful Colorado scenery in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains.

The local brewery, Seedstock, is three doors down from the house & you can often find food trucks outside.

name: Comfortable Business Travel Denver
description:
Dear Guest: I am no longer offering my condo on the Airbnb platform. I cannot support a business that does not subscribe to ethical business practices. I have decided to part ways with Airbnb after almost five years as a Super Host. As you can see by my many excellent reviews, I take hosting seriously and I do whatever it takes to make sure my guests are satisfied. You are welcome to contacting me directly or find my listing on a similar platform.

Warmly ,
Anna Forsberg

name: Bright, relaxing getaway
description: Like to ski, snowshoe, visit beautiful gardens or explore alternative medicine?  My place is close to the airport, parks and the wonderful Denver Botanic Gardens, and just a 20 minute bus ride to downtown. Walk, bike or run on the miles of paths thru Stapleton parks, accessible across the street.  I do have a lovely adult cat, Russian Siberian.  He does roam the house so if you are allergic that could be a problem.
neighborhood_overview: Stapleton is a planned community and is very safe.  We have miles of bike and walk trails that wander through lovely green spaces, and access to these trails is across the street from my house. The community is new, only 10 years old, and is home to predominantly young families and grandparents.

name: Carriage House Loft,  History in central LoHi
description:
This beautiful historic building was built in the 1880s as a carriage house and converted into a living space in 2005. Brick walls, original wood floor, big wooden beams, gears and chains for the platform elevator.....this is not your everyday stay. This is a place like no other and smack dab in the middle of one of the hottest neighborhood in Denver. No need for a car at this place.


High Speed Internet ...100Mbps

License: 2017-BFN-0001262
Includes 10.75% Denver tax

No pets, No parties
neighborhood_overview: LoHi is currently one of the hottest neighborhoods in Denver. Tons of new and interesting restaurants and many holdovers  from "the olden days" when it was the Italian district.  In less than a mile you will find 5 of AirBnB's top 7 Best of the Best of Denver's bar/restaurants. (https://www.airbnb.com/things-to-do/denver) . Walking at night is safe and well lit.

description: Searching for the highest standard of luxury for your trip to Denver? Look no further. Welcome to this gorgeous, newly renovated building right in the middle of all the action. “From its early beginnings during the Gold Rush era, The Mile High City has always been a gathering place for diverse and creative people. Today, Denver is an outdoor city with a vibrant, walkable downtown offering urban adventures for all ages. Within a one-mile radius, you can kayak on the Platte River; explore some of the city’s best museums; shop at art galleries and boutiques; see a Broadway touring show; enjoy live music; ride a rollercoaster or cool off in a water park; and experience exciting professional sports. Downtown is also home to many of Denver’s top farm-to-table restaurants and innovative craft breweries, and the Denver Beer Trail is a great guide to sampling those local brews.

name: Queen Anne Victorian central Denver
description:
Spend a month in Denver this spring. Urban living in the heart of Denver. Updated and sunny 2300 sq. ft. private home built in 1886 available from April 13 to May 22 for period of 31 days or more.

Blocks from light rail to downtown. Walk to City Park, Historic Five Points, Cervantes, Queen City Collective, Point Easy and Whittier Cafe. The kitchen is updated and fully-equipped. Have coffee on the deck off the master suite, or enjoy the deck, patio, and garden off the sunroom.
neighborhood_overview: Whittier is one of Denver's oldest central neighborhoods with predominantly single-family housing and diverse population. The block is filled with a variety of types of friendly people who love city living.

name: Highlands Area Private Basement with Living Room
description:
You will have private access to the entire basement with your own separate entrance. The space includes a personal bathroom, living area, bedroom and laundry.

Our place is close to the RTD Bus line going to Downtown Denver, Union Station, Ball Arena, Empower Field, the Convention Center and Regis University. There’s plenty to see and do without renting a car!

Grocery/Liquor stores are less than a block away. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is very popular in Denver. In the summer you can join in on First Friday festivities on Tennyson street which is 6 blocks away. We are across the street from the grocery store and within walking distance to many restaurants, bars and breweries.

Historic Tennyson street offers shops and boutiques galore. There is never a shortage of things to do. If you like being outdoors you have easy access to two parks that are within a mile away. Hiking can be found as close as 20 minutes away. There are bike paths and bus routes close to the house.

Popular venues:
Ball Arena (downtown Denver) is 4 miles making a Lyft/Uber ride very easy.
Coors Field is 5 miles away.
Red Rocks concerts and hiking is 18 miles away.
Boulder’s famous Pearl Street is 28 miles away.
Winter Park Resort is 65 miles away.
Copper Mountain is 81 miles away.
Garden of the Gods is 76 miles away.

name: 38th floor Spire 1 BR with incredible view!

host_about:
Hello there!  I'm Ashley. 

I've been hosting on Airbnb for years now and absolutely love it! Personally I think it is because it has given us the opportunity to travel and see the world AND to meet amazing people like yourself and that's just freakin' cool. 

In addition to our own home, we manage a number of properties for others and guests from all over the world enjoy staying in our properties! That could have to do with how we strive to make everything perfect for you during your stay! 

I have a website with resources on planning your trip to Tulum - it's called Tulum Traveler - you can check it out for tips and recommendations. 

Wishing you a wonderful trip!

Cheers, 

Ashley

Check on multi month discounts. This LoDo property is just minutes from Larimer Square, Coors Field, & Union Station. It is also close to Elitch Gardens amusement park, Store, the Pepsi Center, the Convention Center, Illegal Pete’s, ChoLon Modern Asian Bistro, & many more restaurants & bars. neighborhood_overview:
"From its early beginnings during the Gold Rush era, The Mile High City has always been a gathering place for diverse and creative people. Today, Denver is an outdoor city with a vibrant, walkable downtown offering urban adventures for all ages. Within a one-mile radius, you can kayak on the Platte River; explore some of the city's best museums; shop at art galleries and boutiques; see a Broadway touring show; enjoy live music; ride a rollercoaster or cool off in a water park; and experience exciting professional sports. Downtown is also home to many of Denver's top farm-to-table restaurants and innovative craft breweries, and the Denver Beer Trail is a great guide to sampling those local brews.

host_about:
Hello, I work in the field of marketing and my husband, Tim, works in Solar. We are quite active and self-proclaimed foodies. If you want any recommendations on where to hike or eat while in Denver, we have some good recommendations. 

HOW HOSTING BECAME OUR PASSION:
Tim and I came into our relationship each owning a 2 bedroom house.  As our family grew and our needs changed, we decided to rent out both of our two homes because neither one of us wanted to sell. We gave short term renting a try and we’ve had such great experiences with the wonderful people we’ve met. It brings joy to know that our guests are enjoying our homes as much as we did. 

As a couple who travels quite a bit, we try to incorporate a high level of standards of what we expect in a hotel. Our ultimate goal and passion is to help our guests get as much out of their visit as possible, as there's just so much to offer in this unique and beautiful city. If there is anything that would make your stay more enjoyable, please reach out prior or during your stay. 

*I have contracted a translator for French and Spanish speaking guests to help arrange accommodations, if needed.

name: Cozy apartment, easy access to everything
description: Our place is within walking distance of Bronco's Stadium, Meow Wolf, Sloan's Lake, and the Lightrail station, which can take you to the Pepsi Center or downtown in less than 10 minutes. We are conveniently located close to both I-25 and I-70, making the apartment a perfect starting point, whether exploring the city or the mountains. The place is cozy and nicely decorated, and accommodates up to 4 guests. You are welcome to spend time in the backyard, and we have a couple of bikes available.
neighborhood_overview: We live in a changing neighborhood with a mixture of older, classic homes, and more modern constructions. Our house was one of the first on the block, built in 1900. Sloan's Lake is a lovely place for a walk or a bike ride, and the area around the lake is booming with new restaurants and shops. Paco Sanchez Park is nearby, which has one of the best playgrounds in Denver, as well as a splash pad in the summer and a bike path that can take you to the stadium or downtown.

host_about: I am both a homebody and an adventurer. I love calling the up-and-coming city of Denver home, and I also love visiting new places. I have lived in Colorado for most of my life, with a few detours to India, Costa Rica and New York. As a result I have eclectic taste in food, drink, music and cultural activities. neighborhood_overview:
The location is hard to beat! We’re just over a mile from the popular RiNo (River North)district with its great restaurants, breweries and music venues and art.

Even closer is Welton Street which is being rapidly revitalized with a nod to it’s diversity and soulfulness. Grab a beer or a growler from the laid back Spangalang Brewery, hit up Rosenberg's for the best bagel and lox outside of New York City or step back into 1950 and grab an ice cream cone at the new yet vintage Sherrie’s Soda Shop. You can also hop on the light rail which runs along Welton to Downtown.

Head south to 17th Avenue for a great selection of eateries including Olive and Finch, the funky Hamburger Mary’s, upscale Humbolt or the affordable Waffle Brothers with its laid back shaded patio. New restaurants are constantly popping up in this area, too, so let me know what you find!

name: Cozy & Elegant Art District Remodel -Downtown Area
description: Welcome to my 2Br/1Ba in Santa Fe Art District, Denver's most eclectic neighborhood. Whether you are on business, a traveling nurse, a couple(s), or a family, the space, amenities, and location are perfect for a long stay! A $9-13 Uber to almost anywhere including downtown, the Convention Center, Mile High Stadium, and entertainment. Uber, scooter, or walk to restaurants, breweries, art galleries, and dispensaries.  Headed to the mtns or out of town? Be on 6th Ave, I-25, and I-70 in 60 seconds.
neighborhood_overview: Santa Fe Art District is an eclectic mix of art galleries, their owners, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and families. The alleyway behind my home is one of the densest areas of street art/graffiti/murals in Denver.  One block over from my street is Santa Fe Ave, lined with shops, art galleries, restaurants, and bars. It's an up-and-coming neighborhood  (still transitioning) with mostly families and artists and some young professionals.  Although the street and surrounding houses show some character, the neighbors (especially directly next to me on each side) are all friendly and cool. I've lived in a 2 blocks radius since 2013 and love the variety, diversity, families, and art. It's also central to all destinations and attractions - I don't think I've ever paid more than $15 for an Uber to get anywhere in the Denver area from music venues on Colfax to Union Station downtown to clubs, bars, and restaurants on South Broadway or in Capitol Hill. The Denver Convention Center and Auraria

host_about:
I'm a wandering New Yawk Jew who grew up on Long Island, went to college in Burlington, VT, lived in Cambodia for a year, then Lake Tahoe for 2, Japan for a winter and finally Denver from 2013-2017 working for Big Brothers Big Sisters of Colorado. Currently, I'm back and forth between Denver and Breckenridge. In Breck I work with Ski School. I spend summers and parts of winter as a downtown Denver tour guide and I've spent a summer (winter) in Australia ski instructing (yep, there's skiing there!), but I love the mix of mountains and city and this house remains my home and where I return after you're stay!

I love to ski, bike (bmx, road, mtn bike), float down rivers, go to concerts, eat asian food, and travel. I also love helping others have fantastic vacations and experiences. 

When I travel I prefer to spend a lot of time in one country/region or if possible, live there for a bit and work. I've lived and worked in Cambodia, Japan, and Australia. Otherwise, I still enjoy weekend trips to new cities or small towns within Colorado. I love to visit and connect with friends or friends of friends in places I've never been before. 

As a host I enjoy meeting new people and hearing about their travels and where they're from.  I am happy to chat and show you around if I'm available, or completely let you do your own thing.

neighborhood_overview:
"From its early beginnings during the Gold Rush era, The Mile High City has always been a gathering place for diverse and creative people. Today, Denver is an outdoor city with a vibrant, walkable downtown offering urban adventures for all ages. Within a one-mile radius, you can kayak on the Platte River; explore some of the city's best museums; shop at art galleries and boutiques; see a Broadway touring show; enjoy live music; ride a rollercoaster or cool off in a water park; and experience exciting professional sports. Downtown is also home to many of Denver's top farm-to-table restaurants and innovative craft breweries, and the Denver Beer Trail is a great guide to sampling those local brews.

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Historic Curtis Park/RiNo home -walk to everything
description:
Bright loft-like house in Five Points and nearby Rino area - A short walking distance to the hottest restaurants, bars, breweries, and art. We are about a 15-20 minute walk to Coors Field and just a quick car ride to 16th street mall, Union Station, Mile High stadium, the Convention Center, and the Ball Arena.

The house is in an ideal location to really see all the best parts of Denver or to hop easily onto the I-25 and I-70 and view nearby attractions, like Red Rocks or Garden of the Gods.
neighborhood_overview: Curtis park is located between, Downtown and the Rino Arts district. The Rino art district has all kinds of galleries and restaurants. On the first Friday of the month, they have a first Friday gallery crawl. There is also several breweries, cideries, and wineries. Music venues include the Larimer lounge, Nocturne, Cervantes and the walnut room. It is probably 2 miles from the Avalache/Nuggets venue and 2.5 miles from Mile high stadium. City park is 2 miles east and the plate river trails are a mile north.

name: ☆South Gaylord Charm ☆ Steps to Restaurants!☆
description: Enjoy modern luxury in this spacious, updated Wash Park Bungalow circa 1917. Walk 1 block to 9 local gourmet restaurants & cafes, a bakery, ice cream, spas, yoga, boutiques, art galleries, and other shops. Stroll 6 blocks to 165-acre Washington Park with fitness center, tennis, playgrounds and running paths. Step back in time as you experience the peaceful ambiance of Denver's nicest neighborhood. NOTE: The separate & private downstairs living area may be occupied by the owner during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Old South Gaylord Historic District - This wonderful amenity is less than 1 block from the house. Featuring 9 local gourmet restaurants (many with outdoor dining), a neighborhood pub, gourmet coffee and bakery, an old-time Ice Cream Shop, specialty wine and spirits, live music on weekends, boutique shops, contemporary clothing stores, art galleries, hair and nail salons, yoga/pilates, massage studios, private aestheticians and other specialty shops.

Walk along quiet tree-lined streets while enjoying the neighborhood’s remarkable homes that are as much an expression of each resident’s unique personality as they are examples of their place and time in Denver’s history.

name: GARDEN SUITE: COMFORT & BEAUTY IN AN HISTORIC HOME
description:
THE BEAUTIFUL, UPDATED Garden Suite is a perfect retreat for a traveler, parent, doctor/ intern, or an executive. It is private, secure & well managed, with 2 private entries. Nestled in our 1912 Arts and Crafts home, this apartment is open & spacious with comfy, elegant furnishings. A gas stove in the living room warms up wintry evenings.
We are a mature couple preferring a tranquil environment, so we seek an individual who shares these values. All is provided -Just bring a suitcase!
neighborhood_overview:
We are 10 minutes due east of downtown traveling by car on 17th Street. Directly to the west is the lovely Johnson and Wales campus just two blocks away, and Park Hill, one of Denver's oldest and most elegant neighborhoods is also to the west. Park Hill features some lovely parkways, including 17th Street, Montview Boulevard, 23rd Street and Monaco Boulevard; it is a nice place to walk. (And if you're really motivated, the Zoo, City Park and Museum of Nature and Science are about 2.5 miles west.)
To the north and south are the relatively newer neighborhoods of Stapleton and Lowry, with town centers, restaurants and cafes.
Going to the east, the neighborhoods are more transitional, but changing fast as they are now anchored by the newer and huge Anshutz Medical Campus. Not to be missed is the spanking new Stanley Marketplace, housed in a former airplane factory, with brewpubs and some of the most innovative new restaurants in Denver. I-70, the main route to the mountains

host_about:
Hello, thanks for taking the time to read about us.  I came from the beautiful Finger Lakes area in upstate New York, moving here at 18 years old because I "had never known until I came to Colorado that the sun could come out in winter. "  That being the case, of course I never left. Lynne is from Colorado, with great-grandparents who grew up in Georgetown and old Snowmass. Life back then was not glamorous and a living was cobbled together from gritty pursuits such as silver mining.  
We love beautiful spaces, the outdoors, art in its many forms, and the company of good friends.  One of our careers together has been restoring neglected historic homes, and our home has been an almost two-decades long work in progress.  Restoring the apartment was one of our earlier efforts, and as is usually the case, we found architectural clues as to what our home's earlier owners had been up to.  (Such as the enormous beams that proved the claim that our house had been moved from Denver Municipal Airport in 1928. That airport became the old Stapleton Airport. We also heard from a gentleman in his ninties that he had watched it being moved.)
We believe historic homes are living history, in real time.  Having modern amenities makes them all the more appealing.
Possibly our greatest love is travel.  We agree with St. Gus, who said "The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page." And of course our favorite part of traveling is and always will be connecting with people from all walks of life, from all around the world. We're so thankful to have the opportunity to do this once more through hosting. 
Wishing you safe and happy travels!

name: Cozy 2-bedroom home in Curtis Park
description:
This home is an incredible place to stay in the heart of Curtis Park. It's close enough to RiNo that you can walk to all the bars/restaurants/dispensaries, but far enough away to be quiet and have lots of parking.

We are also across the street from a large, well-lit park that includes lots of mature trees and a tennis court. The 16th Street Mall and other attractions are a 4 minute Uber ride.
neighborhood_overview: The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery walls in this neighborhood, with its colorful and innovative street art murals in alleys and on buildings around almost every corner!

name: Retro 2 Bedroom Luxury Suite - Cap Hill
description:
Step into fun luxury living in this completely remodeled retro two bedroom apartment. No detailed was spared in this colorful mid-century modern space. Private parking behind building. Perfect for travelers, families, & long term executive rentals. Walking distance to Capitol Hill's shops, restaurants, The Denver Art Museum, Molly Brown House, and The Denver Convention Center. The Best Location for being close to Downtown and yet in a quiet residential neighborhood.
This is a 30 day listing.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is Denver's most densely populated neighborhood. It was once the home of Denver's elite and origination of Foursquare architecture in Denver. Today it consists of historic mansions, apartments and condo buildings. Because of the concentration of multi-family uses and the urban character of the neighborhood, parking is at a premium. The area is strongly influenced by the Colorado State Capitol and Downtown Denver which is adjacent to the northwest boundary of the neighborhood. Commercial uses are typically located on major arterials such as Colfax Avenue, East 8th Avenue, East 14th Avenue, East 13th Avenue, Lincoln Street and Broadway. A considerable number of mansion properties have been converted to office uses over the past several years due to zoning exemptions offered to historic structures which are zoned for residential uses.

My husband Robert and I split our time between Denver and Carbondale. Robert is a retired Professor of Human Services at Metropolitan State University of Denver and I still teach full time in the Human Services Department at Metro. Most of our time, when we are in Carbondale, is spent fishing, hiking and biking this magnificent valley , listening to music at the Aspen music festival , and watching sunsets in our beautiful backyard.

Why the Owner Chose Carbondale: 
We have always loved the Roaring Fork Valley, each town having its own unique personality and style. We have been coming here for the past 30 years, hiking and biking and camping. When this beautiful home was up for sale we couldn't resist. It was the best decision we could have made !

neighborhood_overview: This is a perfect place for folks visiting Denver for fun, business, or a stopping-off city location as one prepares to head up into the Colorado Rocky Mountains for sight-seeing, skiing, hiking, camping, and a wealth of other sports.  Our neighborhood, Cheesman Park, is a very well established and diverse residential area.  It's a wonderful part of town for walking or bicycling.  The Park is a very short walk and Historic Seventh Avenue Parkway with it's beautiful homes is two blocks to the south.  We're 10 blocks from the Cherry Creek Bike trail system with links to downtown, Auraria University Campus, Cherry Creek Reservoir State Park.  The Denver Botanic Gardens is a walk across the Park as is Congress Park with tennis courts and summertime swimming.  Grocery stores are nearby--King Soopers is 3 blocks, Whole Foods as well as Safeway are 5 blocks.  The up-scale Cherry Creek Shopping area is 1.5 miles away.  Downtown is a walkable destination and has oodles of entertainment, sports

neighborhood_overview:
Make yourself at home and relax, you are among friends and neighbors!
When you exit the complex through the front gates, take a right to get to Sloans Lake, 25th St. Joyride Brewery, many dispensaries and restaurants.
You will notice the Mexican bakery, hair stylist and nail salon across the street (Sheridan) on your left before the 7-11 store. Other eateries are down along the lake on your right. Rupert's is my favorite, and is only open for breakfast and lunch.
Barbershop and one day spa are also down Sheridan just past Starbucks, as is Northern Lights dispensary. The other way on 29th is my favorite day spa A new spirit 4840 w. 29th.
Catch the #28 Eastbound bus in the covered bus shed by the lake across the street from 7-11. Fare is $2.60 and includes a transfer. This takes you downtown where you can catch the free 16th St. Mall Shuttle. Catch the #28 bus Westbound to return home on 15th St. The drivers are all very helpful as are other rider

name: Rococo Romance: 2 Bedroom Cap Hill
description: Great for long stays- this 30 day listing is a romantic two bedroom oasis in the center of Capitol Hill awaits your entrance. This recently renovated Mansion surprises and delights in its delicate and sensual decor. Nestled in Denver’s original upscale neighborhood you are walking distance from the best Denver has to offer, including the Denver Art Museum, Colorado Convention Center, and countless gourmet restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is a quintessential Denver neighborhood, a place where politicos and hipsters cross paths. It is Denver's most densely populated neighborhood. It was once the home of Denver's elite and origination of Foursquare architecture in Denver. Today it consists of historic mansions, apartments and condo buildings. Because of the concentration of multi-family uses and the urban character of the neighborhood, parking is at a premium. The area is strongly influenced by the Colorado State Capitol and Downtown Denver which is adjacent to the northwest boundary of the neighborhood. Commercial uses are typically located on major arterials such as Colfax Avenue, East 8th Avenue, East 14th Avenue, East 13th Avenue, Lincoln Street and Broadway. A considerable number of mansion properties have been converted to office uses over the past several years due to zoning exemptions offered to historic structures which are zoned for residential uses.
