name: Large Historic House Close to Mile High & Downtown
description:
Originally built in 1912 this renovated, historical house is walking distance to Mile High Stadium. Close to LoDo, the Convention Center, Coors Field, Denver Zoo, Aquarium, Union Station, Pepsi Center, lots of breweries, and both the Art Museum and the Museum of Natural History.

Includes 5 bedrooms and the ability to sleep 16 comfortably and 20 with tight quarters, a large 2nd story patio and backyard, and full size arcade games. All races, religions, and LGTBQ are welcome here!
neighborhood_overview:
Located next to Viking park in the Highlands area there are a ton of restaurants and breweries within walking distance. Both Zuni St and Little Machine breweries are just down the block and are great places to enjoy a freshly brewed beer while checking out the local food truck.

For breakfast check out Sassafras ( call ahead as they fill up quickly), for lunch my favorite spot is Snarf's Sandwiches or Federal Bar and Grill. There are so many dinner restaurants it's hard to choose! Uncle for picture worthy ramen, Patzquaro's Mexican food, Sexy Pizza, Highland Tap and Burger, Wynkoop Brewing and Restaurant, or Williams and Graham (a cool speakeasy) which was rated the #1 cocktail bar in the country in 2016. It's also a quick 5 minute drive to downtown for great shopping during the day and great breweries, bars and clubs for a night out.

name: Awesome 2BR House at Park Hill, Denver Colorado.
description:
Sam’s home is located in the Park Hill neighborhood in Denver, CO, U.S.A. It is of the hottest & most desirable neighborhoods in Denver. Rated as Denver's best neighborhoods in 2017, as seen in Westword Magazine.

Conveniently located to choose your own adventure: nightlife in downtown, eat ethnic food along Colfax Ave, concerts & local breweries. Check out the New Stanley's Marketplace in Stapleton/Central Park a few blocks away.

Let me know how I can make your stay even better & enjoyable.
neighborhood_overview:
Lived in this house since December of 1989. It has a huge front and back yard with great public transportation.

There is a cool local coffee shops a short walk away at Oneida Park Center that currently has: Little Man Ice Cream, Spicy Thai, Famous Philly Cheese Steak & Beer Garden, Red Sauce, Allegra's Pizza, Zen Den Pet Spa. Park Hill Veterinary Medical Center, Oneida Liquors, Love Fashion Nails, Park Hill Motors, Flex Yoga + Barre.

The closest full-service grocery store is King Soopers at Quebec/26th with Starbucks inside the store. 3 blocks away from the house

The town center at Quebec/29th has a variety of restaurants and a few shops.

The Stanley Marketplace at 2501 Dallas Street has many more restaurants and shops.

Colfax Avenue has many restaurants and stores stretching for miles.

I will provide a list of my favorite places in the area

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: Eclectic Platt Park ~1 mile to DU & Hospitals
description:
Welcome to our very comfortable suite with private bath in our Platt Park home. Hosts have hospitality backgrounds; one is multi-lingual: English, French, German, Dutch & Spanish. House is across the street from a park/library & two blocks to S. Pearl Street.
DU (~ 1 mile away & 1 stop south) is accessible by light rail (about six blocks away). The University of Colorado Denver and Denver International Airport can be reached by light rail as well. The closest RTD bus stop is two blocks east.
neighborhood_overview: Very walkable and accessible to Denver's attractions.  Many restaurants (Thai, chicken, Mexican, Italian, Columbian, burgers, pizza, salads, sushi, poke, bakery, ice cream....), wine store, breweries (some with food trucks) & distilleries.  Galleries, antique stores, retail stores, and many coffee/tea shops sprinkle the neighborhood.  S. Pearl Street hosts a Farmers' Market every Sunday (9am - 1pm) from mid-May to mid-November.

COVID-19 UPDATE:  ANDRÉ & NANCY HAVE BEEN VACCINATED. 
We are 5-star rated Superhosts who maintain a "sparkling clean" reputation.  That said, we have taken extra steps towards sanitizing the suite.  Every surface will be cleaned to our usual standard.  Additionally, a disinfectant will be sprayed as a finishing touch.  All bedspreads and decorative pillows have been removed and stored.  All linens, to include sheets, blankets, towels and bathmats, dish towels and drainboard mat will be machine-washed.  As I have more than one set of everything, this rotation will ensure a completely clean and sanitized stay.
For those looking to work from the suite:  we provide a high-speed gigabit internet connection for your convenience.
The beauty of having your own code for the front door is that you come and go as you please.  Andre and I maintain a very low profile, so rest-assured that you will be able to maintain your privacy.

name: Modern Baker Victorian with HOT TUB!
description: Our remodeled home in the heart of Baker/Santa Fe Art District, offers access to one of Denver's most desirable neighborhoods with abundant walkability. The neighborhood is home to great restaurants, bars, shops and is situated less than 3 miles from downtown. It offers light rail access and a neighborhood park one block away. The house is bright and inviting with lots of amenities.   The kitchen is fully stocked.  There is an amazing back yard with a HOT TUB and room for morning yoga.
neighborhood_overview:
To the east, Baker offers you Broadway with an array of bars, amazing restaurants and even it's very own movie theater, the Mayan. To the west, Baker neighbors the Santa Fe Art District with 1st Fridays you should not miss. Art galleries, shops, bars and restaurants all get together to provide an evening of fun.
Natural Grocers and Safeway are just down the road as well as quick highway access to I25 and I70.

name: Capital Hill Condo in the heart of Denver
description: Our home is centrally located in the heart of Denver. Major amenities and sightseeing within walking distance include grocery stores, museums, galleries, library, restaurants, music venues and more.  There is a large private balcony, rooftop deck, sauna, basic workout room, bike storage room and laundry room.  Almost everything is within walking distance but there is also Denver B-cycle, car2go and eGo CarShare. We have topnotch AC/heating, fans, Roku TV, fully equipped kitchen and parking pass!

name: Mid-Century Modern - Close to Cherry Creek / I-25
description: Welcome! My home is a remodeled mid-century modern, open plan that is just a few minutes away from light-rail, and Cherry Creek. It's very easy to access I-25 and go either to the Tech Center or Downtown if you're driving. No matter your background, all are welcome.
neighborhood_overview: I'm sandwiched between two mid-century modern housing developments. To the north is "Krisana Park"... A mid-century enclave that is fondly referred to as "Leichler" since it thinks it is "like Eichler". To the east is "Lynwood"... Very similar houses and very much in demand. This house was built in 1958 and is one of a kind. Other stuff? We have an authentic french bakery two blocks away (Detour) as well as an independent coffee house: Sojourners.  The bus route begins a block away. The Lightrail "Colorado Station" is a mile's walk and can take you either south to the Tech Center, east to DIA or north to Downtown Denver. Cherry Creek is about 10 mins by car and has great shopping, restaurants and movie theaters. If you love gourmet, niche pizza, we have a fantastic neighborhood bistro, "Esters" that opened about a year ago. Their nachos are mouth-watering. They have a few awesome salads, some sandwiches and of course, what most people go for... The pizza (and the craft beers). Think ar
amenities: ["Hangers", "Essentials", "Dishwasher", "Shampoo", "Hair dryer", "Oven", "Dishes and silverware", "Single level home", "Air conditioning", "Indoor fireplace", "Smoke alarm", "First aid kit", "Carbon monoxide alarm", "Fire extinguisher", "Washer", "Heating", "Kitchen", "Refrigerator", "TV with standard cable", "Cooking basics", "Extra pillows and blankets", "Backyard", "Hot water", "Coffee maker", "Dryer", "Free street parking", "Patio or balcony", "Stove", "Wifi", "Bed linens", "Bathtub"]
host_about: I've lived in the USA for 30+ years after narrowly escaping a rainy future in England. I can discuss American politics but not English ones, unless you count the politics of the school playground. I love chess. I've won one lottery (although there was no cash involved, just an elusive Green Card). I play six-degrees-of-separation for fun and find that in Denver, it's usually only two or three degrees (even if it's the President or a Hollywood movie star and sometimes it's one and the same). I am completely in love with my dog, Bodhi (a non-shedding, Portuguese Water Dog), who lives up to his name in every way (a being of wisdom and enlightenment). I am bummed (how's that for eloquence) that neither DaVinci or Einstein are still anchored to Terra Firma because I'd love to meet them, sit around a fountain somewhere (hopefully with an Americano in hand) and ask them what their take is on "Life, The Universe and Everything"... (Thank you Douglas Adams.) I love "Game of Thrones", "Homeland" and all things "Shameless"... And I'm just a little obsessed with the whole mid-century modern thing.

name: Tranquil Urban Retreat in Congress Park
description:
Brew up some coffee in a kitchenette with an exposed brick wall and dark granite counters. Read a book on a comfy, premium sectional sofa in a living area with a decorative brick fireplace and calm decor within this stylishly decorated and cozy apartment. All the convenience and excitement of the city, with a small-town feel. Close to Denver sights, parks, bars and restaurants, yet on a quiet tree-lined street -- the best of both worlds!

Front door keyless entry and self check-in to apartment.
neighborhood_overview: Set in the historic residential neighborhood of Congress Park, this apartment is blocks away from great dining and shopping. It’s walking distance from the Denver Museum of Nature and Science and the Zoo within City Park, as well as Congress Park, the neighborhood's namesake, Cheesman Park, and many fantastic dining and bar options.

Location, one block from DU! Architect designed modern home. Less than 3 blocks to light rail. . Everything else (Chipotle, bank, restaurants, gas) one block away! rail to Downtown 10 minutes. Completely furnished. Perfect for international students. Live with a family and pets!
License 2019-BFN-0011858

host_about: I am a mother of three children. Our family lives in Denver, Colorado. We are very active and love to ski. One daughter graduated from Carleton College, another daughter graduated from Harvard, and our son is attending Carleton College. My husband is an architect. We also have a place on Nantucket, MA and Jackson Hole, Wy too, if you are interested in renting there!

name: Modern Townhome - Private Room (1) - PT Roommate
description:
I travel often for work - between Seattle/Nashville/Avon/Denver. My small pup Yuki is usually with me!

Cuddle up with cozy blankets on the couch while you enjoy a spacious, airy, open and contemporary townhouse in a fantastic location 5 minutes from downtown Denver by car. Biking/walking distance to the Pepsi Center, Broncos Stadium, Sloan's Lake and Edgewater. Great for outdoor lounging and grilling ... or enjoy downtown activities ... or hanging out at home playing board/video games!

•1 block from a bus stop to downtown (20)

name: Private Basement Suite - the Heart of Central Park
description:
If you’re looking for quiet time or conversation, you’ll find it. Many of our guests have become family. Some simply want a place to crash! We’ll be good to you no matter what.

You have your own bedroom, bathroom, family room, coffee maker, and mini fridge. Hang out and stream Netflix or head to Puddle Jumper Pool, the Stanley Marketplace, the Town Center, or downtown Denver. Easy parking and access to Stapleton and hospitals. Close to Dick’s Sporting Goods Park.



License 2021-BFN-0008898
neighborhood_overview:
Stapleton is about 5 miles from downtown and Cherry Creek. We are a community with many families, parks, schools, and restaurants. Our neighbors are like family! Feel free to ask anyone for help or suggestions.

If you are looking for restaurants and shopping in the area, check out the Stanley Marketplace. You can walk! Plenty of restaurants, retail, coffee shops, ice cream, etc. I recommend using Yelp to determine quality of restaurant and proximity.

host_about:
Scott and I bonded over many things - one is our passion for travel. It’s in the DNA of our relationship. COVID may have blocked some of our adventures - like it has for everyone - AND it’s definitely granted us new ones!

We love being hosts. We love meeting new people, talking, and not talking. We value the inclusion, sharing, and connected culture that Airbnb offers. 

It reminds me of my great grandmother taking on “boarders!!” They seemed to be where her life stories came from.

description: Featured in Dwell Magazine! Enjoy a modern, luxe, eco-conscious home in LoHi, one of Denver’s most interesting neighborhoods with the ability to walk to restaurants, coffee shops, and bars.

The Lower Highland neighborhood is only a short bike ride to downtown, and is growing quickly. That means there are many attractive dining and shopping options within walking distance of this home.
Our home is located within a neighborhood, so we do ask guests politely respect that fact by ensuring music and voices are kept low after 10pm when outside.

name: Sparkling Carriage House near Downtown and Rino
description:
We pride ourselves on keeping the cleanest Airbnb in Denver. Don't be fooled by dingy hotels or Airbnb units hosted by management companies that only care about the bottom line. Amy and I meticulously clean the unit ourselves after each booking and guarantee our guests a comfortable stay. You will not be disappointed.

Guest will have full access to the carriage house except for the garage space.

As little or as much as you like. We are here to make your stay enjoyable and we are always available to answer any questions and give recommendations. We are available by texts, email or message.

The apartment is in the historic Whittier neighborhood. It's less than a mile from the popular RiNo Art District which is known for its industrial street art, coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and breweries. It's a fun area with tons to do.

Walking distance to City Park and Golf Course and the Denver Zoo. Walking and biking distance to nearby neighborhood hot
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the historic Whittier neighborhood. It's less than a mile from the popular RiNo Art District which is known for its industrial street art, coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and breweries. It's a fun area with tons to do.

host_about:
Born and raised in Michigan but have been living in Colorado for the past 10 years. I consider myself an avid do-it-yourselfer. If I don't know how to do something, I cannot rest until I figure it out. I enjoy the outdoors, specifically camping and most recently whitewater rafting. 

When traveling, I mostly look for seclusion and try to stay away from tourist traps at all costs. I want to experience the places no one knows about and love getting tips from the local hosts when renting on AirBnB. 

When hosting, I try to give the guests as much space as possible. I love to give tips on where to go and where to dine in order to give our guests an amazing experience that they may not have had if they just looked at travel guides on the internet. So please, ask me questions! I have good advice!

description:
We offer an immaculate private guesthouse that is marijuana friendly. We just ask that you smoke outside.

We are located in the N. Denver neighborhood of Inspiration Point. Our guest house is a separate 400 sq ft brick unit with your own private driveway and patio.

10 min away from downtown Denver
30 min from Denver International Airport
20 min from Red Rocks
30 min Boulder
40 min from Rocky Mountain National Park
50 min from the first ski resorts
neighborhood_overview: Inspiration Point boasts a 75 mile view of the northern Front Range of the Rocky Mountains. We highly recommend walking the park to capture this magnificent view. We are the northern corner of the city of Denver with some incredible locations in walking distance like the famous Lakeside Amusement Park only three blocks away, Willis Case Golf Course just across the street to name a few. Like craft beers and interested in recreational marijuana? Tennyson Street is a lively neighborhood of bars, tattoo shops, restaurants and dispensaries only one mile away. There is a lot to experience in our part of north Denver.

name: Stroll Capitol Hill from a Cozy Foursquare Home
description:
1 queen bed in bedroom, 2 twin beds in living room sofa. WIFI, TV w/cable included. Keyless entry makes for an easy visit.

The space is 1 block from a city bus stop and 2 blocks to Denver B-cycle. There is street parking, however we recommend walking, biking, or Uber/Lyft ride anywhere in the city.

name: Bright Sunny Fourplex Unit in Clayton Neighborhood
description:
Have a bright, recently-updated row house (one unit in a quadplex building) all to yourself in Denver's historic Clayton Neighborhood. Quiet and residential, but still close to the heart of the city.

This unit is furnished ideally for a couple where one or both of you are working from home. Airy and colorful decor includes contemporary touches, local fine art pieces, and antique heirloom details. I go for a clean, minimalist vibe.
neighborhood_overview:
Some quotes on Clayton from Urbanist Insider:
"All in all, Clayton rocks because of its proximity to everywhere else in Denver, without being a busy thoroughfare. Neighbors are friendly and likely to greet you as you walk down the street. Parking is always available. Sirens are not common, and most cars drive safely through the ‘hood. The disadvantage to Clayton is that it’s so darn residential. Without much to walk to, you will definitely want to consider having a car to get around. Busses come down the major streets and bikes are certainly an option -- but having your own vehicle would be preferable here. If you don’t mind the quiet, check out Clayton."

There's not much in close proximity as far as local eateries or grocery stores, but I do recommend Lucero's down the street for fab burritos and green chili, and the tamales at Tres Girasoles are also bomb.

name: Beautiful Home Away from Home
description: Just renovated, second floor, two Bedroom, two bath 1200 square foot condo in Stapleton neighborhood. This is a stand alone building with vaulted ceilings, large open living and dining area, huge kitchen with all new stainless steel appliances and gas cooking. Beautiful quartz counter tops. .  Central Air conditioning, washer and dryer, small deck.
neighborhood_overview:
The Central Park neighborhood of Denver is located in the Northeast part of the city with quick access to DIA and downtown via RTD or car. The property is less than a mile from the RTD Station with ample parking. Within the neighborhood is a large selection of restaurants along with the new Stanley Marketplace that houses retail stores, brew pubs, restaurants, a yoga studio, ice cream, and much more.

(URL HIDDEN)

The town center is also close in proximity to the property. There are three grocery stores near by, a recreation center with indoor pool, parks, 5 outdoor pools, Sunday farmers market and evening concerts and events. name: Historic, Artsy 2 story house in the Heart of RiNo
description:
Enjoy the best of Denver in the heart of the vibrant RiNo neighborhood in our circa 1890 two story brick home. Artistically decorated and stocked with amenities for your friends and family. One block from coffee shops, restaurants, breweries, shopping and live music. Two very large and two small bedrooms sleeps at least 7, fenced in backyard and key-less check-in.
5 min walk to Curtis Park, 18 min walk to Coors Field, shares an alley with Crema Coffee, Owlbear BBQ, Our Mutual Friend Brewery.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a walking/biking neighborhood. Just about anything you need is within a few minutes stroll. That said, parking can be hard to come by streetside on the weekends, but readily available within a block or two anytime. Uber/Lyft/Taxi's are recommended over a rental car. If you do have a car, we have a parking pass for the block in front of the house but it absolutely must be returned upon checkout, they are hard to get re-issued!
We are in the city! The neighborhood is a mix of residents who are third and fourth generation, new additions to the hip new restaurant and art scene as well as a fair number of Denver's transient/vagrant population- as is the case with most larger cities in this day and age. We haven't had any safety issues at the house, but please use common sense and keep doors locked and gates closed. Also, we encourage not leaving anything in vehicles.

name: Luxurious, Cozy & Quiet Home Centrally Located
description:
Enjoy your stay in this beautiful, well appointed home in the amazing Central Park neighborhood in Denver, Colorado. It has everything you need and more to have a comfortable stay and an enjoyable experience. You will feel right at home.

Central Park is a quiet Denver neighborhood conveniently located between the airport and downtown, centrally located to everything the Rocky Mountains have to offer. If you plan to stay close to home, there is much to enjoy all within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
Whether you are traveling on business or with family/friends you will love this home!

Super convenient to practically everything Denver and the mountains have to offer; the new A line light rail train takes you to downtown in less than 15 minutes and to Denver International Airport in around 20 minutes. Restaurants, Starbucks, entertainment and shopping (including a Super Target, Liquor Store, locally-owned coffee shop, and a convenience store) are within walking distance.

This area offers 36 miles of biking and walking trails, 100+ acres of parks as well as seven community pools (one conveniently located across the street from my home).

This area has many free activities during the summer (concerts, theatre, movies, farmer's markets, etc.) all within walking distance.

host_about: My wife and I bought this wonderful beach condo in March of 2014 so that we could have a place to take our 2 children to escape the Colorado snow. We come here frequently and keep the place equipped with anything we like to have while on vacation. We love the mix of foreign and familiar that Puerto Rico has to offer. Also, there is so much culture, history, and nature to appreciate on the island as opposed to resorts whose only feature is the beach. Before buying this condo, we stayed at several of the other larger condo developments in Isla Verde. The building we chose is not as expansive as the others, but it has quicker beach access and is really in the best central location on the strip for access to restaurants, casinos, etc.

name: Updated Victorian Bungalow in Sunnyside
description: Comfy and inviting home close to everything, minutes from I-70 & I-25, downtown, restaurants, sporting, and cultural centers. The house has been lovingly updated while keeping some Victorian charm. Located in a quiet, walkable neighborhood you have the whole house with multiple outside areas and an off-street, lit parking spot. Great for a family or a couple! Guests receive a manual made by the third generation owner that will guide you through the city and state bite by bite and sight by sight.
neighborhood_overview:
Sunnyside is one of Denver's most desirable neighborhoods, in large part due to its restaurants, bars, closeness to the downtown attractions, two minutes off both major highways, parks and more. One of my favorite things about living there has been how quiet and cozy the street is while having so much so close by, an urban oasis for your adventures.

The neighborhood has become more and more walkable and bike friendly every year with new breweries, restaurants, museums and activities added the time.

My detailed “Native” guide will highlight much of what there is to discover in the area, whether it is fine dining across the street or a street fair across town.

name: Enjoy the Logan Urban Refuge in comfort!
description: Separate carriage house apartment with its own entrance. Enjoy the comfort of our recently built, very CLEAN, fully-equipped carriage house (2nd story) apartment in historic Speer neighborhood.  In the spirit of keeping travel affordable we have not raised our prices in over two years - even though our operating costs have increased. Free street parking. Sorry, we do not allow pets or Emotional Support Animals. (Service Animals allowed per ADA)
neighborhood_overview: Seventy percent of the homes were built in the 1890's- 1910.  The neighborhood is a mixture of old Victorian and Arts & Crafts Style 100+ year old houses along with old and new apartments.  There are local businesses scattered within and a major business district (local shops, restaurants, and bars) is a 5 minute walk away.  It's a very popular neighborhood with Millennials and Gen-Xers. Excellent location if you are in town to enjoy an event at the Ball Arena, Denver Performing Arts Center, Convention Center, Red Rocks Amphitheater or do business at the State Capitol or any State agency.  It's also close to the Civic Center Park where lots of public events (festivals, demonstrations, cultural attractions) are scheduled throughout the year.

name: Modern Carriage House Loft in Popular Platt Park
description:
No smoking on property and No 420. Our modern carriage house is centered in a vibrant historic Denver neighborhood. The interior is bright and airy with vaulted ceilings and huge windows. The house features a kitchen, living area and separate bedroom.

There are many award winning nearby restaurants and breweries (even a couple distilleries) all in walking distance. The light rail station is a convenient 10 minute walk, the bus station is around the corner. Uber is available in minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
The carriage house is one block off "Antique Row", a section of Broadway with many small antique shops and a several musical instrument shops.
Pearl Street in the center of the neighborhood has a number of local restaurants, small shops and art galleries. On Sunday mornings in the summer, two blocks of Pearl Street are closed off for the weekly farmer's market. Ideal for walking, there are many people out with their dogs. You are likely to encounter: Huskies, Bernese Mountain dogs, German Shepherds, Labs and other large breeds.
Our neighborhood was once part of the city of "South Denver". There are many homes from the late 1800s. In the 1920s, many bungalows were added. In the center of Platt Park neighborhood, is the Denver city park, Platt Park. The old mayor of South Denver's house sits at the north end of the park.

My wife and I moved to Denver over ten years ago to enjoy the active Colorado lifestyle. We both enjoy all types of outdoor activities and have completed Full and Half Ironman length triathlons in Cozumel, California and Colorado. We travel as often as we can and are both amateur photographers.
We love food and drinks from all over the world. Everything from fine dining to exotic street food.
While we love traveling and adventure, Platt Park is our home. We enjoy walking our dogs on the tree lined streets. There are great friendly restaurants, breweries, wine bars and distilleries all in walking distance. Nearby Wash Park, is great for a walk or jog around the lakes. There is a Denver B, bike rental station at the park. We love to talk about travel, food and outdoors. If you need any recommendations, we are happy to help out.

name: Charming garden level suite with private entrance
description: The Nest is nestled in a prime location near shops, restaurants, DU, Safeway, and light-rail.  You have a separate entrance to a fully remodeled basement apartment including 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, living room, work-space, laundry room and kitchenette.  You have your choice between Marriott pillows, My Pillow pillows, and some temper-pedic pillows. (I take my pillows seriously!) There are 14 restaurants of all ethnicities within 400 yards, and a Starbucks only 100 yards away. Welcome to The Nest!
neighborhood_overview:
Cory-Merrill is a HOT neighborhood, just having been voted the second Most Livable Neighborhood in Denver by 5280 Magazine. If you can walk 100 yards to a mile you've got yourself a wide variety of restaurants and shops from South Gaylord, DU, Wash Park, and Colorado Blvd.

You in the mood for Thai food? Boom, 2.5 blocks away.
Vietnamese food? Boom, 1 block away.
Italian, pizza, Chinese, Asian, Mexican, and the good ol' Ihop all within 1-3 blocks. If you can walk a full mile it opens your options 10-fold!

Besides food, there are also a number of parks near by, the closest is 1.5 blocks away with basketball court and tennis courts for your use.

It's nice to have switched places, where other people are traveling and I can spoil them! When I bought this house it was such a cozy place for me that I started calling it The Nest. I'm an author, speaker, and run a bustling little publishing business. I love this neighborhood because everything is walkable, transportation is easy, and moreover, there are 14 restaurants within 400 yards of all ethnicities! Denver is my great love and I'm anxious to share it with you, or leave you entirely alone if you just want to relax and refresh. My goal is to ensure you love your stay at The Nest.

host_about:
We are lucky to professionally host many properties in the Capitol Hill/Uptown/City Park/LoHi/Wash Park/Stapleton areas. We are in our 7th year of hosting and have hosted over 6,000+ stays meeting 10s of thousands of guests from all over the world. We personally greet many of our guests.
Gretchen is an adopted Colorado native of 25 years - 12 years in Vail and 13 fabulous years living in Capitol Hill and Baker in Denver. Jim was born in Denver and his entire family lives here. We LOVE this city and this state - it has so much to offer visitors and residents. The culture, diversity, performing arts and culinary scene are just a few of the things that make us smile here every day.
We truly enjoy helping people connect to the best of the best local gems, whether it's one of our hidden comedy venues or to the newest and most innovative restaurants. Our food truck scene is out of this world, we have the most amazing bands locally and headliners that come from across the country and around the world to perform here.
Jim has an unbelievable wealth of knowledge of Colorado microbrews and can be booked to guide you through some of the best local craft breweries, tailored to your specific taste. Budtenders can be booked for an informative, fun and unique dispensary tour, to discover the truth behind the cannabis lifestyle in Denver. Gretchen can take you for a progressive happy hour, for "single bite" bests at some Denver's best restaurants off the beaten path.
Looking for comedy, spend an evening with both of us at hidden venues laughing with some of Denver's best local comics.
We are blessed to enjoy a great rapport with our guests and respect their privacy. Please communicate any special needs or concerns about your trip. It's our pleasure to be of service.
Please check out our other listings if your dates don't coincide with what you see available on the calendar. And feel free to contact us if you don't find availability when you need it, we might be able to help you find another Airbnb listing that works for your needs. 
On occasion, Gretchen can be of assistance in helping those who are relocating to the area, whether you are looking to rent or buy, contact me with your specifics and I'll see what I can do to help.

name: Charming North Denver Home with all the Amenities!
description:
This Newly Remodeled 800 sqft private basement apartment features a full kitchen, large living room, 50" 4K TV w/ Roku, fast Wi-Fi, a master bedroom with comfy memory foam queen bed & en suite bathroom, and a den/2nd bedroom with a queen bed.

This unit is loaded with space & amenities, including a full-size kitchen (microwave, dishwasher, oven, dishes, cookware, etc), access to a fenced backyard deck/patio ( yard is smoking/420 friendly), on-street parking, a washer/dryer, & a private entrance.
neighborhood_overview:
The West Highlands is one of Denver's hottest neighborhoods. It is a short walk to two major shopping and dining areas and downtown Denver is short and cheap uber ride away. We are also close to Mile High Stadium if you plan to visit for a Broncos game!

One of the best part of being on the west side of the city is that great nature and Hikes in Golden and Red Rocks are a 20 minute drive away without having to deal with downtown traffic/parking. On top of that, the location is still very accessible to all of the great things downtown has to offer.

name: Denver Home Away from Home- 4 Bedroom House
description:
Perfect for a family or couple staying a month or more.

You'll find our spacious, 4-bedroom home on a quaint tree-lined street minutes from Denver's largest park, the Museum of Nature and Science, The Denver Zoo, Botanic Gardens, local restaurants, bars and so much more. This sweet retreat holds 4 bedrooms, one and a half baths, a large back yard, vine-covered patio and many other amenities . Our historic 4-bedroom home is an ideal destination for longterm stays.

No pets. No smoking.
neighborhood_overview:
NEIGHBORHOOD/LOCATION
Our house is in South Park Hill, one of Denver's established residential neighborhoods. The streets are lined with large trees and mostly single family houses. The neighborhood is safe, relatively quiet, and surprisingly close to downtown.

Park Hill is on the edge of Denver's largest park -- the one with the zoo and nature and science museum in it.

The view from behind the museum is iconic: lake, park, skyline, and mountains. Watching the sunset (or even the reflection of the sunrise) from here is sublime.

There's also a large water feature behind the museum for kids to play in during the summer and paddle boats and surreys to rent from a stand near the park pavilion.

For runners, there is a 5K path that winds through the park; the outside of the park is 3 miles long -- 3.5 miles if you go around the golf course.

name: Beautiful Victorian Oasis just steps from 32nd.
description:
This airy, bright, warm and comfortable Victorian is the perfect calm haven to escape to. You will have the entire house to yourself. The backyard is your own oasis, complete with a 'secret garden' feel.

There are yoga mats and weights in the mud room off the kitchen if you’d like to do yoga on the patio in the morning.
neighborhood_overview:
The West Highland neighborhood is one of the most coveted neighborhoods to live in in Denver. Cute Victorian homes and bungalows grace the streets. 3 awesome business districts are within walking distance.

32nd and Lowell is literally just steps from our front door. Full of great restaurants, bars and bakeries you can find just about everything you need. The best restaurant is Il Camino - fresh Mexican and is literally around the block from our house.

Mead Street is a great dive bar, Happy Bakeshop has award winning cupcakes, and the Denver Bread Company does unbelievable bread (and they offer free samples!). If you're looking for great Italian check out Spatolla and if you want Indian go to Himichulli.

The massages at LoDo massage are awesome and Highlands Pilates has a great workout.

LoHi - with it's trendy bars and fine food is about a 5 minute drive (20 minute walk) towards the city center. Root Down, Linger and Postino are awesome pl

name: "Blue Ox" Charming 2 Bedroom Triplex - S Broadway
description:
Located in the heart of trendy South Broadway, literally steps away from Denver's favorite bars, restaurants, boutiques, thrift stores, music venues, & rooftop patios . Blue Ox is a 5 minute uber or lyft from downtown and a short walk to the Light Rail. Daily scooter and bicycle rentals located just around the corner. Walking distance to wash park, grocery and liquor stores, movie theaters and pharmacies. 1 -2 hours from Summit County ski resorts. Parking available upon request.

*No Parties*
neighborhood_overview: My home is located in the heart of trendy South Broadway, steps away (literally) to some of the most popular bars, restaurants, boutiques, thrift stores and music venues Denver has to offer. You are steps away from coffee, breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, and so much more. You can walk to go bowling, to the movies, salons, post office, urgent care, pharmacy, grocery store and more!

name: Suite Tennyson at Sloan's Lake
description:
Private, spacious, modern, can't beat the location! 1/2 block to Sloan's Lake Park, 2 blocks to "SloHi" (brewery, coffee shop , bagels, sports bar), 10-15 minute walk to Edgewater, Highlands Square, or Berkely / Tennyson St Cultural District. 7 min drive to downtown.

Quiet & safe neighborhood. We are a family with young children, you will hear us upstairs during our morning & evening routines.

Guests are welcomed to use back yard patio & amenities. Smoking is permitted outside including 420.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and we ask guests to be respectful of the neighbors. It's great for walking as there are many nearby destinations and relatively little vehicle traffic. There's a fair amount of pedestrians going to and from the park and plenty of bikes and bike lanes. You can rent a bike from the bike shop 2 blocks up the street.

name: Capital Hill Condo - Top Floor - Great location
description:
In the heart of Capitol Hill

Beautiful condo in desirable neighborhood centrally located between Downtown and Cherry Creek Shopping Center.

Top floor condo with good sized balcony very near Governor's Park. The complex is very well secured.

In the middle of everything: Fine restaurants, sidewalk cafes, bars, Trader Joe's. The old town Denver feel and close to everything downtown has to offer.

1 reserved on-site parking spot.

2017-BFN-0006346
neighborhood_overview:
One of the best neighborhoods in Denver, full of tree-lined streets and historic homes (some of them are huge!), boutiques, cafes and restaurants. organic grocers and indie shops and a new wine bar. Angelo's Taverna, Little India, Moe's Bagels, Brothers BBQ, Trader Joe's is just around the corner. It's all here, walk-able, bike-able and beautiful. You can't walk very far without smelling something delicious cooking.
And if you do need to get downtown, it's just a few minutes away. Art Museum 1.3 Miles, City Park (with a great zoo and Museum of Nature and Science)- 3.5 miles, Coors Field - 2.6 miles, Mile High Stadium - 2.7 miles, Governor's Park - about 100 steps ;-)
Someone said in an AirBnB review of a condo here: "This condo provides a perfect lifestyle for those who like to be in the middle of it all." But it's on a dead end street so it's actually very quiet.

name: Pool/Central Park/Hospitals/Private entrance
description: While you're most likely to choose this 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom Denver short term rental for its location and convenience to the light rail, you'll also enjoy its sparkling newness and welcoming amenities. - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, central air conditioning, Smart TV and Apple TV, full-size washer and dryer, free FAST WiFi and a community pool and park directly across the street

name: Private King BDR & Bath * Ideal Location
description:
*Welcome to my Home -- it's comfy, modern, quiet & clean!

*Ideal Location: only 5 min to the highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit -- close to downtown, DU & Cherry Creek -- safe residential neighborhood -- easy access to public transit -- walk to stores & restaurants.

*Private Room: very comfy king bed -- space heater & fans -- smart tv.

*Private Bathroom.

*Kitchen, Living/Dining Rooms and Back Patio --a great place to eat & relax.

*self check-In -- central AC/heat -- free parking -- fast WIFI.
neighborhood_overview:
*My Home is in an ideal location.

*Virginia Village is residential, but also has an urban vibe. It is safe & walk-able, including at night--many stores & restaurants (Starbucks, Safeway, Jamba Juice, Best Buy, Hacienda Colorado, Jaya Asian Grill) are nearby.

*Free Parking: in the driveway / carport or on the street.

*Directly across the street is a church, which has a nice park.

*Easy access to Public Transit: light rail Colorado Station and buses #40 & 46.

*The highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit is only 5 min away, yet the House is quiet, so you can easily access all-things-Denver (downtown, DU, Cherry Creek & more) and beyond (the mountains).

name: Romantic Period House Close to Hip Galleries and Brew Pubs
description:
Built in 1895 and originally used as a tailor shop, this unique building has all the charm of a historic victorian but with modern conveniences. Located on the first floor of a 4 unit building. The apartment is 730 square feet with 12 foot ceilings, large windows, an original parquet floor and a full length antique mirror. There is a porch with a swing, private parking, a washer/dryer and all the essentials to make your stay comfortable.

Guests will have full access to the entire first floor apartment. There is a full kitchen, washer and dryer, heat and AC. The unit has one reserved off-street parking spot as well as ample street parking year round.

The house is in the heart of the historic Curtis Park neighborhood and the Rino Arts District. Easily walk to restaurants, breweries, galleries, and hip and happening places. It's a great place for exploring Denver as well as trips to the mountains.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the heart of the historic Curtis Park neighborhood and the Rino Arts District. Easily walk to restaurants, breweries, galleries, and hip and happening places. It's a great place for exploring Denver as well as trips to the mountains.

name: Modern Townhome - Private Rooms (2) - PT Roommate
description:
I travel often for work - between Seattle/Nashville/Avon/Denver. My small pup Yuki is usually with me!

Cuddle up with cozy blankets on the couch while you enjoy a spacious, airy, open and contemporary townhouse in a fantastic location 5 minutes from downtown Denver by car. Biking/walking distance to the Pepsi Center, Broncos Stadium, Sloan's Lake and Edgewater. Great for outdoor lounging and grilling ... or enjoy downtown activities ... or hanging out at home playing board/video games!
neighborhood_overview:
My place is just a couple of blocks East of Sloan's Lake, which has a trail for walking and biking that's about 2 miles around. There's lots of nature within walking distance, but most restaurants require driving. Several awesome neighborhoods are within a 5-10 minute drive including West Highlands, Lower Highlands, Jefferson Park, and Downtown.

Excellent central location
•5 minutes from downtown Denver (by car or 10 minutes by scooter/ebike)
•1 block away from Hallack Park and Sloan’s Lake (walk and bike trail)
•1 block from a bus stop to downtown
•0.5 blocks away from Colfax and Federal (bus/train to downtown)
•0.5 miles from the Broncos’ stadium and the Alamo Drafthouse
•1 mile away from bustling LoHi (Lower Highlands) neighborhoods

name: Centrally located, modern home in Downtown Denver!
description: Experience urban luxury in this 3-bed, 2.5-bath haven in Denver's Santa Fe Arts District! Seamlessly blending historic charm with modern elegance, this stylish home offers a tranquil retreat. Work from the beautiful office, whip up meals in the chef's kitchen, gather around the outdoor fire pit, or unwind in the cozy media room. Explore nearby galleries, boutiques, and attractions like Meow Wolf Denver, Ball Arena, and the Denver Art Museum. Your perfect Mile High City escape awaits!
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of the vibrant Santa Fe Arts District, this home puts you just steps away from galleries, boutiques, restaurants, and nightlife hotspots! Moreover, you'll find yourself a mere 5-minute drive from some of Denver's premier attractions, including the captivating Meow Wolf Denver, the dynamic Ball Arena, the renowned Denver Art Museum, and the bustling Denver Convention Center.

-Meow Wolf Denver (1.3 miles • 5 mins)
-Invesco Field at Mile High (1.3 miles • 4 mins)
-Ball Arena (1.2 miles • 5 mins)
-Denver Convention Center (1 mile • 5 mins)

name: Lovely Spacious Home - Univ Park/Central Denver
description: This University Park/Central Denver home with easy access to downtown is truly a fantastic home away from home. Perfectly located if you’re in Denver on business, want to be close to U. of Denver (DU), explore Downtown, experience Colorado outdoor adventures, or attend a conference/wedding/concert/sporting event. This home is ideally situated to suit your needs whether a group of 2-4 or needing to sleep up to 10 people.
neighborhood_overview:
The University Park neighborhood is named after University of Denver which is the local highlight in this area of Denver. This home is located on a quiet street in close proximity to many points of interest:
5 min drive to University of Denver (within walking distance)
5 min drive & walking distance to many shopping centers on Colorado Blvd.
5 min or less drive to Colorado Blvd Light Rail Station which connects to lower Downtown's Union Station and many other Denver stops.
5 min drive to interstate I25 which connects people to Downtown Denver, all major Sports Stadiums, Theater/Convention center district.
15 min drive to the amazing Cherry Creek shopping district.
5 min drive & walking distance to beautiful parks with children's playground (Observatory Park). The gorgeous Washington Park with lake, rental boats, running/biking trails, playground, and beautiful gardens is a 10 min or less drive away.

name: Private 1B/1B in Very Walkable LoHi Neighborhood
description:
Private bedroom with queen size bed and an adjacent/detached private bathroom on the ground floor of a townhome in LoHi (lower highlands), Denver.
The closet has plenty of space for luggage and also contains a floor fan, ironing board, iron, curling iron, hairdryer, laptop tray, umbrellas, extra pillows, blankets and towels. There’s also a mini refrigerator and Keurig in the bedroom.
There's nothing else on the ground floor except for the entrance which makes for a private and quiet stay.
neighborhood_overview: LoHi (lower highlands) is one of the most trendy neighborhoods in Denver for restaurants, bars, breweries and nightlife.  Additionally, downtown is easily accessible via a Lyft/Uber or you can walk down to the bridge and across Confluence Park to get downtown. All three of the stadiums, Coors Field, Ball Arena (formerly Pepsi Center), and Empower Field (Mile High Stadium) are all within a few minutes drive as well (I often walk to them also).

As an entrepreneur I've started, built and run a few small companies.  I enjoy the outdoors and home renovations! 

Currently living in Tampa, though I've spent time in NYC, Seattle, Kansas City, Chicago and Salt Lake City previously.

When I visit a new place, I get wrapped up in the tourism, but ensure that I seek out the restaurant favorites of the locals and any hidden treasures the locals may be able to recommend. name: Admire the Eclectic Aesthetic at a Historic City Sanctuary
description:
Soak up the vintage charm of this basement hideaway built by a silver baron in 1891, featuring original red brick walls and oriental rugs. Old England meets the Wild West, while mementos from international travels add even more character.

We will keep you safe during your visit. We have a dedicated professional cleaner for the apartment, who cleans and disinfects between guests based on CDC guidelines. There are sanitizers and cleaning supplies for your use in the apartment, and you need never meet us.

The apartment is part of the original basement from 1891, so it has exposed granite exterior walls and interior brick walls. The apartment includes a newly renovated kitchen and bathroom, new heating, tile floors, oriental carpets, and a new (firm) bed. Air conditioning was installed in July 2019 to keep you cool.

The apartment is decorated with Colorado antiques, with the exception of the new bed and new sofa bed. Much like when the house was originall
neighborhood_overview: The property is located very close to the longest and once considered the most wicked main street in America, Colfax Avenue. Visit Cheeseman Park for a walk, connect with plants at Denver Botanic Gardens, and jog to the pool at Congress Park.

host_about:
Originally from Sweden, I have lived in many cities, including London, Moscow, and Boston, before settling in Denver.  My first memories of traveling are of staying at Bed & Breakfasts around England and Wales, from castles to working sheep farms.  The castles made a big impression, I’m a romantic to this day but stone is cold. The sheep - well, they’re loud and they have ugly teeth.

My hosting style is to greet and interact with you if you want, and else stay out of your way.   If you want tips for things to do, eat, or drink around the neighborhood, let us know; we love our neighborhood.  I am also a member of the Denver Historical Society, and am always happy to talk about Denver's history and that of our home.

 We've tried to anticipate everything you may need to enjoy your stay.  Since we live on-site, if you need anything else, please just let us know.  We look forward to exceeding your expectations.

I like to read, travel, cook, knit, embroider and garden.

Born in Sweden, US citizen, graduate from Amos Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth, and the Stockholm School of Finance.  Married with three growing children, a dog and two cats.

name: 30+ Day Rental in Capitol Hill
description:
Have a sip of Rum in this bright garden level 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of Capitol Hill. Enjoy it's colorful decor while steps away from museums, the convention center and restaurants that Denver is famous for. You might swear you see a colorful tropical bird fly above this perfectly centrally located apartment. Book today and brighten your Denver stay with an electric tropical vibe. Private parking is just steps from the door. Great value in a terrific neighborhood.

2017-BFN-0000650
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill is Denver's most densely populated neighborhood. It was once the home of Denver's elite and origination of Foursquare architecture in Denver. Today it consists of historic mansions, apartments and condo buildings. Because of the concentration of multi-family uses and the urban character of the neighborhood, parking is at a premium. The area is strongly influenced by the Colorado State Capitol and Downtown Denver which is adjacent to the northwest boundary of the neighborhood. Commercial uses are typically located on major arterials such as Colfax Avenue, East 8th Avenue, East 14th Avenue, East 13th Avenue, Lincoln Street and Broadway. A considerable number of mansion properties have been converted to office uses over the past several years due to zoning exemptions offered to historic structures which are zoned for residential uses.

We are approximately 1 mile north of Mile High Stadium, a mile from the Pepsi Center, downtown and Coors Field.  Additionally, we are within easy access to I-25, I-70 and Hwy 6 to the mountains.

name: LoHi Art Cottage- A Comfy Semi-Urban Oasis
description:
Cozy, modern-victorian house with great energy, in a vibrant, downtown-close, neighborhood.

The house is right in the middle of a quiet, neighbourly street. You'd never know that there are two great coffee shops, a bar, a tavern with great food and TVs, and a restaurant, all within two blocks. Then, every block or two...

LGBTQ friendly. Welcome to all. The house is one of the fewer and fewer vintage homes left in one of the country's most coveted destination neighborhoods.
neighborhood_overview: The Lower Highlands Neighborhood (LoHi) is one of the country's fastest growing neighborhoods, and for good reason. It is full of coffee shops, restaurants, taverns, breweries, yoga studios, parks, bike and walking trails, and... you name it, within easy and pleasant walking distance. Lower Downtown Denver (LoHi) and the business district, as well as Union Station, are easily accessible via a short (1 mile) walk across the platte river.

name: Perfectly Appointed, Walkable, Lovely Denver
description: Located in the quiet yet centrally located Congress Park neighborhood, you will be called to stroll to the best of Denver's restaurants, recreation and entertainment. The Bungalow maximizes easy living w/ comfy bedding, a separate office, ample closet space and storage, a cheery garden-level basement, a front porch and a fenced-in yard.  Remodeled in 2017, the house boasts an inviting, new, fully stocked kitchen, and huge granite countertops great for working, cooking and hosting.
neighborhood_overview:
The Monroe Bungalow is located in the quiet Denver Congress Park neighborhood and close to everything! The house is a 10 minute drive downtown or a 5-15 minute walk to the 12th St neighborhood center, Colfax District, Cherry Creek North shopping district, the Botanic Gardens, Denver Zoo, Museum of Nature and Science, and several parks including Congress Park, Cheesman Park and City Park!!
This is the place to be!!

name: Garden-Level Apartment near Chaffee Park
description:
Listing ID: 2017-BFN-0008107 Recline on a comfortable queen pull-out couch in the living room of this garden-level apartment situated in a duplex. Slate gray walls add style aplenty to the neatly arrayed interior with its straight-aspect fitted kitchen and warm wooden floors.

Please don't hesitate to reach out with questions, negotiate pricing for longer stays etc! I'd rather have it booked then not!

My home is a 1 Bedroom Duplex located on the bottom floor with tons of character. Great for business travelers! Fiber wifi, easy parking, 2min from I-70 and I-25. Perfect for escaping up to the mountains as well. The living room has a very comfortable queen pullout couch, TV (basic channels only, no cable), Roku, WiFi (fiber for lighting fast speeds), and a bunch of games/puzzles. There is a great updated kitchen with a garbage disposal, dishwasher, and electric stove. The kitchen is stocked with pots, pans, spices, and anything you might need for cooking. There are a
neighborhood_overview: The apartment lies just two blocks from Chaffee Park for picnics, basketball, and more. Nearby Monkey Barrel is an excellent place to get a taste of local Denver breweries. Radiator is an awesome place to grab a bagel and coffee if you want a quick breakfast. The Bacon Social House and El Jefe Mexican restaurant are a short walk away. Sunny's Breakfast is one of our favorites and also is a couple blocks away.

name: LoHi Haven
description:
Located in Denver's​ LoHi area, this cozy home has everything you need for a Denver adventure.

The house is old. It’s cozy, clean, and well equipped, like a home, we have a fully fenced yard and allow dogs. AND it’s an older house.. we work hard to keep the space very clean but if you have a super sensitivity to animals OR want something modern and new this place is not for you.
neighborhood_overview:
The home is located very close to many of Denver's most popular restaurants and social venues.

Root Down, Linger, Avanti are just a few of the locations in walking distance. Downtown is a stones throw away as well as the Highlands.

Within 30 minutes you could drive to the mountains, Boulder or Red rocks!
You have the opportunity to be a social butterfly or retreat into your private secluded cocoon.

name: Two Story Denver Carriage Home
description: A beautiful two story victorian carriage house in the heart of the Denver's Highlands neighborhood.   Nestled at the back of the property, this charming one bedroom loft like home has all the bells and whistles.  This home features exposed brick, timber ceilings, tons of natural light, and general coziness all around.   Enjoy a piece of Denver's history, all just blocks from the bustling restaurants and chic boutique shops of 32nd and Lowell.
neighborhood_overview: We love this neighborhood for a few reasons: it's super close to downtown, close proximity to I25 and I70, and we can get to the mountains fast.  Uber or Lyft to most areas downtown and Cherry Creek for about $8-$15.

host_about:
While I was born in Columbus, Ohio, my upbringing had me residing in southern California and Miami, FL.  I love the outdoors and sunshine and Denver is perfect for both of those needs!  I stay busy with my career in real estate, but carve out enough time for all my hobbies (skiing, hiking, running, triathlons, and eating)  However, my truest love is being a mother of two gorgeous, fun loving daughters.  And my husband is pretty great too!  He's a classically trained chef who just opened his own distillery, making small batch whiskey and gins.  

My bucket list is comprised mostly of the need to travel abroad.  I started traveling young, but haven't gotten away much in the last few years.  I desperately want to go to Italy, France, and Croatia.  Mostly because I love wine and food, and old buildings that have stories!

I love to keep my carriage house spotless, and topped off with all the pleasantries I would want when traveling.  You may not see me much, but I am around if you need me.  I hope you enjoy the stay.

A favorite quote of mine, by Hunter S. Thompson: “Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!”

name: PET/420 friendly - Cheesman Park
description:
Fantastic furnished newly remodeled 2 bedroom Capitol Hill condo available with one assigned off street parking spot.

* awesome location just blocks from Cheesman park (pic shown in photos).
* new hard wood floors.
* free high speed WIFI.
* 45 minutes to mountains!
* minutes to downtown.

Cannabis friendly and dog friendly (limit of one dog, up to 40 lbs). Building amenities include sauna and outdoor pool during summer.

Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy Denver and the mountains.
neighborhood_overview:
You'll know what it is to feel like a local living in a pedestrian friendly area - cross the block to find a dispensary, pub, many eateries and noted coffee/brunch hot spot Thump! Just five blocks from King Soopers, 24 hour grocery store.

Also just five blocks from the pedestrian friendly 17th Avenue restaurant row (our favorite place for restaurants in the city - you'll find anything and everything here, and at the best value), two blocks from the Colfax Avenue - walking distance to many of the amazing music venues including the Ogden, the Fillmore and the Bluebird; also great bars like 1UP (retro arcade game bar) and plenty of food to discover, like Voodoo Donuts - open 24 hours!

This particular spot is in the heart of the lively Capitol Hill neighborhood and the base of the downtown area, 16th St Mall is 5-10 minute Uber/Lyft away or is an easy 15-20 minute walk. The mall is full of shops, restaurants, banks, and street activity including music and art fairs.

host_about:
We are lucky to professionally host many properties in the Capitol Hill/Uptown/City Park/LoHi/Wash Park/Stapleton areas. We are in our 7th year of hosting and have hosted over 6,000+ stays meeting 10s of thousands of guests from all over the world. We personally greet many of our guests.
Gretchen is an adopted Colorado native of 25 years - 12 years in Vail and 13 fabulous years living in Capitol Hill and Baker in Denver. Jim was born in Denver and his entire family lives here. We LOVE this city and this state - it has so much to offer visitors and residents. The culture, diversity, performing arts and culinary scene are just a few of the things that make us smile here every day.
We truly enjoy helping people connect to the best of the best local gems, whether it's one of our hidden comedy venues or to the newest and most innovative restaurants. Our food truck scene is out of this world, we have the most amazing bands locally and headliners that come from across the country and around the world to perform here.
Jim has an unbelievable wealth of knowledge of Colorado microbrews and can be booked to guide you through some of the best local craft breweries, tailored to your specific taste. Budtenders can be booked for an informative, fun and unique dispensary tour, to discover the truth behind the cannabis lifestyle in Denver. Gretchen can take you for a progressive happy hour, for "single bite" bests at some Denver's best restaurants off the beaten path.
Looking for comedy, spend an evening with both of us at hidden venues laughing with some of Denver's best local comics.
We are blessed to enjoy a great rapport with our guests and respect their privacy. Please communicate any special needs or concerns about your trip. It's our pleasure to be of service.
Please check out our other listings if your dates don't coincide with what you see available on the calendar. And feel free to contact us if you don't find availability when you need it, we might be able to help you find another Airbnb listing that works for your needs. 
On occasion, Gretchen can be of assistance in helping those who are relocating to the area, whether you are looking to rent or buy, contact me with your specifics and I'll see what I can do to help.

name: Near Park w/ Easy Access to Downtown & Red Rocks!
description:
Our 4000+ sq ft remodeled Denver home is half a block to the Park with a lake and mountain views.

The complete remodel was carefully crafted to instill modern comforts and upgrades, while maintaining the beautiful charm of the home.

The home is a great base location to many top attractions in the Denver metro and regional area. Easy access to Red Rocks and Downtown!

We're minutes to I-25 and I-70. For the skiers and snowboarders I-70 will get you to Colorado's best ski resorts.

name: Cozy&Spacious 2Bed Gem: Private, Kitchen, Near DIA
description: New, modern apartment w/ all new furnishings! 2 bed, 1 bath,  full kitchen, living & dining w/ 2 fireplaces & private entrance! Fast wifi Inc. Close to all Denver has to offer. 15 mins from airport, 15 mins to Children's & Univ. Hospital, within 30 mins of downtown, zoo, aquarium, museums, conv. center and sporting events. Light rail station & lots of fast food & sit down restaurants within 2 miles. Come stay for a night or a week; you'll have everything needed in this home away from home!
neighborhood_overview:
We are 2 miles or less from Walmart and King Soopers (grocery store), Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, 3 liquor stores, as well as lots of fast food, including Chick-fil-A, Arby's, Taco Bell, McDonald's, Wendy's, Burger King, Jimmy John's (they deliver too!), KFC, Panda Express, Chipotle and more! There is a Domino's Pizza, Pizza Hut and Papa John's, all of which you can pick up from or have delivered. There is a Chili's within this 2 miles radius and Outback Steakhouse, Uno's Chicago Grill, Applebee's and Ted's Montana Grill just a few extra minutes away. The Beer Garden is a local favorite and a must try! This is far from an exhaustive list of what's fairly close. Let's just say, if you don't want to cook, you have lots of options!
There is a children's park within walking distance, which also has tennis courts and a pool in the summer (for a small fee)

name: Backyard, Pets, Convenient, Walk to Lake, Dining, & Shopping
description:
Peaceful, quiet & relaxing! Sink into our sublime leather sofa with a delicious cup of jo, make a gourmet meal in our fully-stocked kitchen or take advantage of our abundance of towels, comfy beds, & patio furniture. Fire up the grille and chill with your pup(s) while you wait. Get out for fresh air & venture to stunning Sloan’s Lake for a beautiful run, ride or walk! Between our 69" big-screen TV, our backyard & countless trails, you won't be bored! With everything going on, we take pride in how well we sanitize our home! NOTE: Quiet, responsible tenant lives in a sep apt under the Airbnb.

• Stunning, modern & elegant - enticingly decorated to truly satisfy all your senses!!
• EVERYTHING brand new! West Elm furniture, modern appliances, quartz counters, quality linens, etc... -- all selected with your comfort in mind.
• Thoroughly-equipped, well-stocked stylish kitchen
• Luxurious Leesa beds- SO impressive, we promise you won't want to get out!
•
neighborhood_overview: Our home is on a very quiet, dead-end street, which is centrally located between downtown and the mountains. It is 4 blocks from a gorgeous lake and 1 block from Hwy 6. This conviently located gem give a super easy commute to the mountains or Golden. Also, it is supremely convenient to access all the downtown and/or sports attractions as the lightrail stop is half a block away! Our place is steps away from numerous trails, parks, shopping & a gorgeous lake! We are near cafes, dining, tap houses, brew pubs, grocery stores & retail stores. Quiet, responsible tenant lives below Airbnb in seperate apt w/ sep entrance.

name: Colfax Urban Farm
description:
Enjoy this charming historic urban farmhouse. The property is located right off of the historic Colfax Ave, fifteen minutes from downtown, not far from popular nightlife, easy access to I-70/DIA, and walking distance to the local brewery, Fiction. Off street parking is available, but is also close to main artery bus stops. I look forward to being your host!

name: Private Room Shared Bath Capitol Hill Downtown
description: Get ready to kick back and enjoy the fanciest shmanciest retro hostel experience of a lifetime in our 9,000 sq foot mansion! Whether you're in the mood to party or sit by the fireplace with an espresso and good book, we are the hostel for you!  This listing is for our Euro Queen which sleeps up to two people. Shared bathrooms are just a few steps away.
neighborhood_overview: Our hostel is located in Cap Hill just a short walk from the state capitol, downtown bars and an awesome music scene. Capitol Hill was once the home of Denver’s elite and today consists of historic mansions, such as ours. The neighborhood has urban character, eclectic architecture and is well known as a haven for young artists, musicians, and bohemians (like Jack Kerouac who lived at the Colburn Hotel just one block from Ember Hostel). Near us is Colfax Avenue, which the concert and live music hub of Denver! The Filmore Auditorium, The Ogden Theater, as well as numerous late-night bars, coffee shops, thrift stores and restaurants are just blocks away. The Denver Art Museum, Santa Fe Arts District, and South Broadway bar scene is also walking distance from the hostel.

name: Wash Park Apt - Premium Location Private Entrance
description:
A clean lock off studio apartment that has it's own private entrance and is separate from the rest of the house.

Located in the Wash Park neighborhood, it's 2 blocks from the ever popular Bonnie Brae Ice Cream, 3 blocks from the South Gaylord Street shops and restaurants (7), and seven blocks from Washington Park.

About a mile from DU, and the Cherry Creek Mall and Cherry Creek North area of Denver. Centrally located with easy access to I-25, downtown, and the Denver Tech Center.
neighborhood_overview:
Wash Park has been named a top 10 neighborhood in the US recently. Because of everything being within walking distance of each other it is a great place to live or visit.

The actual park is amazing, right in the heart of South Denver. On any given day, you can take in a walk, jog, bike ride, volleyball, tennis, or paddle boats in the summertime. It's about a 2.5 mile loop around the park. And, there are two lakes. From the east side of the park, you look across the park and see the Rockies in the background. There are tons of places to stop and take a break (benches, lawns, etc.) to enjoy the park, watch the people, and take in the Rockies. With 300 sunny days a year in Denver the park is usable all year round.

name: Cap Hill Private Condo. Great Walkability!
description:
Welcome to our recently renovated basement apartment in an 1880's built Capitol Hill gem! *We want you to know that we’re doing our part by following all Airbnb cleaning guidelines.*

This is a 1 bedroom/1 bath condo on the bottom floor of a Victorian home in the heart of Denver's cap hill neighborhood. This will truly be in a walkers paradise (Walkscore of 95!). The apartment includes newly renovated kitchen with basic supplies, a television, bluetooth speaker, and coffee.
neighborhood_overview:
With a walk score of 95, you are less than a mile from Cheesman Park, botanical gardens, museums, a variety of speciality restaurants, coffee shops, bars, B-Cycle stations, public transportation, and more.

If you have a car, please watch parking signs. Friday night at 7pm til Monday at 6am (and holidays) parking is available on the west side of Logan. Weekdays, 2 hour parking is available on the east side of Logan. Nights, weekends, and holidays, the east side of Logan is unlimited. On 11th and 12th st. there unlimited parking. Parking is difficult to find after 5pm. If all else fails there is paid parking on 13th and Logan (1.5 blocks north of the house).

This South Denver neighborhood you are in called Southmoor Park built in in 1963. Yes, we are in Denver. I love this neighborhood because everything you could want is less than a mile. Super Target, Wholefoods, Walmart, King Supers (grocery stores).
I love it because you still get the urban city suburb vibe. Families, young and old. Very diverse.

name: Comfy & cozy private 2-bed guest suite - RiNo area
description: Live like a local in a private guest suite in the lower level of a renovated bungalow close to the RiNo (River North Art District) area of Denver. Just a short car ride or 15 min walk puts you in the heart of RiNo, a neighborhood known for its urban charm and industrial revival, lined with breweries, shops, restaurants; you can also walk to the new Mission Ballroom. Add a few extra minutes to your commute, and you are in the heart of downtown Denver.

neighborhood_overview: Nicknamed “RiNo,” the trendy River North Art District features contemporary art galleries and hip concert venues in revamped industrial buildings. Food halls include Denver Central Market, Zeppelin Station, and The Source, a buzzy indoor venue with eclectic products and a bar for small plates and craft beer. Known for its colorful murals, Upper Larimer Street also has cocktail lounges, brewpubs with patios and late-night food trucks.

name: Furnished month-to-month townhome in heart of RiNo
description:
Wake up in the heart of RiNo, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Denver. You're within a stone's throw of some of the best food, drink + art in the city.

Welcome to the townhome my husband and I call home in Denver. We currently rent out our guest bedroom, for a period of 30+ days, pictured in the listing as Bedroom #2.

Moving to Denver and looking for a temporary landing spot? Our month-to-month rental provides a comfortable stay while you figure out your next move.
neighborhood_overview:
RiNo (short for River North) is a really happening area in Denver. Very walkable, there are a plethora of bars, restaurants, breweries, art galleries and shops nearby. It's a perfect location if you don't want to have to go very far to find some action.

However, you're also close enough to the freeway (with a car) that you can head out to the mountains fairly quickly without hitting too much traffic.

And, the Lightrail station is only 10 blocks away, making for an easy car-free transportation to and from the airport.

name: Roaring Twenties Speakeasy Apartment Near City Park
description:
Built during prohibition, this private basement apartment has a fantastic speakeasy feel for those needing a secure isolated space. Spread out on the leather sofa in front of the 60" LCD TV with Roku. Exposed wood paneling and brick accents, little nooks and crannies, and a bottle collection transport you to the roaring twenties, while latter-day luxuries include a spa bath and electric fireplace. Prepare your own meals in the updated kitchen with full size fridge, sink and countertops. Microwave, toaster/oven, and induction hotplate (complete with pots and pans) for all your cooking needs.

In what once was the hidden cellar situated beneath the main house is a private living room, kitchenette, bedroom and bath all with it’s own separate entrance and courtyard.

Enjoy the cozy bedroom with Queen Size Bed!

AND Separate Living Room, 60” LCD TV with Cable TV, and large, comfortable sofa!
• Complete kitchenette with fridge, dishwasher, microwave and sin
neighborhood_overview: Blocks from City Park and just minutes to Downtown, Park Hill, with its friendly neighbors, mature trees, and picturesque gardens, is a favorite for many who like to stroll and smell the roses. Homes range from mansions to modest bungalows. Explore the shops and restaurants tucked along quiet streets. Take a walk to Denver's sprawling City Park, visit the zoo or the Museum, or enjoy the lake and historic statues.

host_about:
Zac and Lisa are experienced Airbnb hosts managing properties since 2014. They own Urban Islands Vacations and manage properties in Colorado, California, & Missouri. They reside in Denver and love hiking and the outdoors as well as traveling hosting and entertaining. They were both born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and have been all over the world together. Some of their favorites include Montenegro, Paris, and Table Rock Lake!

Zac is an altitude junky and has summited 16 of Colorado’s 14ers. Lisa has run the Colfax marathon,  the Loveland Lake to Lake triathlon, and the Ragnar up in Snowmass. 

They love to find new places to eat and adventures to explore, they are friendly social people and love to be hospitable. If you are property owner in need of a management team, or a guest looking for a vacation property reach out at Urban Islands Vacations and we would love to connect!

name: Cozy Sunnyside Bungalow
description: This half duplex has two bedrooms and two bathrooms with a detached guest suite.   It also has an office and basement/game room with a pull out sofa appropriate for kids. The space is cozy and equipped with everything from kitchen appliances and cooking supplies, to comfortable and stylish furniture- plus an incredible patio for summer hangs! The space sleeps 6, though it is most appropriate for 4 adults.  **No Running water or bathroom in guest suite**
neighborhood_overview: Denver truly has so much to offer, and this location is in the heart of it. Highlands Square, Jefferson Park, Lo Hi's trendy restaurants and bars, Edgewater, Tennyson and Sloan's Lake are all within a 15 to 30 minute walk. (!)  Our guidebook includes a list of our favorite places nearby, in case you need some recommendations. If you are here for a sporting event, Coors Field, the Pepsi Center and Sports Authority Field are all accessible by bike or less than a 10 minute drive. If Denver is your gateway to mountain adventure, we are located with convenient access to I70 and I25. This location gives you easy access to all that Colorado has on offer.

name: Artisan Loft in Historic Five Points with Rustic Red Bricks
description:
Explore Denver's art district, then climb the steel stairs to this eclectic loft where vintage charm meets steam-punk fashion. Portuguese-style patterned tiles blend seamlessly with a bottle top coffee table and industrial-chic lighting.

This space was a family project (Steve, Lisa and Mick who are brothers and sister) – a carriage house built behind our 1900s house near downtown Denver. The building was designed to mimic older architecture to fit-in with the historic neighborhood. The interior was designed to carry that vintage charm inside with exposed brick and steam-punk fixtures and furniture to blend vintage and industrial design elements. We designed and built the structure including detail such as the black pipe chandelier, steel stair case and funky locker cabinets in the bathroom and bedrooms. Handcrafted items and collections from our family are displayed around the house.

The carriage house is exclusively for guests so anything you see is available i
neighborhood_overview: Historic Curtis Park is situated between two commercial corridors: Welton and Larimer (RiNo). There are plenty of restaurants, craft breweries, wineries, cideries, and dispensaries nearby.

name: Shared Room - 1 twin bed in 16 bunk bed co-ed dorm
description: Get ready to kick back and enjoy the fanciest shmanciest retro hostel experience of a lifetime in our 9,000 sq foot mansion! Our five-star bunks include pillow-top mattresses, plush king-size pillows, and in-bed outlets/lights/storage/privacy curtains. If you have more than one guest, you need to make a separate reservation.
neighborhood_overview: Our hostel is located in Cap Hill just a short walk from the state capitol, downtown bars and an awesome music scene. Capitol Hill was once the home of Denver’s elite and today consists of historic mansions, such as ours. The neighborhood has urban character, eclectic architecture and is well known as a haven for young artists, musicians, and bohemians (like Jack Kerouac who lived at the Colburn Hotel just one block from Ember Hostel). Near us is Colfax Avenue, which the concert and live music hub of Denver! The Filmore Auditorium, The Ogden Theater, as well as numerous late-night bars, coffee shops, thrift stores and restaurants are just blocks away. The Denver Art Museum, Santa Fe Arts District, and South Broadway bar scene is also walking distance from the hostel.
