host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION

This stylishly renovated condo is located in the heart of Mayfair, just a stones throw away from the VA and Rose Hospitals, fast-casual dining, Trader Joe's, Starbucks, shops, and other conveniences such as a banks, gas stations and shopping centers along Colorado between 6th & 9th Aves, and Cherry Creek.

Mayfair, tucked quietly between Colorado and Monaco and Colfax and 6th, is surrounded by some of the strongest neighborhoods in Denver: Park Hill to the north, Hilltop & Cherry Creek on its southern border, and the new communities of Lowry and Stapleton to the East.

Uncomplicated and somewhat undiscovered, Mayfair is known for its health facilities, spacious lawns and proximity to Downtown Denver.

This neighborhood is also experiencing a growth period, and is slated to become Denver's most talked about neighborhood.

Near by Colfax Avenue offers a string of conveniences from tire stores to coffee shops, music venues, an

host_about:
I'm a single, 50-something, friendly and sociable fellow traveler.  

I lead an itinerant home office lifestyle based out of Steamboat Springs and Denver.  (I've been "social distancing" since '94 and 28K baud modems, so I know a thing or two about the now, near dominant work-from-home challenges, setup and rewards. ;) )  

Since growing up in the small town of Eastern Pennsylvania called Nazareth, (Yeah, that's me, I am "Joseph of Nazareth"! ;P ), I have ventured through all 50 United States, and dozens of countries across North America, South America, Africa and Europe.  

My zest for travel stems from experiences in my youth attending grand and exciting "Bon Voyage" and "Welcome Home" parties, and trips to the airport, all dressed up, for family members to all of these unknown and distant places, in particular, Gram's many trips back to our mother country of Austria.  

During my first international month long travels through Europe as a 17 year old, I enjoyed many a serendipitous guest house and hostel stay.  The rest is history.

As an adult, my trips range from weekend road trips to extended multi-month adventurers, for both work as a contracting AppleOS Software Engineer and/or pleasure in pursuit of athletic, cultural and educational endeavors.  

Accommodations during my travels often require an independent, work-from-home and active lifestyle considerations, something I found not to be that readily available.  

After acquiring a single family home in a mountain and ski resort town before the real estate bubble, and then several condominiums immediately after that bubble burst, I found myself in a position to setup and offer my properties and rooms in my house for that "home office" niche.

Fast forward to the internet era, and the embrace and popularity of airbnb.com and the like, I am now able to successfully manage these rental opportunities in an enjoyable and successful manner.  "Who'da thunk". this would have been possible as a youth lusting for travel?!

I take pleasure in hosting my guests' stays at either my private condominiums and rooms in my home.  It's a great way for me to feel "connected" to that itinerant lifestyle while "home'n it".  

I tend to float between these two locations to fathering my 6 year old son in Denver and/or managing rental turnovers.  

I can "hit the ground running" at any of my properties with just a suitcase and gear in tow.  You will be able to as well.

In the interest of learning about your host, some hobbies I enjoy include home improvements, vintage vespas, photography/videography, technology, cooking, brewing beer/mead and volunteering.

I could live just about anywhere, but I chose the endearing community of Steamboat Springs in the beautiful Yampa Valley and all it has to offer.  

I'm more than happy to share my local knowledge and experiences with you during your extended  stay at my house in Steamboat, or at one of my other properties in Denver and Phoenix.

name: Denver Urban Tree House
description:

This space is private and not attached to our home. It has a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, hot plate, sink, coffee maker and toaster, all dishes and silverware. There is a large walk in closet.

name: North Highlands 1BR with Easy Access to Downtown
description:
Located just off of I-70 and I-25 in Denver (Chaffee Park Neighborhood) near Regis University, my Airbnb provides easy access to Denver, or any direction - 25 mins to Red Rocks, 6 minutes to Coors Field, 5 minutes to the National Western Complex or 10 minutes to the heart of Denver. Take I-36 to Boulder in just 30 minutes.

With Central A/C and new furnace installed 6/27/18, it's the perfect jumping off point to enjoy the city or the mountains.

License #: 2018-BFN-0006341
neighborhood_overview:
Known to many as North Denver, Chaffee Park is situated just north of I-70 on the outskirts of downtown. Much like the neighboring Sunnyside, Regis, and Berkeley neighborhoods, Chaffee Park has experienced a boom in the last several years. And while the aforementioned neighborhoods have reached a fever pitch—and will continue to benefit from light rail stations and massive urban redevelopment—Chaffee Park has managed to stay under the radar, relatively speaking.

Looking for a Northwest Denver neighborhood that’s close to the Highlands but still a bit off the beaten path? Chaffee Park offers a close proximity to downtown, recent revitalization, and still has the charm of not being a completely changed Denver neighborhood.

name: The Nest in Platt Park - Studio Apartment
description:
We've got an amazingly cozy nook above our garage with all the comforts of home sweet home. Built in 2016, the apartment has a full kitchen equipped with an induction cooktop and full-size washer & dryer. A Juliet balcony opens up the space.

This bright studio apartment is nestled in the very walkable Platt Park neighborhood with all there is to explore Denver at your doorstep. You can hop on light rail and go downtown or walk a couple blocks to award winning restaurants on Old S. Pearl St.
neighborhood_overview: The Platt Park neighborhood borders Wash Park and DU. Our studio apartment is a short block and a half from Platt Park's celebrated South Pearl St, five blocks from light rail to downtown, and roughly thirteen blocks from the University of Denver. South Pearl Street is known for its famed Sushi Den, and there are many other restaurants, bars, shops, galleries, massage, yoga, a bakery, a florist and a Farmer's Market from late May to mid November on Sundays. Decker Library and Platt Park (the actual park) is a few blocks away. South Broadway is a few blocks farther and is lined with more restaurants, shops, and entertainment. Wash Park is less than a mile away with tennis courts, two playgrounds, and a recreation center, and another downtown area with restaurants and shops on Gaylord St.

neighborhood_overview: The absolute perfect location! Nestled between "Wash Park" (Washington) and Platte Park, we are near Platte River, in an adorable neighborhood with brick-style bungalows, trees, sidewalks, and easy free street parking.  You are steps away from S Broadway with countless restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and endless activities always happening. You are also right by the tree-lined blocks of South Pearl Street, where there are excellent restaurants, shops, and home to the best farmers' market in the city. Less than 1/2 mile to the light rail station and less than 1 mile to Wash Park, where you'll want to explore the beautiful park and take a stroll around the lakes. You are only a few minute drive or ride share from downtown Denver if you want to check out the attractions there as well.

name: Just Renovated, Fully-Stocked Apt + Free Parking!
description: Location, location, location.  Cliche but so true.  You usually sacrifice comfort, space and amenities for the convenience of such a great location, but not the case here!  Brand new one bdr apt in the heart of hip and trendy Capitol Hill--you can walk everywhere, but it includes a very coveted parking space!  If you know this area, you know that parking is a huge challenge.  Price includes a dedicated space.  All the amenities of a corporate extended stay apt, with the feel of a luxury hotel!
neighborhood_overview:
Capitol Hill is one of the hottest, most cosmopolitan neighborhoods in Denver, well-known as a haven for artists, politicos, and hipsters alike. There are numerous restaurants, clubs, bars, stores, concert venues, and other cultural amenities in the community. Has multiple concert venues (The Fillmore Auditorium, The Ogden Theater, The Bluebird Theater, 1Up Colfax), and numerous late-night bars, coffeeshops, restaurants, and independent stores. During the day, lobbyists and politicians from the Colorado State Capitol can be seen making deals in the restaurants and bars of the neighborhood.
Capitol Hill is located between two major Denver parks: Civic Center Park and Cheesman Park. Both locations are meeting hubs for the community; they host many festivals throughout the summer/fall months, including fireworks for Independence Day, Taste of Colorado, Pride Festival, Parade of Lights, and more.

name: Highlands Square | 1885 Urban Victorian Charmer
description: Stunning & soulful loft-like victorian built in 1885, just steps from the historical Highlands Square of Denver. Breathtaking 20' vaulted ceilings highlighted with pine beams and exposed brick everywhere! Nostalgic exterior architecture blends seamlessly with chic, modern updates inside. Huge kitchen with all the cooking essentials. 2 bedrooms and a Queen pull-out sofa in living room comfortably fit five people! Backyard is an urban oasis with patio & turf. Just 80 min drive to the ski resorts!
neighborhood_overview: Highland Square is a vibrant and dynamic offbeat urban neighborhood just west of downtown set among a remarkable collection of quirky shops, quaint architecture, tempting restaurants, unique entertainment, cozy homes and convenient personal services. This thriving historical arts district supported by both new youthful residents and longtime, committed community. Full of Victorian-era homes and buildings, lush gardens and parks, hip independently owned shops, art galleries and restaurants, the Denver Highlands neighborhood is a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover here: Highlands Square, Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi). All boast there own flavors of trendy boutiques, salons, coffee shops and restaurants.

host_about:
Hey, I'm Danny! I'm originally a Midwesterner who moved to Colorado in 2017. I’m a full-time entrepreneur and have been a remote worker for a decade. 

I like to camp/hike/backpack, canoe/kayak/paddleboard, mountain bike, ski/snowboard, fish...you name it! It's easy to adopt more hobbies than you can handle in Colorado.  

I love meeting new people on my travels and really enjoy experiencing new cultures. I've been to all 50 US states, 59 countries on 6 continents, and am hoping to add more friends and destinations to this list through Airbnb! 

I use this platform on both sides and am an investor in the company too, as I believe in the growth of travel, hospitality, remote work, and placing an emphasis on buying experiences over things.

I’m easygoing, low maintenance, and don't need much to keep myself happy. I appreciate good hospitality, design, & communication and try to provide the same myself for my own listings. Let me stay at your place sometime, and you're always free to stay at mine!

Cheers and travel on!

name: Home away from home, PET Friendly Large Backyard
description:

name: Downtown Denver Victorian 1-Bedroom Apartment
description:
Beautifully modernized private 1-bedroom 1-bath apartment just 4 blocks from Downtown.

With a queen bed in the bedroom and a pull-out couch in the living area the apartment accommodates up to 4 guests.

Located among historic districts and 3 blocks from the light rail station. Just a 15 minute walk to the 16th street mall makes all of lower downtown easily accessible.

A perfect stay for anyone attending events at the Denver Convention Center - ride the light rail right to the front door!
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located in one of the oldest neighborhoods in Denver - at edges of the Curtis Park, San Rafael and Clements Historic Districts - all of which are dominated by beautifully restored Victorian 1880's homes.

Clements Historic District typifies high-style Queen Anne and Italianate architecture, and is one of the most intact collections of late 19th Century Victorian high-style residential architecture in Denver. It is representative of the City’s rapid growth and middle class population of the 19th Century. The district maintains beautiful views of the Rocky Mountains to the west.

Curtis Park, Denver’s first street car suburb, is one of the city’s oldest and most diverse residential areas. The neighborhood’s heyday was from the late 1870s until 1893. The district is a showcase of architectural styles from that era, including Italianate, Eastlake, Queen Anne, and Victorian eclectic homes. Romanesque, French Second Empire and Gothic Revival buildings

host_about:
Brad and I love Colorado, and have lived here for years.  Brad is a sommelier, and has seriously ruined my ability to drink boxed wine. He specializes in Italian wine.  He also loves to ski and can tell you about his favorite slopes.  I love my bike, gardening, and good food.  We're both foodies.  And in general, if we can be outside in the midst of any place that's green and lovely - with special points if there are small, wild creatures about - we are happiest.  

We've recently expanded our "urban farm" by including backyard chickens in the family. They are hilarious, delightful hens - all different. One might try to perch on the back of your patio chair and look over your shoulder at the book you're reading.

Like our hens, we are sociable types, love to have friends over. Guests tell us they love the house and outdoor space. Our lifestyle is relaxed and flexible, and we love to laugh.  But we also will give you all the privacy and personal space you need for your vacation or visit in Denver.

host_about:
I am an elementary PE teacher originally from Upstate New York.   

Yoga, hiking, camping, reading, and water-coloring are all some of my favorite activities!  In the time I am not teaching or participating in these hobbies, you can find me hanging out with my "Little Sister" (Big Brothers/Big Sisters), checking out a brewery or live music with friends, and/or beautifying my yard.

Every time I go back east, my mom has childhood room spotless, fresh towels on my bed, and my favorite dinner planned out.  I am an incredibly fortunate human.  Although I will not be cooking your favorite dinner for you, I absolutely love the opportunity I have on Airbnb to host you in the same way my mom has hosted me for years.  It is my pleasure to make your stay as comforting as I can as you explore this beautiful destination I have decided to make my home.

Travel well, friends!

"Strangers are friends you haven't yet met."

name: Light filled, homey, quiet & private unit
description:
Come stay with us! Your private home away from home styled to feel like you are staying at a family or friend's house. And, we have included all those little things that you may have forgotten to pack. That homey feeling is reinforced by the view out the windows of the private backyard. The unit has its own covered entrance and free parking in the driveway.

Located 3.3 miles east of downtown Denver. An easy trip to the mountains, Red Rocks, or the airport that is 22 minutes from here via I-70.
neighborhood_overview:
A tree lined residential neighborhood.

In 1887, Baron Allois Gullaume Engine von Winckler designed the original Park Hill development on 32 acres of land he owned in northeast Denver. As the neighborhood grew, settlers from many nations, including England, Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands and Italy, moved into the neighborhood, as did African Americans. Today, both South and North Park Hill remain diverse communities representing many ethnic backgrounds.

https://history.denverlibrary.org/park-hill-neighborhood-history

I chose to move to this house in this neighborhood BECAUSE of it’s diversity. It is what America is and what I feel comfortable with, I hope you do too.

name: Platt Park Studio - 4 Miles from Downtown Denver!
description: Experience the exciting city of Denver from this charming vacation rental studio boasting a full bathroom, kitchenette, and a furnished deck. Catch a sporting event at Ball Area, watch a concert at Red Rocks Ampitheater, or walk along 16th street mall. With the many attractions of downtown just minutes away and easy access to the Rocky Mountains, this quaint getaway is the perfect couples retreat! After a day of adventure, relax on the deck and watch the sunset.
neighborhood_overview:
This Denver retreat is ideally located within steps of the amazing restaurants and shops of Broadway. Stroll 3 blocks west to grab a quick bite at Pasquini's Pizzeria and shop through the array of antique stores!

An easy 0.5-mile walk is all that stands between you and wonderful Pearl Street, home to various upscale boutiques and top-rated restaurants like Sushi Den and OTOTO. If you're in the mood for a casual meal, stop by Park Burger for a Classic Double and The Works!

The condo is also within walking distance of the Broadway light rail station, making it effortless to get downtown! While you’re in the city, roam down 16th Street filled with shops, check out the restaurant scene of Larimer Square, or catch a game at one of the several sports venues!

name: Sunny Private Guest Suite In Historic Denver Home
description: Get the real Denver experience - stay in our historic Washington Park home and enjoy all the unique perks the Mile High City has to offer. Our house is a 10 minute walk to the light rail, 2 minutes to the nearest bus stop, 2 minutes from I-25, and a $10 Lyft to pretty much anywhere in the Denver metro area. Quickly and easily get to downtown, the Tech Center, the shopping on South Broadway, to the mountains or simply relax in the comfort of our cozy guest suite.
neighborhood_overview:
The perfect blend of city living in a quaint package. You'll have easy access to all the perks of living in the city like bars, restaurants and nightlife, combined with the comfort of staying in a house in one of Denver's safest and most desirable neighborhoods. Wash Park itself is a local favorite spot for walking, running, tennis, biking, volleyball and picnics.

Everything you need is within a 10 minute walk or at most a 5 minute drive!

Bus & Light Rail Access:
- The 0 bus to downtown picks up at the end of our block ($3)
- The Alameda or Broadway light rail stops are a 10 minute walk away and will take you to/from the airport, Central Business District, Performing Arts Complex (Sculpture Park & Big Blue Bear), Denver Selfie Museum, Coors Field, Union Station, Ball Arena, Meow Wolf & the Tech Center (you’ll thank yourself when you don’t have to find parking downtown)

name: *Cannabis friendly, Private, Great Location/Value*
description: This spacious apartment has plenty of room for 2 guests to relax comfortably. You will have a private entrance, full private bathroom, bedroom with queen size memory foam mattress, comfy full size pullout sofa bed, and a kitchen with a full size refrigerator/freezer and stove/oven. Skylights in the bathroom, bedroom (light sensitive guests might consider a sleep mask) and kitchen provide the space with natural lighting during the day. You will also have access to a private backyard/patio area.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood on the west side of town. Mostly young adults and elderly home owners... not very many kids running around. Not too much foot traffic in general and plenty of street parking. There is also a variety of delicious food options nearby! There is a pharmacy, package store, and dispensary a few blocks away. You can get an $10 Lyft or Uber ride into the downtown area very easily at any time of day or night. If you plan on doing some adventuring into the mountains you can easily access Hwy 6 West and I-25 from here. Red Rocks is only a 20 minute drive from us! Great if you plan on seeing a show while you're in town.

Liz and Nathan have lived and worked in Denver since 2014. Liz is a talented ceramic artist and works out of her nearby studio on various pottery designs.  All of the ceramic designs displayed in the apartment are handmade by Liz, including some of the plates and bowls you'll use! If you'd like to know more about her work, please ask! 

Nathan owns and operates a personal training business nearby, Monday - Saturday 8am - 7pm. The training space is located less than a mile from their home. Nathan does exclusively one-on-one and small group coaching for strength training and conditioning as well as sport specific training for various athletes. If you have any questions at all about that, don't hesitate to ask!

We welcome people of all creeds, nationalities, genders, and beliefs... provided you act with kindness and do not encourage hate! We will not discriminate against anyone based on the color of their skin, the place they were born, the religion they ascribe to (or don't), or who they choose to love. 
You get the idea. Be good to each other. 

Please enjoy being a guest in our home and have an awesome and unforgettable time enjoying Denver and all of the other great things Colorado has to offer!

***Our property is 420 friendly. Please familiarize yourself with local laws and ordinances regarding consumption. ***

***NO tobacco smoking inside the apartment!***

Mother Nature needs our help. DO NOT LITTER. If you head into the mountains, remember to "pack it in and pack it out" and follow "leave no trace" principles. Stay up to date on FIRE BANS. Don't burn our state down, FFS!
Don't feed the Bears, and remember to have a great adventure!

name: Shared Room - 1 twin bed in 12 bunk bed co-ed dorm
description: Get ready to kick back and enjoy the fanciest shmanciest retro hostel experience of a lifetime in our 9,000 sq foot mansion! Our five-star bunks include pillow-top mattresses, plush king-size pillows, and in-bed outlets/lights/storage/privacy curtains.  If you have more than one guest, you need to make a separate reservation.
neighborhood_overview: Our hostel is located in Cap Hill just a short walk from the state capitol, downtown bars and an awesome music scene. Capitol Hill was once the home of Denver’s elite and today consists of historic mansions, such as ours. The neighborhood has urban character, eclectic architecture and is well known as a haven for young artists, musicians, and bohemians (like Jack Kerouac who lived at the Colburn Hotel just one block from Ember Hostel). Near us is Colfax Avenue, which the concert and live music hub of Denver! The Filmore Auditorium, The Ogden Theater, as well as numerous late-night bars, coffee shops, thrift stores and restaurants are just blocks away. The Denver Art Museum, Santa Fe Arts District, and South Broadway bar scene is also walking distance from the hostel.

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests.

name: Mountain Goat - 4 Bedroom by Conventions - HotTub
description:
This designer four bedroom home with killer rooftop views and a hot tub is located conveniently between Denver’s Museum District, the Colorado Convention Center, and the Santa Fe Arts District, right in Denver’s Golden Triangle Neighborhood. Almost everything you could need (groceries, bars, art, restaurants, the convention center, museums) is within a 10 minute walk of the house.

The house also includes a two car garage, and all access is automated with coded locks.
neighborhood_overview: Golden Triangle is right in the middle of everything, yet quiet enough to get a good night's rest before a big day at the convention center or after a night on the town. We have plenty of good restaurants within a few minutes walk, and the 16th Street Mall is a 12 minute walk away, as are quirky art galleries on Santa Fe and the State Capitol building by Civic Center Park.

name: Cozy Convenient Access to Downtown and Foothills
description: The lower level of our highlands/berkeley home is all yours! Well lit with windows on all sides and private entrance through the back of the house. Walking distance to many restaurants, parks, and shopping. A few miles from downtown, a quick hop on I-70 to head to the mountains, and bikes for you to explore the neighborhood. We live upstairs with our two sons, born in 2015 and 2018. Happy to interact as much or as little as you'd like during your stay. Welcome!
neighborhood_overview: Northwest Denver is the best! We're located walking distance to Highlands square and Tennyson both with tons of shopping and dining. Even closer are a few tasty cafes and taco shops. Lots to explore on bike (we've got two you can borrow) or on foot. Downtown Denver is a short drive (or 3 miles on bike) or you can catch the bus half a block from the house. We're a great jumping off spot for day trips to the mountains as we're minutes from I-70. Our block is quiet and residential with great neighbors - if you're lucky you'll be here for an alley party!

name: On Top of the World Vintage Condo!
description:
Stay in the treetops in this beautiful, light and sunny vintage top-floor apartment. Sip your morning coffee or tea in peace and quiet on the large private deck.

Location, Location, Location!

The space is perfect for traveling nurses or anyone with short-term assignments who want to be close to the city but in a quiet, centrally-located, very walkable neighborhood, close to large parks and the Botanic Gardens. Quiet, private and charming!
neighborhood_overview:
You can’t beat the location! Awesome shops and restaurants within walking distance on all sides and centrally located to virtually all of Denver’s main attractions. You can even walk the to the beautiful Botanic gardens just four blocks away for an evening of summer music, or go for a jog in nearby Chessman or City Park.

This place is close to everything! Walkable restaurants, bars and coffee shops in all directions. The brand new Carla Madison Rec center is three blocks away. Chessman Park and City Parks are only a few blocks away. The awesome Tattered Cover bookstore close-by makes a great place to spend a rainy afternoon. Or culture yourself with wine and o’dourves at Sie Film Center down the street. Uber downtown for less than $10 or head south to Cherry Creek North just a mile away!

description:
Updated brick bungalow in the heart of Washington Park. Located 3 short blocks from Denver’s beautiful Wash Park, this home is the ideal location for exploring all that Denver has to offer. We are within walking distance to Wash Park, the light rail, coffee shops, restaurants and both Sprouts, Whole Foods and Natural Grocers grocery stores. Boasting 1,200 square feet and comfortably sleeping 4 guests, this home is centrally located to everything Denver has to offer. Stroll through City Park, take in a Colorado Rockies game, or browse the shops on 16th street mall, all within 2 miles of the home.
neighborhood_overview:
When you've finished your morning coffee, take a short 15-minute stroll over to City Park for a fun afternoon with family. The park is host to the Denver Museum of Nature & Science, the Denver Zoo, and 2 lakes.

After working up a hearty appetite at the park, grab a bite to eat at one of the nearby eateries like Whittier Cafe, Genna Rae Wings & More..., and The Whittier Pub. For fine dining, look no further than Larimer Square featuring gourmet restaurants like Rioja and Osteria Marco. Cap off the night with an after-dinner cocktail at Corridor 44, a chic champagne bar with a patio.

Check the schedule to see which Denver sports team is playing during your visit as Coors Field, the Pepsi Center, and Sports Authority Field at Mile High are all within 5 miles of the home. If concerts are more your speed, head to Red Rocks Amphitheatre to take in a show, just 22 miles away.

name: Lovely 3 bed 3 bath Central Park home with garage.
description:
Great Stapleton location. New 3 bedroom 2.5 bath town home with attached garage.

Two blocks to the large Central Park with miles of walking biking trails.
Close to Childrens, VA and University of Colorado hospitals.
Light rail and bus depot 300 yards or 4 minute walk across the street! I-70/270 are a mere 1/2 mile away. 15 minute drive to downtown or DIA . 20 minutes to Cherry Creek and 30 minutes to DTC. Also 270 takes you directly to Boulder in 35-45 minutes. 2020-BFN-0000278
neighborhood_overview:
Stapleton is the perfect hybrid of a modern neighborhood in a Urban setting close to downtown Denver.

Stapleton is the old Denver airport that when announced in the late 1990's was to become the largest urban renewal project in America. It is a 20+year master plan which is now getting close to completion. A great mix of homes, parks, restaurants and stores. I believe you will enjoy everything Stapleton has to offer during your stay. Cheers.

name: Urban Oasis - RiNo Art District
description:
Welcome hOMe to the Urban Oasis featuring modern Moroccan vibes infused with environmentally conscious materials and incredible architectural details.

Enjoy Denver’s Hippest Neighborhood - RiNo - where trendy restaurants, art galleries, and breweries are right out your font door.
neighborhood_overview:
Nicknamed “RiNo,” the trendy River North Art District features contemporary art galleries and hip concert venues in revamped industrial buildings. Food halls include Denver Central Market and The Source, a buzzy indoor venue with eclectic products and a bar for small plates and craft beer. Known for its colorful murals, Upper Larimer Street also has cocktail lounges, brewpubs with patios and late-night food trucks.

https://rinoartdistrict.org/

name: Private Entry Suite in Cole/RiNo Near Downtown
description: Contemporary and comfortable, this historic house is a picturesque discovery in the heart of the Cole neighborhood tucked into the hip area of RiNo (RiverNorth). Behind the Victorian architecture, this unique 1880s home is tastefully upgraded with modern amenities and vintage finishes. You’ll love this place because of your private outdoor space, the neighborhood, and the proximity to the trendy RiNo scene. Overall, this suite is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers alike.
neighborhood_overview:
Easily access all that Denver has to offer! If you're in town for a sporting event, we are minutes away from Coors Field, Pepsi Center, and Mile High Stadium. If you are here to check out breweries, arts/culture, museums, festivals, we are in the heart of it all!

RiNo (The River North Art District)... "where art is made"... goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination for visitors. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery

name: Private Guesthouse | Walkable to Food, Shops, Lake
description:
This private guesthouse is the perfect home base for exploring Denver. The guesthouse has a private entrance, one bedroom, a kitchen, living room, a small bathroom, off street parking and a private patio area with umbrella.

Location is perfect -- we are within a short walk to many restaurants, breweries, and shops! We love our little neighborhood, but we also love that it is so easy and quick to get Downtown (~2 miles, 10 min by car) and other parts of Denver. Sloan's Lake nearby is a plus!
neighborhood_overview: We love our little slice of the city in the West Highlands. It is a perfect mix of cute shops, trendy restaurants, laid back places, and the outdoors (looking at you Sloan's Lake). It is a very safe area that you can walk to so many cool places from the guest house! There are about 7 breweries within a 1.5 radius of us, so if you like beer you are in the right neighborhood (actually, you might just be in the right city). It is nearby to some other cool areas too (Tennyson Art District and LoHi are our favorites in the area). We are located ~2 miles from downtown (10 minutes by car).

name: Remodel,clean,bright,quiet, top Location
description:
This is a smoke and pet free house.
*Refundable linen fee if you bring your own bedding and bath towel.
This unit is newly remodeled and spotless, wood floors, granite countertops, bathroom vanity, & spotless white tile bathroom. Includes a small closet, bathroom, full kitchen, & bedroom: flat screen TV, alarm clock, sitting area, stocked kitchen, & linens
Private entrance to our fenced back yard & patio
There are six apartments in our house. To find the other apartments, check out my profile
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is in the Perfect Denver Location. Central to everything, you can walk one mile in any direction and reach Major Denver attractions. Our house is in a quiet tree lined neighborhood. It is just two doors down from Restaurant Row, which is one of Denver's fastest growing, hippest destinations. Within one block of the house, there are several dining restaurants, a bakery, pubs, and fast food restaurants, and a 7-11. Walk just one more block and double your choices for food, coffee shops, Starbucks, shopping, and entertainment. Looking for local entertainment, the Denver nightlife is centered about 6 blocks from the house. Close enough to walk, but far enough that our neighborhood remains quiet.
Our neighborhood is officially City Park West, but is also called North Capitol Hill, Uptown, and Whittier Heights. We are adjacent to Downtown, Capitol Hill, the Central Business District CBD, Five Points, Central, Cheesman Park, Congress Park, Curtis Park, Baker, Linco

For an accurate picture of our rentals, check ALL of our 180+ reviews, that average over 4.5 stars.  We have been renting short term for over eight years, and strive to provide a peaceful, clean, quiet and joyful experience for all guests.
We live in Colorado and enjoy the outdoors.  We love to hike, ski, swim, garden, camp, and cook.  We travel as much as possible and usually end up in the Yucatan or the Colorado mountains.  Denver and the Rockies are spectacular and keeps getting better year after year. 
 
Our house has been in our family for two generations, and will someday be passed down to our children. name: Cozy Victorian Townhome, Trendy Lohi Neighborhood.
description:
Get a taste of Victorian Denver in a living room with preserved brick walls, stained glass and tall windows allowing lots of light. Rooms have high ceilings in this townhouse and are tied together with restored hardwood floors and original millwork.

City of Denver License # 2018-BFN-0004619

High ceilings, exposed brick walls, decorative trim and other elements make this original Victorian townhome a rare gem in a newly redeveloped neighborhood. The home is split level with the living room, dining room and kitchen downstairs and the bedrooms, office and bathroom upstairs. (Please note, guests with children should take extra precautions with the hardwood stairs.) Lots of natural light pours in through large windows and a patio is available for lounging in the back. There’s a 55” television in the living room and a 42” tv in the master bedroom. Granite counter tops and stainless appliances adorn the kitchen.

Guests have access to all areas accept the outdo
neighborhood_overview: The townhouse is in LoHi (Lower Highlands), a popular neighborhood due to its walking proximity to award-winning restaurants, breweries, and boutiques. Downtown Denver, Union Station, and Coors Field are just beyond the Highlands footbridge.

name: @Central Denver Perkyhouse

Free community laundry.

NO-SMOKING.

2-GUEST MAXIMUM.

Full sized bed with memory foam mattress.

Always parking on the block around the Perkyhouse.

name: Enchanting Escape
description: Step out of the usual boutique hotel routine and truly experience the liveliness of Denver. The Curtis Park Club has everything any wanderer needs to feel at home in the West. At The Curtis Park Club, our mission to provide every guest with the most memorable experience imaginable during their time in Denver. The Enchanting Escape is quaint, smaller room -  perfect for two people who want to spend as much time in and around Denver as possible.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Denver, Colorado, our charming Bed and Breakfast is located in the RiNo District and offers the perfect home base for your Mile High City adventure. Known for its eclectic mix of art, culture, and urban living, this neighborhood is an artistic and culinary mecca that will make your stay truly unforgettable.

Artistic Vibes: RiNo is Denver's premier art district, and you'll be surrounded by mesmerizing street art and colorful murals at every turn. Stroll down the streets and alleys to discover stunning graffiti, sculptures, and inspiring art installations. You'll quickly see why RiNo is often described as an open-air art gallery.

Craft Breweries: Craft beer enthusiasts, you're in for a treat! RiNo is home to numerous award-winning breweries and taprooms. Sip on unique, locally brewed beers while soaking up the lively atmosphere. Be sure to explore the RiNo Beer Trail for a taste of the best of Denver's craft beer scene.

description:
⬇️IMPORTANT! PLEASE READ ALL INFO⬇️
👋Check in starts at 2:00PM, checkout by 10:00AM
🌿Private basement mini-apartment
👮🏼‍♀️Denver law requires hosts in home too

❌Please read all house rules before booking.
neighborhood_overview:
🏡Nice neighborhood 10-15 minutes from DIA and 25-30 minutes from downtown Denver. Local shops, restaurants and entertainment are 5-10 min away by car, Uber or Lyft.

🚲There is a nice green area in the back of the house with a walk/bike trail that goes around a small lake. You can see various kinds of birds including hawks during the day and hear an owl at night. Driving alongside of the Rocky Mountain Arsenal National Wildlife Refuge, you will see elk, deer and prairie dogs.

name: Stay @ The "ARTBNB" One Of Denver's Coolest Homes!
description: The Artbnb is a one of a kind place to stay. Decorated with a collection of beautiful artwork and unique furniture, you are sure to feel at home during you time here. The house is smack in the middle of Uptown/City Park West Neighborhood in Denver and is a short walk, bike or car ride to all Denver has to offer.  Four  blocks away is 17th ave - Denver's  "restaurant row" which has many of Denver Local's favorite places to eat and drink. Come stay at the Artbnb and enjoy the Mile High lifestyle!
neighborhood_overview:
City Park West/Uptown has become one of Denver's most desirable places to live due to its easy access to City Park (Denver's Largest Park) and proximity to Downtown. On the grounds of City Park are the Denver Zoo, tennis courts, bike trails, and Denver Museum of Nature & Science. Along 17th Avenue are a number of Denver's best restaurants and bars, and many have now opened along Colfax Avenue just 2 blocks south from 17th Ave.
For Breakfast in the 'hood go to...
One Fold (4 blocks away), Syrup (6 blocks away), Petes Kitchen, Rosenberg's Bagels, or there is an Einstein bagels/Starbucks three blocks away on 18th and Franklin.
For Grub in the 'hood go to...
Stubens, Ace, Park Burger, and Avenue Grill are all on 17th Avenue, Sliceworks on Colfax is the best closest pizza, Shish Kabob Grill on Colfax has the best Hummus in Denver and great food. Pinche Tacos is on York and Okinawa is great sushi close by on Colfax.

name: Spacious Artist’s House in the middle of Denver
description: Fantastic, one of a kind 138 year old home with 2,550 spacious sf close to the best Central Denver has to offer. One block from the light rail or a short walk to Coors Field, the convention center, restaurants, music venues, RiNo (River North Arts District) and much more. Play cards and shuffleboard in the basement speakeasy/3rd bedroom or hang out around the fire pit out back while grilling with views of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Just three blocks away is the River North Arts District (RiNo) which made Food + Wine Magazine's 2018 Top 10 Coolest Neighborhoods. There you'll find hundreds of great murals, coffee shops, restaurants galore, nightlife and the largest concentration of Brewery's, Cideries, Distilleries and Wineries in a 1 square mile radius anywhere in the country with 18 Breweries and counting. If you'd like to venture a bit further, you'll be a 15 minute walk from Coors Field which is surrounded by some of Denver's hottest clubs and nightlife activities. If you don't want to walk, there are scooters for rent all over. Uber and Lyft are also a great way to get around.
Also close is City Park where you'll find a golf course, Nature and Science Museum and the Denver Zoo.

name: Savor Alfresco Breakfasts at a 1920s Voyager's Garden Oasis
description:
Sink into a chocolate leather armchair & ottoman by the fireplace and soak in the open feel of a 1925 bungalow minutes from downtown. Pass through the French doors for breakfast each morning surrounded by calming, colorful plants.

Tucked between Highland Square and Sloan’s lake, we are in the midst of fabulous restaurants, boutiques, and breweries that are only steps away.

Great transit options make attractions near Denver/Boulder & the mountains of Colorado accessible without renting a car.
neighborhood_overview:
The vibrant northwest Denver neighborhood of West Highland is one of Denver’s best! Highland Square boasts wine, cheese, fish, gourmet bread and ice cream shops. Colorado is also known as the Sonoma-Napa of beer, and local breweries abound.

Within one block walking you can get to SloHi Bike & Bagel shop or Hogshead brewery where they have an array of English cask ales.

It is a 5 to 8 minute walk to Sloans lake where you can find trails for all uses and make your way to Edgewater market.

name: ♥ "Hygge" Retreat Sloan Lake ♥ Comfy, Clean, Close
description:
Indulge in the ultimate cozy getaway at your two bedroom retreat near downtown Denver! Your charming garden level suite in a 1930 bungalow boasts beautiful design and boutique comforts. Savor a tasty meal in fully stocked kitchen, unwind with movies/games, drift off to restful sleep in snug beds.

neighborhood_overview: The West Colfax neighborhood is changing with the redevelopment of the former St. Anthony Hospital just three blocks away and the opening of the West line of the Light Rail system. name: Updated & Cozy Denver Bungalow
description: Minutes from Downtown Denver, RINO, LoDo and the Highlands, this cozy 3 bedroom bungalow in Denver's Chaffee Park neighborhood is close to everything! Conveniently located with access to I-70 & I-25 our home is great for Denver-area stays and makes for SUPER EASY access to the I-70 corridor for mountain day trips and getaways.
neighborhood_overview: The Chaffee Park neighborhood is a quiet Denver neighborhood that is beginning to emerge. Most residents in this area have lived here for 20+ years. There is a large concrete tower located to the northeast of the home. While it may look like an imposing structure, rest assured that it's harmless. The tower houses legacy microwave equipment that was in use from the mid-1960's to the mid-1970's. The tower was part of a nationwide network that was effectively an early incarnation of the internet. Since going out of service in the mid-1970's, the equipment has been deactivated and the space is currently vacant and not in use.

name: Cozy private suite in Stapleton
description: You'll love our cozy, brand new guest suite in Stapleton. Your space has a private entrance, one bedroom, a relaxing separate living room, kitchenette and full bathroom. There is easy access to public transportation, walking trails, the Rocky Mountain arsenal, restaurants and shops, and several parks. We can't wait to share our favorite city with you!
neighborhood_overview:
Beeler Park is Stapleton’s 11th neighborhood, located in the Northeast corner of the Stapleton community, roughly 15 miles from Denver International Airport and 9 miles from Lower Downtown Denver. To the West is Dick Sporting Goods Park, home to the Colorado Rapids professional soccer club and the biggest names in music and entertainment. To the North is the 15,000 acre Rocky Mountain Arsenal National Wildlife Refuge, offering numerous drivable and walkable paths with incredible views of wild buffalo, deer, birds, as well as a variety of native flora and fauna.

Within Beeler Park, there is no shortage of things to do and see. Five unique parks offer playgrounds and activities for kids of all ages, while three distinct green spaces offer gathering areas for family and friends alike. And Beeler Plaza, located on the Beeler Park Crescent and near retail, offers shaded adirondack seating and long community tables to bring everyone together.

description:

Enjoy the breathtaking view of the Denver skyline, incredible location, and amazing amenities, including a heated swimming pool, fitness center, and clubroom!
neighborhood_overview: This condo offers a great location and a gorgeous view of the historic Daniels and Fisher Clock Tower in Denver Downtown. Denver Downtown is a vibrant neighborhood in the heart of the city. It's the central business district of Denver and home to many government buildings, corporate offices, universities, shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues. The neighborhood is dotted with skyscrapers, including the iconic Republic Plaza, the tallest building in Denver. The 16th Street Mall, a pedestrian-friendly shopping and dining district, is a popular attraction for locals and tourists alike. Denver Downtown is also known for its arts and cultural scene, with the Denver Art Museum, the Colorado Symphony Orchestra, and the Denver Performing Arts Complex all located within the neighborhood. The area is easily accessible via public transportation, including light rail and buses. With its mix of urban amenities and historic landmarks, Denver Downtown is a great place to live, work, and play.<b

neighborhood_overview:
I bought the home in June 2018 and have grown to love the neighborhood. The house sits on the border between the traditional Park Hill neighborhood and the newer City Park (formerly Stapleton). This offers the advantage of staying in a well-lived and loved neighborhood with easy access to amenities.

Just a block away, you'll find a shopping center with a large grocery store, three different types of fitness facilities, and plenty of restaurants. Whether you're looking for a quick lunch at Chipotle, a yoga session at Core Power, or a delicious meal at Little India, the neighborhood has something for everyone. There are also several other commercial centers within a close radius for all your shopping, dining, and entertainment needs.

host_about:
Hi!  I'm a 5th generation Denver native with roots and pride in my place.  I love welcoming people to the Mile High City and putting our best foot forward by hosting my home.  In July 2020 I also become owner and proprietor of a very cool property in Western Colorado currently hosting three tiny homes.

Before COVID I spent several long stretches of the year working as a Tour Director.  I lead small groups on wonderful vacations like "Italy's Great Cities," or the "Best of Spain." I also lead student groups to DC and NYC, and birthright tours to Israel.

Long term travel is in my system.  I've spent years at a time in Morocco for the US Peace Corps and more years in each of Japan, Israel and Costa Rica working mostly as an English teacher and basketball coach.

Between the really long living abroad situations, I tried to see as much as I could see.  From the top bunk of a crowded boxcar on the Trans-Siberian Railway, to five-star hotels in Jerusalem I stayed everywhere.  Seeing the best and worst of accommodations, I learned to love the hospitality game.  

In 2014 I returned to Denver to became a family caregiver.  I began hosting a small family owned condo in Denver.  That little condo kept my pockets jingling and my mind spinning for four years.  So many problems!  Floods and bugs and drugs, Oh my!

But I worked that little listing, and I leveraged my hard-knock education into SuperHost status.  When it came time to trade up, I sold the condo and found this wonderful house in Denver.  I selected it specifically because I recognized its versatility as an AirBnB property.  

This home will forever be a work in progress.  It will never be perfect.  But it may be perfect for you!  I am an individual home owner and not a large conglomerate or property management company.  I'm working to improve and integrate new technology including dynamic pricing, limited automated messaging, and streamlining all my cleaning processes.

Would love to have you see these little passion projects of mine.  Speak to you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! This is by far the most active and up and coming area of Denver. The loft is situated in Union Station North and is a great hub to access everything downtown Denver has to offer.

Union Station and the Light Rail are just down the street, about a 10 minute walk (0.7 mi) and provides direct access to the Denver International Airport. Union Station is a beaux arts-style transport hub that has amazing places to eat and drink, plus summer events that include concerts and a weekly farmers' market.

Coors Field, home of the Colorado Rockies, is right around the corner and is also about a 10 minute walk (0.5 mi). Pepsi Center is the home of the Denver Nuggets basketball and Colorado Avalanche hockey teams and is 1.2 miles away. Broncos Stadium at Mile High is home to the Denver Broncos and is 2.2 miles away.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview:
We live in the historic Clayton neighborhood which is a wonderful, quiet and diverse neighborhood. There's a mix of young people, families and seniors from all different backgrounds and we ask that you respect everyone you encounter.

Within walking distance you can find River and Roads Coffee Shop, Tres Girasoles Mexican Grill, Tighe Brothers Distillery, NOLA, Jack Rabbit Slims Sports Bar and an array of fast food. City Park is 6 blocks south which is home to the Denver Zoo, the Denver Museum of Nature & Science, and boasts many outdoor activities, music concerts, paddle-boating and more. We are a short drive or bike ride (about 3 miles) from Downtown Denver, Coors Field, Union Station, Larimer Square, 16th Street Mall and the hundreds of restaurants and bars Denver has to offer. If you're here to ski, you can hop on I-70 easily to get to the mountains (but no promises about I-70 traffic when you head back to the city!)

neighborhood_overview: Berkeley is a city-center neighborhood in Denver, Colorado, located in the area traditionally called Northwest Denver on the west side of Interstate 25 and just south of Interstate 70. The neighborhood is bounded by Federal Boulevard on the east, I-70 on the north, Sheridan Boulevard on the West and 38th avenue on the south. It is bordered by the West Highland neighborhood on the south and is often erroneously grouped together with the Highlands. The neighborhood contains two lakes surrounded by parks, one eponymous (stretching from 46th Avenue to I-70 and Sheridan Boulevard to Tennyson Street) and Rocky Mountain Lake Park (stretching from Lowell Boulevard to Grove Street and 46th Avenue to I-70). Berkeley Park also contains the William Scheitler Recreation Center, run by the City and County of Denver and including both indoor and outdoor public pools. neighborhood_overview: Berkeley is a city-center neighborhood in Denver, Colorado, located in the area traditionally called Northwest Denver on the west side of Interstate 25 and just south of Interstate 70. The neighborhood is bounded by Federal Boulevard on the east, I-70 on the north, Sheridan Boulevard on the West and 38th avenue on the south. It is bordered by the West Highland neighborhood on the south and is often erroneously grouped together with the Highlands. The neighborhood contains two lakes surrounded by parks, one eponymous (stretching from 46th Avenue to I-70 and Sheridan Boulevard to Tennyson Street) and Rocky Mountain Lake Park (stretching from Lowell Boulevard to Grove Street and 46th Avenue to I-70). Berkeley Park also contains the William Scheitler Recreation Center, run by the City and County of Denver and including both indoor and outdoor public pools. Berkeley has experienced rapid growth and rise in property values in the last 20 years and particularly since the closing of Elitch Gar

name: Park Hill Full Bed private room optional 2nd bed
description:
Room with 1 full sized bed, dresser, love seat, and walk in closet...A 2nd bed can be set up with advanced notice! Door can be locked for privacy.

Room has space heaters, fans, check out the amenities for more detail.

Ground level, front door has 2 steps to get inside; building sits far back from street.

A park across the street!

More details in "neighborhood" section-this location is close to downtown, active neighborhoods, highways, major roads, transit & bicycle routes.
neighborhood_overview:
North Park Hill is a historic location of Denver, bordering Martin Luther King Jr Blvd and Colorado Blvd. It is one of the most mixed neighborhoods of the city where you can find everything from local breweries to amazing soul food.

This location is right across from a small local park; less than a mile and a half away from the RTD A Train from Denver International Airport (40th and Colorado Station); 1.5 miles to the South is Denver Museum of Nature & Science, the Denver Zoo, City Park, and the infamous Colfax Avenue.

This location borders Central Denver and is extremely close to City Park, Rhino, Congress Park, Skyland, Stapleton, Hale, Clayton,Cole, Whittier; and less than a 15 minute drive to Capitol Hill, Five Points, Cheeseman Park, Golden Triangle, downtown, and Cherry Creek.

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is called Westwood and is located on the southwest side of Denver. The main street through the neighborhood is called Morrison Road Corridor and is colored with beautiful murals along the entire strip. Within walking distance (along Morrison Road) you'll find several Mexican restaurants, a Mexican ice cream parlor, a few bars, a couple of small/tiny grocery spots, a liquor store and dispensary. Khalos Mexican Restaurant is particularly tasty with lots of vegetarian and vegan options, fresh juices and smoothies along with all of your favorite Mexican dishes.  Cultura Chocolate, across the street from Khalos, has unique gift shop and serves amazing tasting chocolate, teas and coffees. On the weekends a Mayan food truck is open just behind the cafe and serves some yummy foods and I hear they smoke the meat underground over night. neighborhood_overview: South Park Hill is considered one of the best neighborhoods in Denver metro. We are located on the coveted 17th Avenue Parkway, among some of Denver's most beautiful old homes. There is a glorious center parkway right in front of our house ideal for walks or a run that goes east for nearly 2 miles with beautiful trees and greenery and some of the best architecture in the city. And to the West one block you will find City Park...one of the largest parks in Denver at 3 miles around. It backs up to The Denver Zoo and houses The Denver Museum of Nature & Science. One of our favorite evening strolls is walking through City Park around the lake and by the boat house. :)

host_about:
Billy and Tahvory have been together for 20 years! Tahvory is a Colorado native born and raised in the Boulder area and Billy was raised on the East coast in Guilford Connecticut and has lived in Colorado since 1990 and considers himself a local.  They've lived in the neighborhood for 20+ years and have watched it grow into the thriving neighborhood it has become! They both love the outdoors and spend a lot of their time enjoying the amazing mountains of Colorado. Tahvory is a hiking enthusiast and Billy has been skiing since he was 3 years old and gets out on the mountain as much as possible. 

Billy and Tahvory are both very social people and know the city and it's many fun places to explore!!  Feel free to ask any questions about restaurants or nightlife.  Their biggest hope by opening this space to guests, is to  provide a unique and personal  experience on their visit to Denver, and if the timing is right meet some very interesting people during their stay in their home.

If you choose to stay with them, don't hesitate to call them if you need advice about this beautiful city they call HOME.

host_about:
Greetings Airbnb travelers. Welcome to Denver Colorado!

I’ve learned a couple things from my business career and 15-year experience with VRBO/Home Away. First: no matter how competitive or “mature” your market is, there is always room for a company that does it right. And: listen to your guests, get creative and provide dazzling service.

You already have the location and amenities. I look forward to helping make your stay in Denver-the best.  I’m a Colorado native, University of Colorado at Boulder grad, businessperson, City-dweller and outdoor adventure junkie. My passions are family, snow skiing and exploring my surrounding urban environment.

I look forward being here for you and providing an appropriate and memorable personal touch, even if that means staying out of your way.  Please feel free to connect with me via text, phone or email-anytime. Thank you for taking a look.

Tim

name: Contemporary Berkeley 3 BED/3 BATH & Outdoor Patio
description: This property is centrally located in Denver’s charming Berkeley neighborhood where you’ll find easy access to restaurants/bars, breweries, coffee, shopping and outdoor recreation. The unit features 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, living/dining area and outdoor patio. Easy access to DIA, downtown, Tennyson St., Highlands and all that Denver has to offer!
neighborhood_overview: Berkeley has a quiet small town feel but is close to some of Denver’s most popular restaurants, shops breweries and so much more. There are several coffee and restaurant options within walking distance. Tennyson Street is about a mile away and is lined with an eclectic mix of art galleries, shopping, breweries and unique amenities. Rocky Mountain Lake park is a few blocks away and Berkley Lake Park is less than a mile away both are perfect for picnics or an evening stroll. This funky neighborhood is full of local flavor and offers a unique Denver experience!

name: Private Suite: 9 mi downtown, 14 mi to Airport
description: We live in new and diverse Central Park/Northfield neighborhood.  We love sharing our space and neighborhood with those visiting the Mile High City.  We are located between the airport and downtown and are 5 minutes away from the Central Park Station RTD "A" line which takes you to the airport or the "E" line which takes you to downtown.  This space is close to shopping,  entertainment and restaurants. This sparkling clean, cozy space is ideal for business travel or a relaxing getaway.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet family neighborhood in the diverse Central Park/Northfield area. The area is considered urban living which means that residents have a home within walking/biking distance to parks, pools (summertime), biking and walking trails, shopping, restaurants and entertainment. We are 5 minutes away from the Central Park RTD Station with direct access to both DIA and Union Station (downtown Denver). You can take Uber or Lyft to the Station or you can drive and it offers free parking for the day (not overnight).

This space is 1.5 miles to Dick's Stadium (home to the Colorado Rapids Soccer team and summer concerts), 9 miles to Downtown/Coors Field, 11 miles to Empower Field at Mile High Football Stadium, 15 minute ride to City Park which houses the Denver Zoo, Museum of Nature and Science and IMAX theater, and 14 miles to DIA.

We live within walking/biking distance to the Northfield neighborhood of Central Park which offers the following:
Starbucks,

Hi,  I am a Colorado native  and my husband is from up-state NY.  We count  being out in nature, whatever the season, as pretty much, our favorite thing.   We also love to meet new people and exploring small towns, big cities, and trekking far off the beaten path.

name: Hot Tub & Fabulous Yard! Near DU & Levitt!
description:
Lovely backyard w/ Hot Tub!

Fabulous location walking distance to food & drinks, close to Levitt Pavilion (free live music!) & Denver University.

Renovated private basement studio apartment of a 1929 classic bungalow. Full kitchen, bath, laundry.

Comfy king size bed along with a huge couch.

Enjoy the Colorado sunshine and beautiful backyard (smoking outside OK).

The owner lives on the main level with his two friendly pups, Franklin & Theo.

Hot tub shared with upstairs residents.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on the popular “South Broadway” which hosts a ton of restaurants, bars, breweries, dispensary’s, and liquor stores all within walking distance. Awesome neighborhood with a TON to offer.

LOCALS KNOW:
Denver’s South Broadway neighborhood, affectionately known as SoBo, has grown from a major artery into downtown to an eclectic and funky mix of taverns, clothing stores, unique eateries, bookstores and hip, live music venues with rainbow crosswalks and dedicated bike lanes. From craft breweries, distilleries and cideries to sundrenched, rooftop patios, South Broadway thrives on the unique energy of its residents and visitors.

Home to Antique Row, South Broadway is not only a destination for pieces from the 17th century, but also for immersive art experiences at vibrant, independent galleries. Check out Turn of the Century Antiques for dolls and toys and Spectra Art Space for contemporary art pieces in a fun, welcoming environment.

COOL

name: Modern Victorian in Highlands
description: Beautiful Victorian home is 1 block away to colorful Highlands shopping and dining. The perfect home base to explore Denver. Five minutes to Downtown, 3 minutes to LOHI, and 8 minutes to RINO, this 3 bedroom/1.5 bath two-level renovated Victorian is convenient, and perfect for larger groups & families. A gorgeous private garden patio backyard is dreamy for entertaining with market lights and hurricane candles. It has beautiful citrus and succulents and a grapevine arbor lounge area with a BBQ.
neighborhood_overview:
Highlands is a fun historic neighborhood, and one of the most walkable. You can easily walk up the alley to 32nd Ave where you’ll find NOVO coffee, El Camino tavern for authentic Colorado Mexican food and great margaritas, FnG restaurant for delicious sliders and burgers, mondo vino wine store for a superlative wine and special Colorado distilled spirits and brews, and Salt & Grinder for perfect sandwiches to take on hike. The Perfect Petal is our floral and retail boutique. You should find fun homewares and cards. Next door is Ruby Jane for all your travel apparel shopping needs!

The next neighborhood over is called LOHI. (Lower Highlands) there you’ll find incredible restaurants and views of the city. We love Bar Dough, Uncle, señor Bear, Old Major, El Five, Linger, Family Jones and Root Down. I would take a short LYFT rather than walk but it depends on your fitness level.

RINO is close and is THE hot area right now. Look for all of the art murals along Lari

neighborhood_overview: Walk to City Park, the Denver Zoo, the Nature and Science Museum, playgrounds, local pools, dog parks, restaurants, bars, coffee shops and music venues. Central location with access to downtown, uptown, DIA, Coors Field, and more.

Super friendly and fun!.  I travel a lot for my work and I love it.  When I am home I am working in experiential marketing and live events, writing or coaching my remote clients.  Very energy conscious, texture and design obsessed, and love creating experiences for others.

Jessica

name: Urban Chic Loft Steps to Downtown Restaurants/Bars
description: Top floor of 1881 townhome. Fully renovated and artfully decorated with exposed brick, bay windows (overlooking Welton street on edge of downtown), central AC, hardwood floors, living room that opens to the kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and 2 bedrooms each with a new queen memory foam mattress.  Secure parking behind the building. Walking distance to Coors Field, restaurants, breweries, cafes, RINO/Larimer Street, 16th Street, & downtown.
neighborhood_overview: The Historic Five Points neighborhood is one of Denver’s oldest and most lively neighborhoods. It is filled with, and surrounded by, bars, restaurants, shops, galleries, and other attractions. The townhome is 1/2 block to the light rail stop (L line), a 5 minute walk to breweries and restaurants including Woods Boss brewing, Rosenberg’s Bagels & Deli, Birdcall, and a 10 minute walk to the grocery store (Safeway). It is also just a few blocks from downtown, less than one mile from Coors Field and Larimer street, one mile from the convention center, and two miles from the Pepsi Center.

name: Denver Guest Suite
description: Bright and sunny 2 story private guest suite in nice Hilltop/Mayfair/Crestmore home. Private entrance, 1 bed, 1 bath, granite counters and stainless steel appliances. 2 Private Balcony's and very quiet neighborhood. Hardwood floors on 1st floor and carpeting upstairs in the bedroom. Bathroom is off the bedroom.  Great neighborhood, close to Cherry Creek, Congress Park, Lowry, Uptown. Lots of shops and restaurants within a few minutes drive.  Easy access to DIA and I-70.  Cable,  WiFi.
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful residential neighborhood. Very safe to walk in the morning and at night.  We have many parks close to the house and many people walk their dogs on the tree lined 6th Ave Parkway.

host_about:
Hi, We are Evan & Brad. We are active guys who enjoy all that Colorado has to offer, hiking, camping, skiing and snowboarding, concerts and exploring all the restaurants in Denver. We have 3 very friendly dogs, 2 Golden Retrievers and a Labradoodle. We love to travel both within the US and Internationally. 
We enjoy meeting new people and are happy to get to know our guest and give  advice on what to do in Denver etc.

name: Private Apartment in Gardener's Cottage-NW Denver
description: This place has it all in a charming and walk-able neighborhood. Easy access to downtown,  Regis University, I-70 and the mountains, and walking distance to Tennyson St. breweries, restaurants, coffee shops, bars and more. There is a grocery store, a liquor store and three parks within walking distance. Enjoy the small town feel of a neighborhood with every amenity you could want while having quick and easy access to Denver’s downtown, sports stadiums and the historic Highlands neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood and the many interesting small businesses and restaurants that make it unique. You will find almost anything you need is within walking distance including a  bus line that goes straight downtown, a grocery store, liquor store and all kinds of bars and restaurants. Want to cozy up with a book at coffee shop or bookstore? We've got that. Is a micro-brew bar crawl more your style? There are four breweries within less than a mile and more a little further afield. Looking for live music? Check out The Oriental Theater, Tennyson Tap or other bars.  Want a drop-in Yoga class or other work out? We've got you covered. All of this is nearby, yet our street is nice and quiet at night; it's the best of all worlds.

Gardening and travelling are my favorite hobbies. My husband and I are both teachers and spend our summers travelling or working in the garden and fixing up our almost 100 year old cottage. We obsess over the World Cup, love exploring local food and culture wherever we travel, and try to get away to the Rocky Mountains as much as possible. 

We are very comfortable giving guests or hosts as much quiet and privacy as they  prefer, but also enjoy chatting about local favorites and travel ideas.

name: Ballpark Loft near Union Station (LoDo)
description:
Just around the corner from Coors Field! LoDo neighborhood features some of the hottest restaurants and bars. Very easy access to light rail at Union Station (10-15 min. walk) with direct access to Denver Airport. Have a car? Covered and heated garage parking spot is included with all long term stays!

Unit is located on the top floor of building, featuring 16' ceilings & large windows. Beautiful views of Coors field and the Denver skyline from the turf balcony - complete with BBQ grill.
neighborhood_overview: Great LoDo location sandwiched between RiNo and LoHi. You can walk, take an Uber/Lyft or catch a Bird, Lime or Lyft scooter to explore all that Denver has to offer.

name: Cozy basement suite in beautiful garden setting!
description: Enjoy a Denver escape in this private basement apartment with separate entrance. Located in desirable Sunnyside area in North Denver, it's a quick car/bike/scooter ride to Downtown Denver, Mile High, Coors Field, Pepsi Center. Walking distance to amazing restaurants and bars. Features 1 large bedroom with an attached second bedroom area separated by a curtain; full bath, kitchenette and ample dining/living/work space.
neighborhood_overview:
Adjacent to the popular Highlands neighborhoods of Denver, Sunnyside has its own, somewhat rustic charm, that sets it apart.

The Sunnyside neighborhood is an historic area in Northwest Denver. It's a quick commute to DIA, Boulder and downtown Denver. Our rental is located in the Southwest corner of Sunnyside, just across the street from the well-known Highlands neighborhood. Just within a 1-mile radius are beautiful parks, craft breweries, unique ice cream shops, amazing restaurants and boutique shopping. Most major event centers are less than 10 minutes away.

host_about:
I love working outside in the garden - it's pretty obvious when you see my yard. I love it so much, I turned it into a business. I'm also a graphic designer, which I do on a freelance basis.  I don't love the cold of winter but I deal with it because I love living in Colorado and I'm an avid skier. I grew up in Southern California and then spent several years in the midwest (near Chicago).

I've done some traveling and would like to do a lot more. Italy was my favorite (so far) and Greece runs a close second. I am looking forward to going to Africa next year.

I'm new to Airbnb. I have tried really hard to make an inviting and comfortable space. I'm pretty quiet and will stay out of your way unless you need me for something. If we do bump into each other - probably in the backyard when I let the dog out - I love talking to new people and look forward to meeting you!

name: RiNo 2BD Victorian House w/ Awesome Patio
description:
Super charming 2 bedroom Curtis Park home, close to all the restaurants and action of RiNo/Ballpark/Lodo, while maintaining the historic feel of Denver's oldest neighborhood. Private cozy backyard with comfortable patio, grill, outdoor dining and off-street parking.
Owners have been actively involved in helping & rescuing local alley cat colonies for over a decade! A chance to enjoy a glimpse of 2 resident outdoor cats - friendly but very shy. National Geographic in your backyard!
neighborhood_overview: The house is located where the Curtis Park-Five Points Historical District and the River North District (RiNo) meet, which translates to a quieter residential street a block from all of the action of Larimer St.  Across the street, Uchi Sushi is a stones throw away.  A block away, you'll find an amazing assortment of restaurants, Cart-Driver, Work & Class, Los Chingones, Port Side Cafe, The Ramble Hotel (Death & Co, The Garden,Super Mega Bien).  If parks interest you, Curtis Park is a short walk away.

This home can comfortably host 6 guests (For extra guests or children needing a futon or pack and play please make a special request for exceptions to the total amount of people. Additional charges may apply).
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is extremely popular because of the location. The light rail station is just two blocks away where you can head to Downtown hassle free. Starbucks, is just 2.5 blocks to the south on Evans Ave along with all of the students favorite dinning spots including; Jerusalem's (a staple in Denver open till 2:00pm) Petes cafe, Poke, Jelly, Fermaentra Brewery and tap room, Spanky's Urban Roadhouse and more. A 15 min walk or 4 minute drive to the west are the very popular Shops and restaurants at Platt park including the best restaurant in Denver, Sushi Den! The shops at Wash park are only 6 minutes away. If you're down for a run around the park then just head 6 blocks to the north east and the 161 acre park will keep you and your family or friends entertained for the entire day. Enjoy paddle boarding, jogging paths, biking, rollerblading, basket ball, tennis, croquet or rent an paddle boat or multi person bike and explore the sights!

Walk the short 9 blocks to gorgeous Sloan's Lake (you don't want to miss this!), or stroll/ride down a beautiful bike path to downtown, the Flagship REI store, Confluence Park or the Denver Aquarium. We also have fun new hang-out spots like the Alamo Draft House, Tap & Burger at Sloan's Lake, Seedstock Brewery and a few dispensaries all within walking distance. Our neighborhood boasts of many scooter rentals as well as bike rentals, and there are an abundance of yummy restaurants and breweries that line the lake if you want to enjoy your dining experience while soaking up one of Denver's finest views (the city skyline behind this awesome lake)!!

name: Quaint Carriage House Near Downtown & Interstate
description:
Let our cozy & private carriage house be your home away from home, whether you're looking for a place to retreat for a getaway, a spot to get things done while traveling for work, or just somewhere to park your things and rest your head while you explore Denver.
The Clayton Carriage House provides the amenities you need to make you feel at home while offering you the ideal location and resources to let you get out there and discover all Denver has to offer from downtown to the mountains.
neighborhood_overview: Boasting a 78 walkscore, we are just 10 minutes on foot to Denver's largest park, City Park, and less than a 10 minute drive to the heart of downtown.
