host_about:
Hey there!  We are Stetson & Megan Jenkins, thirty-somethings living in the heart of Denver.  We are both originally from Virginia but call Colorado home.  We moved here because Denver is the perfect blend of everything we love:  during the day you can be in the mountains in 30 minutes and by nightfall you can be catching a show, eating and drinking at a hole in the wall gem or a fancy night out.
We love to be outside hiking, camping, cycling, climbing, or enjoying one of Denver's 250+ parks.  We also love all that Denver has to offer as far as nightlife -- everything from the ballet and theater to concerts at venues big and small, and we are huge foodies -- always searching for the best brunch and speakeasies.  We also just became parents in December of 2018 so we are adjusting to parent life and spending more time at home :-)
We have used Airbnb all over the country for both work and pleasure and are hoping to offer you what we feel like is the best experience.  We can be as hands-on or hands-off as you'd like.  Please feel free to reach out to us if you need anything at all, but we can also completely stay out of your hair if that's your flow as well.  We want you to feel at home in our quaint space but we also realize that sometimes all you need is a place to rest your head and you're out the door -- after all, you're here to take in all that Denver has to offer!

name: Bright, spacious home, minutes from downtown
description:
Enjoy 2,000 sq ft of space with 2 large living rooms for gathering and 2 kitchens. The upstairs has two bedrooms, one bathroom and a living room, and the basement has 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, and a large family/game room. Both floors have their own kitchens.

The house and yard are unobstructed to the south so they generally get a lot of sunshine.

It's only a 10 minute drive or Uber/Lyft to downtown, and there is parking for 3 cars behind the house.
neighborhood_overview: The house is a 10 minute walk to Sloan’s Lake, Joyride Brewing, and a few other restaurants on 25th St. There are a lot of restaurants/shops on Tennyson St. and 32nd St, which are just a 5 minute drive away. The new Edgewater Marketplace with 18 food and drink vendors is just a 20 minute walk, as well as Edgewater Beer Garden and Playa Bowls.

description: Newly renovated garden level unit of a historic bungalow, this cozy space is over 1100 square feet! Walking distance to landmark Washington Park, the light rail, coffee shops, boutiques, restaurants, and neighborhood bars. neighborhood_overview:
This beautiful historic bungalow sits conveniently between Washington Park and South Broadway, an up and coming area with arts and antiques shops, restaurants, sports bars, boutiques and “The Green Mile.” Less than one mile away is Old Pearl Street, home of the popular restaurant Sushi Den, Farmer’s Market on Sundays and many street festivals, live bands, events, and so much more. 2-3 block walk to Whole Foods, Orange Theory, Yoga and Pilates studio, liquor store, Herbal Cure Dispensary and neighborhood dive bars. On the other side of the park is Old Gaylord Street, with quaint boutiques, restaurants, rooftop patios, and year round festivals.

Washington Park centers on its namesake green space, a rectangular 160 acre expanse with a rec center, sports facilities, formal flower gardens and winding trails for cycling and jogging. name: Clean & Comfy Private Room * Ideal Location
description:
*Welcome to my Home -- the basement is modern, comfy, quiet & clean!

*Ideal Location: 5 min to the highway I25-Colo Blvd Exit -- easily access public transport -- close to d'town, DU & Cherry Creek -- walk to stores & restaurants.

*small Private Room: comfy twin -- space heater & fan.

*Bathroom: often private but might be shared with me.

*(Main Level) Kitchen, Living/Dining & Back Patio--great place to eat & relax.

neighborhood_overview:
*Virginia Village is residential, but also has an urban vibe. It is safe & walk-able, including at night -- nearby are many stores & restaurants (Starbucks, Safeway, Best Buy, Jamba Juice, Corner Store, Jaya Asian Grill, Hacienda Colorado).

name: Lovely garden level One block from Washington Park
description: This private apartment is on the lower level of our single-family home in one of Denver's most popular and centrally located neighborhoods.  It includes a comfortable living room,  full kitchen,  bedroom and bath.   Enjoy the comfy new queen bed, and if needed, there is a self- inflating twin mattress.  There's a private patio right outside your door so you can enjoy Denver's sunny days.
neighborhood_overview: Every season brings new beauty to Washington Park, less than a block away.   Year round you'll find Denver locals enjoying a run, a walk, or riding bikes -- enjoying the outdoors that Colorado is famous for. You'll be a short fifteen minute walk to two unique urban districts with great restaurants and locally-owned shops; Old South Pearl Street, and historic South Gaylord.  You can catch Denver's light rail train for a quick ride downtown to the theater district, concert halls and sports arenas.

name: Chill at a Totally Private Carriage House W Bamboo Orb Chair
description:
Completely private & professionally carriage home in historic South Pearl Street (https://www.southpearlstreet.com/)! Enjoy the Sunday Farmers Market. Take it easy in the hanging chair and check out the chalkboard map at this bohemian-inspired bolthole tucked away behind a 6-foot cedar privacy fence. Use your own front door to come and go as you please...you'll have complete privacy and never see the owners (unless you need them!) Quirky home details include a marching band bass drum table, an antique sewing machine treadle sink, and a 420 friendly patio with market lights. Doggos are welcome!

Pearl Alley is a unique little carriage house in a truly fantastic neighborhood! Construction on the carriage house was completed in 2019, but we designed it to feel like part of the original house, built in 1908. Reclaimed brick exterior, moldings to match the main house, and the original back door as the bathroom door! Our 400 sq ft carriage house is filled with cool decor (see if yo
neighborhood_overview: Platt Park has a walkability score of 87, nestled in the heart of Historic South Pearl Street (https://www.southpearlstreet.com/). name: Casa Tejon, Spacious Sunnyside Retreat | Hot Tub
description: Originally constructed in 1911, Casa Tejon is what you get when premium location meets immaculate restoration.  Grab a Colorado craft brew, freshly poured from the tap at the wet-bar, and make yourself comfortable inside or under twinkling lights around the gas fire pit in the backyard before heading out to enjoy any of the delicious restaurants in walking distance** With room to spread out and our new hot tub, all you and your family and friends have to do is relax and enjoy yourselves!
neighborhood_overview:
**For the duration of the social distancing orders, we ask guests to follow all official recommendations. Our neighborhood offers great walk-ability, several parks and has fantastic restaurants serving curbside to-go meals and beverages. It is also about a 15 minute walk to the Platt River trails and park system.

Sunnyside is a city-center neighborhood two miles from downtown Denver with easy access to I-25 and I-70. First formed in 1858, almost 20 years before Colorado became a state, it was annexed to Denver in 1896 and is currently home to about 10,000 residents. Sunnyside has an abundance of coffee shops, breakfast places, as well as cafes and restaurants featuring a wide variety of world cuisine. Patios are popular, allowing you to take full advantage of the Colorado sunshine. Multiple microbreweries reside in Sunnyside, several of them offering beer gardens. The neighborhood has four large, family-friendly parks. In fact, all homes in Sunnyside are within half a mile o

After a short "beach-life" stint, the two returned home to Denver to put down roots, get back to the mountains & share their love of travel & hosting with the Airbnb community.

name: Parking | Private Patio | Walkable Wash Park!
description:
Fabulously located condo that has everything you need for a fun extended stay in Denver. Perfect for WFH & home-base!

-Fast Wifi, Cable TV (2 TVs), In-Unit Laundry, 1 Reserved Parking Spot, Rare Private Patio!
-Walkable! Down the block from some of Denver's most sought after restaurants (Uncle, Carmine's on Penn, Michelin Bib Gourmand winner Mr Oso), coffee, Fitwall Gym!
-Walking distance to Wash Park (Denver's premier park)
-5 Mins from Downtown, easy to Cherry Creek trail (bike Downtown!)
neighborhood_overview: The Vibe: Local spots where urbanites and nearby residents—mostly 20- and 30-something renters, young-families, and homeowners—hang; foodies visiting the hood’s rich and varied selection of eateries; joggers finishing their loop at the adjacent Wash Park.

name: Beautifully Renovated 1 bedroom in Quiet Community
description:

Security building with large common area - gym and two pools - one outdoor and one in your building. The gym has machines and free weights, with wall-mounted TVs so you won't miss the news.

name: MAIN Street CITY Living with DECK!
description: Welcome to our Modern Baroque style apartment located in one of the oldest historical mansion in Denver ; build in 1889 . Mile away from Downtown, Zoo, Botanic Garden. Molly Brown Museum , LoDo , Union Station, Fillmore , Ogden Theater , Coors Field , Pepsi Center and Convention Center ; all major Denver attractions . Great for a quick gateway with friends or family stay . We appreciate high noise tolerance guests:)Pets are only allowed with prior approval and $50 fee 🙌.
neighborhood_overview:
City Park, Capital Hill, Uptown , Congress Park , East Colfax

We are located just East of Downtown Denver on Colfax Avenue - considered the longest and once named "The Most wicked main street in America" . Overall , Capitol Hill is an active and vibrant neighborhood. Coffe , bars, restaurants are step away , right within the same block . One of the most cosmopolitan neighborhoods in Denver , also well known as haven for artists and bohemians .

The apartment is very private and relatively "moderate" quiet for being on the main street in the city and right above the bar/restaurant . You might also hear sirens :)

The thoughtfully designed space is equally comfortable for one guest staying a single night or for a group of friends settling in for a week or more. Come stay with us!

name: Highlands Haven
description: Experience Denver like a local while staying at this stylish garden level studio in the trendy Highlands Neighborhood. This rental is in close proximity to everything in Denver. Visit Red Rocks, the Pepsi Center, or Bronco's Stadium, with easy access to the beautiful Colorado mountains. neighborhood_overview: Located in a safe and quiet neighborhood in the Highlands, everything you need is within a short distance of this rental.  Nearby are the Tennyson Street shops and restaurants, as well as the historic 32nd Square.  You are a short 10 minute drive or Uber ride from the downtown Denver/Lodo area, and close to I-70 if you prefer to take a trip to the mountains.  There are multiple park's nearby, a grocery store and restaurants within walking distance.  While the unit and the neighborhood is quiet, there is plenty of action not far away for those seeking it.

name: ♣ "Hygge" 1BR Sloan Lake ♣ Comfy, Clean, Close
description:
Indulge in the ultimate cozy getaway at your one bedroom retreat near downtown Denver! Your charming garden level suite in a 1930 bungalow boasts beautiful design and boutique comforts. Savor a tasty meal in fully stocked kitchen, unwind with movies/games, drift off to restful sleep in snug bed.

Driveway parking, smart lock entry, and fast wifi make your stay stress-free.

Minutes from heart of Denver and local eateries, brewpubs, coffee, Red Rocks, Rockies, Meow Wolf, or stroll Sloan Lake.
neighborhood_overview: The West Colfax neighborhood is changing with the redevelopment of the former St. Anthony Hospital just three blocks away and the opening of the West line of the Light Rail system. These have brought new restaurants, brewpubs, services, and people to West Colfax. Exciting times and the character of the neighborhood continues to grow with that. Sloans Lake just three blocks away is hub for people getting outdoors and recreating.

host_about:
Thanks for staying with me! My kids flew the coop and now I enjoy opening my home to fellow travelers from across the world who are here to explore all that Denver and Colorado offer from a vibrant city to the great outdoors.

I'm happy to provide recommendations for "my" Denver and Colorado or leave you to your own time and adventures.  

As a Colorado enthusiast, I bike, hike, run, and ski as well as explore the quickly changing city and state. I love ethnic food and particularly Thai and Vietnamese.  In the last several years I've traveled to SE Asia, Paris/Amsterdam, Munich for Oktoberfest, surfing in Costa Rica as well as visiting North Dakota, the last of the 48 states for me. In July 2021 I was thrilled to visit Alaska with my family for my 50th state! So many more places to explore!

name: UNIQUE! Carriage House in Historic Congress Park
description:
Centrally located in beautiful Historic Congress Park, a lovely & safe walkable neighborhood, this luxurious second floor loft style apartment has many stylish amenities.
Private entrance and parking in alley (for average size vehicles).
Chef's kitchen with expansive granite countertop, plenty of storage and fully equipped with all the basics you'll need to prepare your own meals.
There's sleeping for 3, a gorgeous bathroom with tub, high ceilings, a walk in closet.
neighborhood_overview: Super centrally located in a lovely, safe and highly walkable neighborhood.  You'll love the homes in Historic Congress Park. Walking distance to 3 parks, shops, restaurants, coffee shops, Denver Botanic Gardens, SIE art house cinema, Tattered Cover book store and so much more!  20 minute walk to Cherry Creek.  5 minute drive to downtown.

name: Superb Basement Apartment Retreat in Prime Denver
description:
Superb basement apartment retreat in a classic home centered in a prime city location!

By day, experience authentic Denver with easy access to unique restaurants, museums, parks and tons of local favorites – all within minutes. Or, venture into the Rocky Mountains for world-famous skiing/snowboarding, climbing, biking, hiking or rafting in Colorado nature.

Come evening, take in one of the many concerts, sports, pubs or galleries nearby before retiring to a comfortable and peaceful space.
neighborhood_overview:
Our wonderful urban neighborhood, Berkeley, is one of the most popular in Denver, sitting just outside downtown among mature trees, vintage homes and tons to see and do. It's a perfect blend of urban vibrancy and relaxing space. And, one of our favorite parts about living here is what's nearby. For example:

- 2 blocks to a huge park with a lake and big ol' trees (walking trails, tennis courts, fishing, etc.)
- 2 to 7 minutes to four areas hugely popular with Denverites for dining, nightlife, breweries, art, shopping and culture (Tennyson, Highlands Square, LoHi and RiNo)
- 3 minutes to Regis University; 8 minutes to the Auraria campus (Metro State, CU Denver and CC of Denver); 14 minutes to the University of Denver; 26 minutes to the University of Colorado
- 5 to 15 minutes to nearly all of Denver's concert venues
- 7 to 10 minutes to watch any of our four major sports teams (Broncos, Rockies, Nuggets, Avalanche)
- 8 minutes to Union Station (Denver'

Carolyn and I love Denver and Colorado entirely, and have lived here for years (I'm a native!) At home in our state, we thrive on art galleries, unique restaurants, mountain views, and fresh-powder skiing with a little organic gardening on the side.

When not at home, we absolutely love to travel and some of our favorite experiences have been diving in Bonaire, wine in Tuscany, or climbing the Acropolis in Athens. We're always looking for a new adventure!

Since we travel so much (and have stayed at a good chunk of Airbnbs ourselves), we like to put the knowledge of what we loved or what drove us nuts into our own Airbnb to make a space that's fantastic for our fellow travelers. We hope you love it!

name: Wash Park Carriage House: Two sit/stand desks!
description: Quiet upper flat near West Wash Park.  2 bedroom 1 bath with private entry & porch along with shared courtyard.  Great location, walking distance to the South Broadway strip and Washington Park.
neighborhood_overview: West Washington Park: This petite neighborhood is considered one of Denver’s most livable spaces. The area has a bubble effect—it sits barely south of Baker’s booming neighborhood and South Broadway dives, west of the ever-busy Washington Park, and walking distance to South Pearl Street, but maintains the air of quiet suburbia perfectly suited for families and professionals. Colloquially known as West Wash Park, the neighborhood is heavily residential, filled with early-20th century houses that have been turned into multi-unit rentals, and offers easy access to a variety of essential and just-for-fun amenities. (Think: grocery stores and fitness clubs, and watering holes and music venues.) Whether you’re a city dweller searching for a new date-night spot, or a Sunday volleyball player looking for a new place to fuel up and wind down after summer games, this residential stalwart offers many fun ways to recharge your routine.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

name: ⭐️ Monthly for work professionals  ☆ 88 WalkScore
description:
Please note we only rent monthly.

Welcome to your townhome in the heart of Denver's most trendy neighborhood - the Highlands! Our home features:

• SMART TV!
• Fully-stocked kitchen
• Business friendly
• Hotel-grade sheets
• Onsite washer/dryer
• 420-friendly (backyard only)
• Private backyard area
• Walkable to restaurants, bars, downtown area
• Pull out sofa
• Windows and natural light
• Bikeable (adjacent to great paths)
neighborhood_overview: Victorian-era homes and buildings; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors. There are three diverse districts to discover here: Highlands Square, Tennyson Street and Lower Highland (LoHi). Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highland Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great ethnic foods. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars, and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver. See the neighborhood map below to start exploring.

host_about:
My husband Seth & myself always say that we were Coloradans born mistakenly in California! We moved from California to Colorado in 1993 and never looked back. 

We live in historic Potter Highlands in a 122 year old brick bungalow, that we share with our two Chihuahuas, Frannie & Melvin. 

My life passions are.... making things look beautiful, helping to heal dogs, entertaining friends, gardening, live music, dancing, everything Mexico, the beach, white wedding cake, traveling the world and meeting other travelers! 

I really enjoy being an Airbnb host and have met some of the most wonderful and interesting people!

host_about:
Hi everyone! My name is Paulo and I'm a structural engineer based out of Denver, CO, but that's just my day job. My wife Melanie is in Sales and Marketing and works for the largest producer of beverage cans - beer, soda, even wine! 
Whenever we have some free time, we love to travel around the world and when we are home, we spend our time hanging with our sweet German Shepard, Hennie.  We're always happy to make new friends along the way on our adventures and indulge in all the local eats. We have a love of coffee, wine, whiskey and bread pudding....but then who doesn't. 

We’re excited to offer our garage apartment to guests on Airbnb. The unit is a brand new build and is centrally located for easy getting around - central to downtown, LODO, RINO, Uptown, 5 Points, and City Park. No matter your interests, we are just a short Uber away. If farm-to-table restaurants, craft beer, or trendy cocktails are your thing, you are close by. If live animals, museums, or parks are your desire, they are right in your neighborhood. 

We hope that you love the space as much as we do, and find Denver the perfect playground!

Melanie & Paulo

Great location in the center of Lower Highlands (LoHi) neighborhood, 2-3 blocks to many bars, restaurants, coffee shops, bus stop.  20-30 minute walk to Union Station & LoDo.  5 min Uber to center of downtown & RiNo.  Quiet & friendly street, parking on street. Hottest neighborhood in Denver - Lohi - This neighborhood has 50+ restaurants within walking distance. It's walkable to downtown via the Pedestrian Bridge at the bottom of Tejon. You will have your choice of eateries and coffee shops within 5 minutes of walking out the door and more as you venture towards downtown.

name: Sloan's Lake Mid-Mod Escape
description: With beautiful hardwoods, spacious, comfortable communal spaces, and a gourmet kitchen, guests can take advantage of entertaining at home or exploring the bars and restaurants of the tree-lined Highlands and Edgewater neighborhoods. Heading to the mountains for the day? Sloan's Lake is your ideal home base for alpine adventures, with easy access to i70. Very close to Denver favorites Cultura, El Chingon, and Tap & Burger.
neighborhood_overview:
A few years ago, a trip to Sloan’s Lake was all about the water: fishing the marina, paddling the scenic shoreline, and, of course, enjoying the famed Dragon Boat Festival. Today, the lake isn’t the neighborhood’s only attraction, thanks to a slew of cultural additions. Shops and restaurants have turned part of West 29th Avenue into a walkable strip, while developments like the Lakehouse condo community on the former site of St. Anthony’s Hospital are transforming the area near West Colfax. All you’ll need to enjoy the neighborhood are some comfy shoes and an empty stomach.

A construction boom has also characterized the Sloan's Lake neighborhood in recent years, with a flurry of both single-family homes and apartment units being built. Houses range from historical Victorian home plans to cozy bungalows, contemporary duplexes, and modern condos giving Sloan’s Lake residents an eclectic neighborhood drive and homes for all tastes.

Young professionals and young famil

name: Contemporary Comfort in Stapleton
description:
Look out to the mountains from the king suite's balcony, then slide open the glass doors for coffee on the porch. Have lunch to a panoramic backdrop on the rooftop deck. Then hop down to the basement for endless fun and games. Here, sleek modern design meets thoughtful touches like an expansive kitchen and a ping pong table and a pool table in the basement.

Convenient check-in and out with a keypad on the front door. Keypad code will be sent to you from host the day before check-in. Check-in is anytime after 3 pm. Check-out is anytime before 12 pm.

Guests have access to everywhere in the house except the office and the garage. Those two will be locked. Remember to check out the basement and enjoy the ping pong and pool table and Pac-Man!

name: Steck's Roost at Wash Park
description:
Steck's Roost at Wash Park is a cozy one bedroom retreat- only 2 blocks from Denver's popular Washington Park and minutes from excellent neighborhood restaurants and shops.

As a family owned business, we are committed to ensuring an outstanding lodging experience for our guests.

Apartment is garden level with private patio and separate entrance.
neighborhood_overview: Our home of 50 years is a brick bungalow built in 1910 and remodeled through the years. The neighborhood has seen new construction over many years and the home styles are quite eclectic, making Wash Park a very popular neighborhood to visit. There are excellent restaurants, specialty shops and businesses  within easy walking distance from the house. We are also on the cusp of downtown Denver and  renowned Cherry Creek Shopping boutiques, restaurants and stores.

host_about: We are long-time Denver residents and have lived in the same house in the popular Washington Park neighborhood of central Denver for over 40 years. Rick is a retired Denver teacher and has been a real estate broker since 1980. Betty is also retired after many years in the corporate world.   We have traveled extensively and enjoyed staying in B&B's in France, especially.  It is our hope that we can replicate that ambiance in our home. We love the area near our home because of easy access to great restaurants, walking in  the park, downtown Denver,  public transportation and to our beautiful Rocky Mountains.  We are delighted to be able to host Airbnb guests in our comfortable, one bedroom  apartment.

name: Beautiful, BIG, Bungalow! Near DT! All the Extras!
description: Enjoy this recently updated, historic, Four bed, Two bath bungalow with new furniture. Walking distance to the lively Tennyson Street or Regis University,  short Uber ride to downtown or Highlands Square. Be in the mountains in the morning (Red Rocks 17 min), and on a golf course, or downtown in the afternoon from this location. Rocky Mountain Lake Park is practically your back yard! The home is perfect for families or great for a group get away.
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to Rocky Mountain Park, Lakeside Amusement Park and the lively Tennyson street which includes some of the most amazing restaurants, bars, and retail locations in the city. Close to downtown and Highland Square!

name: Cozy Cottage Apartment in Historic Highlands
description:
Welcome to the Potter Highlands!!

We are so excited to welcome travelers to our brand new studio apartment in the heart of one of Denver's thriving historic districts.

Our private cottage style apartment was completed in late 2018 and was designed to be a comfortable, calm get away in the heart of our busy and growing city.

It is walking distance from fantastic restaurants, parks, and historical sites. It is a quick 5 minute drive (or 20 minute walk) into the heart of downtown Denver.
neighborhood_overview:
Potter Highlands is a fantastic neighborhood, and in our opinion, one of the best locations in Denver! There are numerous award winning restaurants within walking distance. The area has several parks and boutique shopping areas that are also within walking distance, or a short drive. If you are on a bike the town is your oyster and you can access numerous bike paths to get around town. We are about a 15-20 minute drive to the foothills and mountains beyond. One of our favorite weekend traditions includes a short walk to one of the best bakeries (The Wooden Spoon), a stop off at our local park and library (Highland Park and Woodbury Library), and an evening out at one of our many delicious restaurants (Root Down, Duo, etc), or a hand crafted cocktail at the local award winning speakeasy (Williams and Graham).
If you are driving, our neighborhood has abundant street parking. Uber/Lyft are fast and easy in our area, usually only taking a few minutes to arrive.

name: Denver Getaway Studio in Contemporary Rustic Style
description:
Slide back the bedroom barn doors made from Beetle Kill Pine from the Rocky Mountains set beneath an original 1909 beam and start the day in the dual-head over-sized shower. After a BBQ dinner, sit by the fire pit under the twinkling string lights. This cozy basement studio has everything you need to explore all Denver has to offer!

Get a great night's rest before heading out on your Colorado adventure! Cook meals in a fully-equipped kitchenette.
Utilize the spacious modern shower w/ dual shower heads.
Stay in to work, write that blog, cozy up to watch a movie, or read a book.

Parking is next to garage in back of house. Entrance is through back gate and backyard.

I am available as much or little as you would like to interact. I am happy to provide a local Denverite/Coloradan perspective and recommendations.

Located across the street from the Regis University Campus, this neighborhood is quiet yet bustling. Take an easy 4-minute wal
neighborhood_overview: Located across the street from the Regis University Campus, this neighborhood is quiet yet bustling. Take an easy 4-minute walk to the main street for breakfast at the bakery and cafe. Later, browse the antique store and visit the micro-brewery.

name: Private Spotless Denver 2 bdrm apt great location
description:
This very clean private second-floor sunny apartment in the host's home located in the Central Park (fka Stapleton) neighborhood is the perfect home-base for exploring Denver and front range with easy access to DIA and Downtown.

Exclusive private entry through the front door, two bedrooms, a great room, kitchenette, full bath; in a highly walkable neighborhood near restaurants, groceries, open space—easy parking, and a short drive to downtown Denver. NO CLEANING FEE and no intermediary company.
neighborhood_overview:
Built on the site of the original Denver airport, the Central Park (fka Stapleton) neighborhood is a walkable infilled part of the City of Denver. Within a 2 block walk is the Eastbridge Town Center with 5 different restaurants (some award-winning), and the Constellation Ice cream shop. There is also a Pilates studio and an Endorphin fitness studio in the town center. Across from the town center is the grocery (and Starbucks). You can find everything that you need, and Colorado just passed a law allowing you to buy beer at the grocery store (this is very thrilling for us locals). The store is stocking a great selection of local and national craft beers.

Just to the north is the beginning of miles of open space parkland. You can take a run or just walk and enjoy our hawks and bunnies. If you're lucky, you might spot a coyote. A short walk can take you to our municipal recreation center with a cardio room, weights, and an indoor pool.

name: Clean quiet carriage house close to lightrail
description:
Come enjoy a sanctuary in the city. Our quiet, cozy carriage house is within walking distance of the light rail, RiNo art district, restaurants and dozens of craft breweries. High speed fiber optic internet provided.

Located one mile from I-70, a trip to the mountains is within 30 minutes.

The apartment is filled with natural light and all the comforts of home. With a queen bed in the bedroom and a queen memory foam mattress on the sofa bed, four adults can comfortably stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Located two blocks from the trendy River North Arts District in the Cole neighborhood, you are close to many of Denver's best restaurants, breweries and art galleries. Proximity to two light rail stations makes travel further into the city or to Denver International Airport easy.

Our neighborhood is a great blend of the old and the new.

A new 7-11 is located one block away, Natural Grocers is 0.6 miles away, Safeway 1.3 miles away.

name: Artsy Haven in perfect Denver location.
description:
Take refuge from the city in this charming, eclectic 1920s bungalow. Sip your coffee next to the fireplace, or enjoy a morning walk through the tree-lined 'hood.

Lunch at the two delish restaurants steps from your door, then explore downtown, the Highlands, or LoHi. Or easily hop on the highway and enjoy the Rocky Mountains within an hour.

*Note that steep, uneven stairs lead to the extra bedroom in the basement, which also has low ceilings*

License # 2019-BFN-0010068 *NO PARTIES or PETS*
neighborhood_overview:
The Sunnyside neighborhood is one of Denver's best kept secrets. It is home to fun local coffee shops, boutiques and restaurants, yet still maintains a mellow neighborhood vibe.

The bungalow is 5 minutes from I-70 on ramp, 8 minutes from I-25, 10 minutes from Union Station, 8 minutes from The Mission Ballroom, 10 minutes from the Bronco's Stadium, 10 minutes from the Pepsi Center, 15 minutes from the Ellie Caulkins Theater and the rest of downtown's gems.

name: Abuelita's House: Walk to Breweries and Ice Cream!
description: Enjoy your stay in our studio carriage house literally just steps away from some of Denver's best restaurants, coffee shops and breweries. It was newly built for our Abuelita and Babu, and features a comfortable queen sized bed, fully equipped kitchen, wifi, smart TV, and washer and dryer. Abuelita's house is cleaned using CDC-approved cleaning products and techniques.
neighborhood_overview:
Platt Park is a super walkable neighborhood, full of restaurants, breweries, and shops. Walk out the back gate to check out our favorite brewery, Platt Park Brewery, some of Denver's tastiest ice cream at Sweet Cow, or a burger and fries at Park Burger. If you're a coffee addict like us, walk just one block north to enjoy a latte or fresh squeezed juice at Steam Espresso. If you're staying with us during the summer, the Pearl Street farmers' market runs every Sunday, featuring local produce, artisanal foods, and one-of-a-kind finds.

Need recommendations? Just ask!

name: Modern Guesthouse in Denver Highlands Neighborhood
description: Spend your nights in one of Denver's pristine neighborhoods; close to great restaurants, bars, boutiques, coffee shops, parks, and Sloane's Lake. name: NEW! Walker's Paradise Apartment in Congress Park
description: Welcome to a newly remodeled apartment in Congress Park! This 2-bdrm, 1-bath unit is located in the window-filled basement level of a 3-story Denver Square house. The neighborhood is known for its friendly attitude, tree-lined streets, and proximity to Denver's best parks. With a walk score of 84 and a bike score of 94, this place is ideally located for getting around on foot & bike. Walk to Sprouts, Trader Joe's, coffee shops, movie theaters, ice cream parlors, local restaurants, and much more!
neighborhood_overview:
From this excellent location, you can grab an ice cream or shake at Little Man's famous new shop, Sweet Cooie's, enjoy top sushi at Sushi Ronin- one of Denver's top-rated spots - and go for a walk or run in City Park to see the Denver Skyline and mountain views. In the morning, answer emails and get a coffee, fresh juice and breakfast burrito from French Press, then head to Cherry Creek for upscale shopping and great people watching. Close the night by watching live music at the Blue Bird theatre.

This apartment also lies just blocks from Denver's best parks, museums, and the zoo. You'll be only a 5-to-10-minute bus or bike ride away from the downtown action, filled with breweries, restaurants, high-end shopping, and the 16th Street Mall.

Amazing hiking outside of Golden rests just 20 minutes away, while you're 1.5 hours to some of the best skiing in the world (Vail, Breckenridge, Copper Mountain, Arapahoe Basin, etc.).

description: This adorable, fully furnished 1 bed/ 1 bath home has been completely renovated!All new hardwood floors, quartz counters, stainless appliances, custom reclaimed wood shelving in bathroom and kitchen, full size washer and dryer, dedicated work space, A/C and outdoor space!  High Speed WiFi, and FREE PARKING! PERFECT location, only 3 min. to Denver's hot RiNo District, Mission Ballroom,Coors Field,LoDo, I-70 and I-25! Approx. 20 min. to DIA. neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in historic Globeville, one of the original neighborhoods of the city, which was settled in the mid-1880s by Polish and German immigrants. In the heart of Globeville and just down the street from our home is Garden Place Elementary, built in 1904. Don't miss checking out the amazing mural artwork on this beautiful school! Globeville is a very eclectic, diverse neighborhood in the early stages of gentrification and while centrally located to downtown Denver it still resonates a "small town" feel. Walk to Globe Hall which is a Live Nation venue for live music concerts BBQ and drinks and visit Globeville's own little quirky speakeasy, Fort Greene, (they have no sign, just look for the Budweiser sign out front). Both are just blocks from our home!

Globeville is situated between the River North (RiNo) neighborhood and the Highlands and LoHi neighborhoods which are both popular areas.

name: Paintbrush Room: GOURMET BREAKFAST INCLUDED
description:
The Capitol Hill Mansion Bed and Breakfast Inn has been in operation for approximately two decades and is the Number 1 rated bed and breakfast in Denver. The Mansion has a perfect 5.0 star average review on TripAdvisor with over 1000 reviews.

name: The Mile High Escape in Curtis Park
description: The Mile High Escape in Curtis Park is the ideal getaway for travelers looking to escape in style. A lot of thought and care has been invested in creating this serene atmosphere. The windows inside of home allows it to fill with an abundance of natural light, which is convenient for all guests since Denver receives 300 days of sunshine a year.
neighborhood_overview: “RiNo,” the trendy River North Art District features contemporary art galleries and hip concert venues in revamped industrial buildings. Food halls include Denver Central Market, Improper City and The Source, a buzzy indoor venue with eclectic products and a bar for small plates and craft beer. Known for its colorful murals, Upper Larimer Street also has cocktail lounges, brewpubs with patios and late-night food trucks.

description:
Please message us directly prior to booking to ensure availability. Attached single car garage available for additional monthly fee.

Rooftop with a Rocky Mountain view! You can't beat this modern home, fully equipped to keep guests comfortable and entertained! Just minutes from Downtown Denver, an easy walk to the trendy restaurant, bar and shopping scene of the LoHi and Highland neighborhoods, and easy access to main highways that lead you to the real fun - Colorado's great outdoors.
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the accessibility of our location to LoHi and Highland neighborhoods, the 5-minute drive to downtown Denver, Bronco's and Rockies's stadiums, Pepsi Center and the easy access to our main roadways which will take you directly into our backyard playground… the Rocky Mountains (our personal favorite!)

name: Mile High Overlook - Amazing roof top views!
description: Mile High Overlook - Entire condo with amazing roof top views!
neighborhood_overview:
This townhome is situated in the Sloan's Lake area of Denver just west of the river - an unbeatable location offering convenient driving distance to a plethora of restaurants, bars, shops, and activities, plus Mile High Stadium within walking distance just across the street. Broncos fans or travelers in town to watch their home team play in the Mile High City will be delighted about this ideal proximity!

More information
Check out the Alamo Drafthouse or Sloans Tap & Burger, just a short drive away. About 1.5 miles north is the trendy Highlands neighborhood with more eateries and boutiques to discover. Downtown is about 2.5 miles away - hop on the light rail to get there, with the nearest station only about a 5-minute walk from the property! Channel your inner tourist by strolling down 16th Street Mall or grabbing a bite to eat in Larimer Square.

With Sloan's Lake just a 10-minute walk away, you'll definitely want to spend a morning or 2 lounging in the city'

name: Brand New Berkeley 2bed/2bath Loft House!
description:
Amazing remodel just finished! Two bedrooms, two bathrooms in the great neighborhood of Berkeley. Comes w/ a loft for an extra sleeping area -great for small families, groups, or couples on vacation!

Brand new everything! Gas range in fully stocked kitchen w/ dishwasher. New washer/dryer. Two new bathrooms! Wired sound throughout - use bluetooth and enjoy music in the living room or during your shower!

Walk to Tennyson or 32nd street- your perfect Denver home!

Pets OK but need approval
neighborhood_overview:
Too many to list! We are a 5 minute walk from all the bars/restaurants of Tennyson street and 8 minute walk from the Highlands (Lowell/32nd). We have a welcome sheet w/ all our favorites listed and will share that upon arrival (or email it ahead of time if you'd like).

The stretch between 38th and 46th avenues on Tennyson Street has developed into a dining destination all its own, with high-end eateries, casual diners, cocktail bars, and more. With the street and its surrounding neighborhood changing almost daily, it can be hard to keep up. Most recently opened are High Point Creamery and The Grateful Gnome brewery. Coming very soon are new restaurants Tres Chiles, a Mexican grill, and Wendell’s, a breakfast diner in the former home of DJ’s Berkeley Cafe. The closings are bittersweet, but many lasting businesses are still staples.

From a Dutch sandwich shop and Native American eatery to two brand new drinking destinations, here are Eater’s current favorites. The

host_about:
Hundreds of guests hosted and all great reviews!  We welcome ALL with open arms. All religions, nationalities, genders.  We've recently added a Pack and Play to make my listings to be more family friendly and we have great Internet and work space for your business trips - let me know how I can make your Denver experience unforgettable!  

We love to travel and have been all around the world.  We've been hosting through Airbnb for over 7 years now and I also volunteer to host international guests in my home for a month or more at a time.  We're very professional and clean - we think there are certain standards of hospitality and being a guest that everyone should follow, which basically stems from respect for yourself and others.

We're big on communication and am happy to help you make your stay in Denver memorable - from the check in process to restaurant reservations.  We can accommodate special requests like an airport pick up or a pre-stocked refrigerator if you'd like.   Let me know how I can help!

name: Bluebell Suite: GOURMET BREAKFAST INCLUDED
description:
The Capitol Hill Mansion Bed and Breakfast Inn has been in operation for approximately two decades and is the Number 1 rated bed and breakfast in Denver. The Mansion has a perfect 5.0 star average review on TripAdvisor with over 1000 reviews.

The owner, Carl, is a well known Gourmet chef, featured in Nationwide B&B cookbooks, and each morning he provides his guests with a true culinary experience. His rooms are constantly updated while retaining old world charm that rival the best hotels.

name: Tastefully Designed Apt In Historic Neighborhood
description:
This modern and elegantly designed garden level apartment is the perfect blend of style, comfort and location. Our rental includes Cable TV, HBO, Showtime, and Starz, and a Pack 'n Play for families. We will provide a complimentary in-stay clean when you book with us!



**A tenant lives upstairs. We only allow the outdoor grill in the backyard courtyard to be used by both tenants.**

2024-BFN-0010287
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a Prime location in downtown Denver.

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

name: Urban 1BR in the Heart of Downtown Denver
description:
Centrally located 1BR apartment in LoDo area of Denver (Lower Downtown). Walk to Union Station in 5 minutes, Whole Foods in 7 minutes, Less than 1 mile from CU Business School, Pepsi Center, and Coors field. Walk to numerous restaurants in the area.

If you want to be in the heart of Denver and enjoy city living, this place is for you!
neighborhood_overview: LoDo, Denver's oldest neighborhood, is home to some of the city’s best-known restaurants, galleries, shops and boutiques. Located in the heart of downtown, businesses ranging from finance and real estate to retail and start-ups can be found here. Whether you are here to work, play, or live, LoDo's family-friendly attractions and businesses entice visitors and locals alike, making it the country's most vibrant neighborhood.

host_about:
I am an entrepreneur (KalenJesse.com), entrepreneurial ecosystem builder, natural organizer, community builder and human-focused professional. I've supported hundreds of underrepresented entrepreneurs in starting and scaling their businesses. I am motivated by empowering others to empower themselves to create positive impact with their unique powers. 

I am a globally-minded professional with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) focused in International Affairs/Political Anthropology, Spanish from Colorado College. MBA Candidate at CU Denver. I am a passionate mountain lover, deep sea diver, photographer, and life explorer in the heart of Denver. When I am not getting lost in nature with my camera, you might find me creatively cooking up some meals in the kitchen with no recipes in sight. I live for meeting great people, eating savory food, adventuring with no agenda,  learning from others' stories and amazing places.
 
I was born and raised in Denver, spent most of the last decade in New Zealand and now live back in my hometown. I take full advantage of my backyard by hiking, camping and skiing. In town, I venture out to live music, local bars, yoga and dance classes, photo galleries and supporting independent shops and restaurants. 
 
This private flat is an urban sanctuary in the heart of Denver - a place to regroup and rejuvenate with lots of activities and delicious restaurants within walking distance. I am excited to host fellow adventurers, families, and friends and offer what so many people offered me while living abroad. 

Safe Travels x
Kalen

 
 

My Place and Neighborhood:

My place is a comfortable, modern and safe abode in the heart of Denver's most colorful urban  neighborhood! You will have the entire unit to yourselves- queen bed, king bed, and  there is a comfortable sleepable futon couch in the living room, private bath and large and well-stocked kitchen.  The fireplace is a bonus in the winter months.

From the front door, you can take long or short walks admiring the historic Victorian bungalows and Arts and Crafts homes, gardens, and parks. There are quaint pockets of older retail areas with cafes, flower shops, and salons. On Colfax you’ll find a varied mix of coffee shops, restaurants, bars, music venues, yoga studios, cycling classes, film and record stores, and The Tattered Cover—a large locally-owned bookstore in a converted movie theater. You’ll also find tattoo parlors, photo-worthy graffiti walls, and plenty of gritty urban characters. As a photographer, my community never gets boring to document! You are just  a few blocks away from beautiful City Park with ponds and trails, the Denver Zoo, the Museum of Nature and Science, and the free Sunday “Jazz in the Park” concerts during summer months. Walk to the Esplanade Farmers Market on Sunday mornings June-October (E Colfax and Columbine St). It’s a wonderful neighborhood where just about anyone can find something to love.

name: Historic Townhome in Amazing Neighborhood!
description: Charming row house in the heart of the hip Baker neighborhood.  Just 3 blocks from the SoBo (South Broadway), 5 blocks to the Santa Fe Art District, and a quick 5 minute drive to Downtown Denver. Complete with a clawfoot tub, private fenced courtyard, and full kitchen, this space is the ultimate combination of comfort and tranquility in a trendy, urban location.
neighborhood_overview: The Baker neighborhood is a diverse, dynamic, hip, and charming neighborhood located just south of downtown Denver. First developed in the 1870's, this neighborhood is full of beautiful historic homes and unique local shops, restaurants, and bars.  Baker is a vibrant urban neighborhood close to the colorful local shops on South Broadway, great bars, restaurants, and dispensaries, an array of entertainment, as well as easy access to downtown and the rest of the city.

host_about:
I'm a single, 50-something, friendly and sociable fellow traveler.  

I lead an itinerant home office lifestyle based out of Steamboat Springs and Denver.  (I've been "social distancing" since '94 and 28K baud modems, so I know a thing or two about the now, near dominant work-from-home challenges, setup and rewards. ;) )  

Since growing up in the small town of Eastern Pennsylvania called Nazareth, (Yeah, that's me, I am "Joseph of Nazareth"! ;P ), I have ventured through all 50 United States, and dozens of countries across North America, South America, Africa and Europe.  

My zest for travel stems from experiences in my youth attending grand and exciting "Bon Voyage" and "Welcome Home" parties, and trips to the airport, all dressed up, for family members to all of these unknown and distant places, in particular, Gram's many trips back to our mother country of Austria.  

During my first international month long travels through Europe as a 17 year old, I enjoyed many a serendipitous guest house and hostel stay.  The rest is history.

As an adult, my trips range from weekend road trips to extended multi-month adventurers, for both work as a contracting AppleOS Software Engineer and/or pleasure in pursuit of athletic, cultural and educational endeavors.  

Accommodations during my travels often require an independent, work-from-home and active lifestyle considerations, something I found not to be that readily available.  

After acquiring a single family home in a mountain and ski resort town before the real estate bubble, and then several condominiums immediately after that bubble burst, I found myself in a position to setup and offer my properties and rooms in my house for that "home office" niche.

Fast forward to the internet era, and the embrace and popularity of airbnb.com and the like, I am now able to successfully manage these rental opportunities in an enjoyable and successful manner.  "Who'da thunk". this would have been possible as a youth lusting for travel?!

I take pleasure in hosting my guests' stays at either my private condominiums and rooms in my home.  It's a great way for me to feel "connected" to that itinerant lifestyle while "home'n it".  

I tend to float between these two locations to fathering my 6 year old son in Denver and/or managing rental turnovers.  

I can "hit the ground running" at any of my properties with just a suitcase and gear in tow.  You will be able to as well.

In the interest of learning about your host, some hobbies I enjoy include home improvements, vintage vespas, photography/videography, technology, cooking, brewing beer/mead and volunteering.

I could live just about anywhere, but I chose the endearing community of Steamboat Springs in the beautiful Yampa Valley and all it has to offer.  

I'm more than happy to share my local knowledge and experiences with you during your extended  stay at my house in Steamboat, or at one of my other properties in Denver and Phoenix.

name: Denver Art Cube House
description: Art cube is a unique, luxury property in heart of Denver, next to Cheesman Park w/ short walk to great restaurants. neighborhood_overview: Cheesman Park in the Capitol Hill Neighborhood is a remarkably diverse neighborhood with one of the most if not most beautiful parks in Denver.  It is a short walk, bike ride or drive to almost anything in central Denver, just a few miles from downtown Denver.  The neighborhood is filled with grand old 19th and early 20th century large homes, some tall apartments along the park and bustles with many cafes, bars and restaurants.  Some of the best restaurants in Denver... Atelier and Poteger are a short walk from the house.  Other great food spots/cafes/bars are just a short walk... Dos Santos, Olive & Finch, Thump, St Marks, Thin Man, Voodoo, White Pie.  It is a great place to live and visit with everything so close.

host_about: I'm a 20 year Coloradoan, originally from the Bay Area. I've spent my life traveling the world with a storytelling nonprofit and work with mostly with people whose stories have been marginalized. It's taken me all over the globe, listening all the way. The carriage house is located in the San Rafael Historical District within the larger Five Points area. Conveniently located near downtown Denver, the residential neighborhood has a walkable, historic, eclectic feel that delights residents and visitors alike.

The neighborhood is very walkable, with a grocery store, liquor store, multiple coffee shops and restaurants within a few blocks. Plentiful restaurants, cafe's, breweries and yoga studios are all a short walk away on 19th Ave, 17th Ave and Welton street. name: treehouse seance glamping in the city.
description:
www dot donaldfodness dot com for full details
Anarchocommunist’s utopia. Natural wild energy. Pitch a tent in the yard wherever you like or sleep on one of the random beds or bed frames previously left behind. Open layout with light (entire backyard to pitch a tent and get your feral fantasies on. Oh, and plenty of old Denver charm. Treehouse is a mock hunting blind and is on my side of the yard but guests may arrange for some snuggle time with me in there to guide your trip. Archers welcome!
neighborhood_overview: Regis/Berkeley is a residential community offering unique walkable amenities. It avoids downtown congestion while providing easy commuting access.  Guests can walk to award winning Goldspot Brewery, The Noshery Coffee + Bakery, Dubbel Dutch sandwich shop, Treasure Chest Antiques, Thai Bao, Cafe Brazil, Billy's Inn Pub, Rocky Mountain Lake Park and more. Guests are also very close to shops and restaurants on Tennyson, the Oriental Theatre, Lakeside’s Amusement Park and many more classic Denver spots. The entire Regis University campus is a beautiful arboretum, just one block from the house. Easy access to I-70 allows for simple travel to downtown or the Rocky Mountains.

name: Private suite with sun room(s) in bright house
description: My newly re-finished home offers it's bright sunroom(s) for socializing and a cozy finished basement suite for resting. Located in Northwest Denver, right next to I-70, means easy access to downtown (only a 5 minute drive), ski resorts in the Rocky Mountains, and Boulder. This house believes in conserving energy and resources, including a xeriscaped front yard and composting. It is friendly and accepting of all people, especially marginalized communities  such as people of color and LGBTQ+.
neighborhood_overview: Zuni Park is located just 2 blocks north of the house. To the south, a quick drive or a half mile walk will get you to fun and spunky eateries in the Sunnyside neighborhood. Great for brunch! Just under 2 miles south is the lively Lower Highlands (LoHi) neighborhood where you can get amazing food and unique cocktails well into the night.

host_about:
I am a fun loving young professional that enjoys sports (president of a local volleyball league), music (especially EDM), bars (I have an extensive liquor shelf and would love to make you my favorite cocktail), and spending time outdoors (skiing and hiking anyone?). I grew up in the Denver area, and I'm happy to serve as your guide to the city! Ask me for my spreadsheet of top restaurants (nerdy, I know).  

Respect of all life is very important to me. This means respect of all people regardless of their characteristics or backgrounds. As a member of the LGBTQ+ community myself, I strive to be the best ally I can to all minority groups. This is reflected in my hosting style as my top priority is to be welcoming to everyone. Respecting life also means being a good steward of our natural resources. My home includes energy efficient appliances, a xeriscaped (zero-scaped) front yard, a vegetable garden (coming soon), and I do my best to reduce, re-use, and recycle. I welcome you to join me in my effort, and I'm open to suggestions to improve my home's sustainability!

name: Denver Home w/ Large Yard & Private Lake Access!
description: Escape to the Mile High City in style at this unique 3-bedroom, 2-bath vacation rental home, ‘Two Wolves!’ This home features eclectic decor, a large backyard, hammock, gas grill, and plenty of space for both kids and pets to run and play. name: Urban Oasis in Denver Highlands! [Monthly Rental]
description: Urban oasis in the hot Highlands neighborhood just 5 minutes from downtown. Walking distance to trendy Highlands Square shopping + dining. Open, bright, modern floor plan and design. Totally private + quiet, with enclosed garden, yard, patio area including grill + outdoor dining area. Two sets of French doors for lots of light. High ceilings + minimalist mid century modern decor. Includes off-street parking spot, AC, washer/dryer. Bi-weekly house-cleaning included. Get the best of Denver living!
neighborhood_overview: Victorian-era homes and buildings; lush gardens and parks; hip independently owned shops; art galleries; and restaurants, all make the Denver Highlands neighborhood a great destination for visitors. A vibrant neighborhood just west of downtown set among quaint architecture and a favorite for locals and visitors. It boasts dozens of trendy boutiques, salons, coffee shops and restaurants along 32nd Avenue. Shop for everything from gifts to contemporary fashion to rare books. Foodies can choose from an array of premium cuisine on offer for casual dining or a special occasion.

name: Cozy Home, Garage, Patio, Laundry, 420 friendly
description:
One bedroom cozy alley house completely private in a quiet safe neighborhood which can sleep four people. Good discount for 30 day stays.

High Speed Wifi, Wide Screen Roku TV. Full Kitchen, Private patio, Washer Dryer, Garage, 420 Friendly.

Easy access to many parts of Denver: 35 minutes to DIA, 12 minutes to the light rail, 15 minutes to LoDo or CFS, 20 minutes to DTC.

Miles of tree lined Parkways. Great walking/running area, daily donation based Yoga 2 blocks away.
neighborhood_overview:
Montclair was originally developed as a small suburban community.

The founder, Baron Walter von Richthofen, was a German nobleman and uncle to Manfred von Richthofen, the celebrated World War I flying ace known as the 'Red Baron'.  

Visit his Castle!

Montclair is framed by several tree lined Parkways: Monaco, 6th St. and 17th Ave Parkway which leads to City Park. The Parkways are great for running or cycling. There is also a dedicated bike lane on 16th which goes to LoDo. About a 25 minute ride.
15 minute drive to LoDo.

You can take a short walk to donation based Yoga with Tina Porter at Newport Street Retreat

See: www.newportstreetretreat.com/calendar/

Also a short walk to:  Grocery, Pharmacy, Several dispensaries, Many Fast Food Restaurants & Beautiful Montclair Park

10 minute drive or 15 minute bike ride to Lowry 24 Hour fitness & Lowry Beer Garden

Restaurants
Buffalo Bill’s Wild Wings

name: Modern LoHi Townhouse - Walk Everywhere
description:
Modern Private Townhouse in Heart of Lohi. Walk the tree lined streets to amazing restaurants, bars and breweries. Close to Coors Field and downtown!
This gorgeous modern townhouse with private yard is all newly renovated. SS appliances and Quartz counter tops in the kitchen. Bedrooms each have their own bathroom and each on own floor. Perfect for sharing with another couple. Flat screen TVs in Living room and each bedroom. Our quiet central home is your perfect home base to explore Denver!
neighborhood_overview: the Lohi/Highlands neighborhood is one of the most sought after in all of Denver. Its proximity to Coors field and downtown make it the perfect place to stay when visiting Denver. Gorgeous heritage homes and new modern construction. So many amazing restaurants and coffee shops and bars are all within walking distance. Avanti and Linger are just down the street as well as Little Man Ice cream (best in the city!).

name: Architectural Dream in Rino- Walk everywhere!
description: Our stunning 4 level townhome with floor to ceiling glass, exposed steel beams and huge rooftop deck with views to downtown is your perfect home base. This unique space features 3 bedrooms each on their own floor, 4 bathrooms, designer kitchen and all gorgeous new furniture. Master suite takes up the entire 2nd floor with Jetted tub in Master bath. Walk to Larimer street and Rino shops, restaurants, bars and art galleries. Or walk downtown or to Coors Field! Perfect location!
neighborhood_overview: The Rino Art District is one of the coolest neighborhoods in Denver! We are just. few blocks away from all the Larimer street shops, restaurants and bars. Denver Central Market is the perfect place for an easy dinner with a multitude of little restaurants, coffee shop, amazing ice cream parlor and bar inside. Walk down the alleyways and take in the street art painted by artists from all over the world. Head to Improper City for a day at their climbing wall and then relax and have a beer and food from one of the many food trucks in their huge outdoor space. Try Uchi restaurant for amazing Japanese fair just down the street from us or head over to Death and Co. at the Ramble hotel for a trendy cocktail. Walking distance to Coors field and downtown as well.

name: Inca Retreat-3rd Floor Guest Suite & Roof-top Deck
description: Welcome to Inca Retreat- the only private room with connected private rooftop rental in the heart of Denver's Santa Fe Arts & Baker districts! Our 3rd floor guest suite features a private bedroom, private bathroom, open space with kitchenette & rooftop deck w/ mountain views!  Walking distance to restaurants, bars, breweries, galleries, distilleries & dispensaries. We also offer up 2 bikes to tour the city! 1.5 miles to downtown Denver, and under an hour to mountain fun!
neighborhood_overview:
Denver's Santa Fe Arts District is a unique, nationally known art and cultural district with over 60 galleries, restaurants/bars, breweries and shops. The Art District opens its doors the first Friday of each month to lively crowds and entertainment for the First Friday Art Walk.

Baker is one of the oldest and most historic neighborhoods in Denver; it is a beautiful neighborhood to tour on a walk or via bike. Plenty of restaurants, bars, breweries, live music venues and shops sprawl many blocks on Broadway!

name: Explore CO - Elegant/Central/WFH Chic/Pets
description:
Centrally located to Denver’s hottest spots in the trendy Berkeley neighborhood.

10 min drive to Downtown. Minutes to Highlands, Sloans Lake & Edgewater. Easy access to I-70 for a day in the mountains.

Walk to Tennyson St. - Artisan shops & delicious food. Liquor store & dispensary a few blocks north.

Stylish & Thoughtfully Renovated 1890’s Townhouse - Custom curated in the Modern-Farmhouse Style. Features original works by a prominent local Denver artist!

Garage & Washer/Dryer!
neighborhood_overview:
Tucked in Northwest Denver, the Berkeley neighborhood is a charming and lively spot, close enough to downtown to be convenient but far enough away to feel like its own close-knit community.

Along Tennyson Street between West 44th Avenue and West 38th Avenue, you'll find a host of fun places to visit, such as the Denver Cat Company, a feline-friendly lounge that serves coffee, pastries and bagels, as well as plenty of coffee shops (like Downpours Coffee and Allegro Coffee Roasters Tennyson). Quaint boutiques there include Inspyre, Your Sliding Scale and Ooh! Aah! Jewelry. BookBar is a quaint, independent book store and wine bar with comfy lounge areas to curl up with a good book and a glass of wine.

There's even a spot in the area just for men. Spruce provides male grooming and style needs and was one of two Colorado startups among the 10 chosen to participate in TechStar's retail accelerator program in June. The program is meant to foster entrepreneurs' experience

description: Welcome to the Colter Cottage - urban cottage meets European charm. Come stay in our beautiful carriage house in the heart of downtown Denver. The home is walking distance from South Broadway’s night life, Washington Park, and many quaint shops/restaurants. 2 blocks from the Cherry Creek Trail gives you access to running trails & a 15 minute bike ride to Union Station and Coors Field. 45 minutes to the mountains and an hour and a half from the ski slopes!
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in West Wash Park, 4 blocks from South Broadway and a mile from Washington Park. Most of the homes in the area are historic homes over 100 years old. The neighborhood is full of great little shops and restaurants and walking distance to many attractions.

description:

This apartment has an open living, dining, kitchen area, very small bathroom.
The bedroom, has lower than average (~7.6 ft.) ceiling, with ceiling ducts hanging down.
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is on Franklin Street two doors down from 17th Avenue. It is half way between 16th street mall, Downtown and Central Park. The house is two doors down from several restaurants, shops, coffee, brewery. Quiet neighborhood street with wide sidewalks.
Starbucks and Einstein Bagels, Olive and Finch bakery, a top Denver Taco Restaurant, a Sushi Restaurant, 7-11... + more a few doors down. 1 mile to downtown, walk to 4 blocks to Chessman, City Park, 1/2 mile to City Park. Walk one blocks to St. Joseph's, St. Luke's Presbyterian, and Children's Hospital. The Denver Convention Center is 1 mile away. Buses run between City Park and Downtown every 15 minutes. There is also B-Cycle rentals across the street from our house, electric scooters everywhere, and a ride share parked on our block.

For an accurate picture of our rentals, check ALL of our 180+ reviews, that average over 4.5 stars.  We have been renting short term for over eight years, and strive to provide a peaceful, clean, quiet and joyful experience for all guests.
We live in Colorado and enjoy the outdoors.  We love to hike, ski, swim, garden, camp, and cook.  We travel as much as possible and usually end up in the Yucatan or the Colorado mountains.  Denver and the Rockies are spectacular and keeps getting better year after year. 
 
Our house has been in our family for two generations, and will someday be passed down to our children. It really is in the perfect location, close to everything and easily accessible to the mountains.  Se Habla Espanol.

Live, Laugh, Love!

host_about: Rebekah and I decided to take some time away from real life and reset our perspectives on life, family, work, and balance - to both lose ourselves and to find ourselves.  We are spending some time traveling with our little ones to introduce them to the rest of the world. host_about:
I have just finished a wonderful 10 years in a full time travel position with a high profile US company. I love to travel and more so, I am so exited for people to experience Denver, CO in a lovely spacious condo in a family oriented newer neighborhood.  Everything is so easy, pool is steps away, light rail in minutes, and easy access to all the great places Denver has to offer.

I am described as very friendly, fun, lady with a ton of personality! I am generous and very helpful and accommodating.  Thus, I am excited about starting my Airbnb business and I hope you will definitely chose my location when in Denver, CO!

In life, I find that being kind to others is a simple and valuable motto.  Especially today!

name: The Denver Gem in Ruby Hill (hot tub! 420-ok!)
description: Whether you are here for an event, 420, the music & art scene, bar-hopping, exploring nature, or hitting the hills for a ski/ride sesh, or for work the Denver Gem is centrally located between the most major reasons people visit Denver. In just 15 minutes in any direction you can be Downtown, Red Rocks Amphitheater, DTC. Close, but far enough from the ruckus to have a quiet, good night sleep so you are fully rejuvenated for the next day’s adventure. Tip: Enjoy ultra relaxation in the hot tub.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet neighborhood, close enough to all the fun bars, breweries, restaurants, boutique shops...but just far enough to come home to hassle free parking and a peaceful and quiet slumber.

The Denver Gem is located moments away from Ruby Hill Park where there is free sledding and ski/ride parks set up in the winter and Levitt Pavilion Amphitheater in the summer/fall which hosts 50 free local music concerts as well as some big named paid shows.

10-15 min to Union Station (Downtown)
5-10 minutes from South Broadway, Platte Park, Wash Park, DU area
15-20 min to Red Rocks amphitheater
30-40 min to DIA
20 min to DTC

Depending on your final destination most fun hotspots in Denver area are only a $7-$13 Uber ride.

I am happy to offer any recommendations for you and your group based on your interests!

neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the West Colfax neighborhood. With close proximity to downtown, easy access to Sloan’s Lake, and both the Pepsi Center and Mile High Stadium in its back yard - this neighborhood is great if you are going to catch a game OR checkout nearby Meow Wolf. You can get there by lightrail - only a 5 minute walk from our Airbnb.

West Colfax has a mixture of mid-rise buildings, single-family homes, and brand-new condos. While this neighborhood is mainly residential, there are a few local breweries such as Joyride and Odell's, and coffee shops like Side Pony (which turns into a cocktail bar at night) sprinkled throughout the area. Sloan’s Lake Park is just a stone’s throw away and offers locals a place to run, or bike.

name: High Street Treehouse: Your Cozy Denver Retreat
description: The High Street Treehouse is a one bedroom, one bathroom carriage house in the City Park West neighborhood of Denver, within walking distance of Downtown, great restaurants and cafes, the hospital district, the Zoo, the Museum of Nature and Science and more. The Treehouse is an apartment above the hosts’ garage, physically separate from the main house and very private and secure. The host is an architect - this little building was designed by her, for you!
neighborhood_overview: The City Park West neighborhood is filled with 100 year old homes, tree-lined streets and diverse dining options. It is named for Denver's largest urban park, City Park, sitting only 4 blocks to the east of the High Street Treehouse. The Park is home to the Denver Zoo, the Museum of Nature and Science, the Saturday Farmer's Market and Jazz in the Park (seasonal).  It also features a great municipal golf course. This is a central Denver neighborhood, with close proximity to Downtown, River North (RiNO), historic Five Points, Uptown, and the hospital district. Walk, scooter, cycle, Uber/Lyft, or drive!

neighborhood_overview:
The Cole neighborhood is a diverse residential neighborhood next to the popular RiNo district, which is more industrial but changing quickly. You may notice construction in and around the neighborhoods as Denver is growing very rapidly and we have several big projects underway, including a highway expansion.

We are easy driving/biking distance to other neighborhoods, a lot of new restaurants, shops, art galleries, breweries, dispensaries, and music venues--notably the Mission Ballroom, which opened August 2019. Easily accessible via main streets and highways.

Many homes in our neighborhood were built in the early 1900s. The closest neighborhood bars you can walk to are NOLA and Clove Pizzeria, and Cohesion brewery; the closest coffee shop is Rivers and Roads. Also nearby are the Whittier Cafe, Crema, and Prodigy.

I enjoy trying new beer and delicious food. While I am out of town or away, I love to host my space to give others a chance to enjoy what all that Denver has to offer!

name: cozy private room with patio, 1 mile from downtown
description: Cozy keyless private bed & bathroom with patio close to downtown and Denver’s premier city events and venues -around a mile or less to civic center, convention center, downtown.  2 blocks from the Fillmore and Ogden theatre.  Around a 2 mile trip for Coors Field & Pepsi Center, 3 for Mile High Stadium. A great central place close to all the cool and desirable urban destinations and fine dining, shopping, and recreation that Denver has to offer via a short ride share, walk, or bike/scooter ride.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Cap Hill neighborhood, this cozy private room with it’s own entrance is walkable to the convention center, performing arts center, downtown, music venues (Fillmore, Ogden Theatre, Paramount Theatre), and to many recommended restaurants and bars. Centrally located to other urban and tourist destinations like Uptown, Cherry Creek, Cheesman Park, Denver Botanic Gardens, City Park, Wash Park, Baker, and RiNo, there’s nothing too far for a walk or short Lyft/Uber or even a free 16th Street Mall bus ride -web search “Cap Hill Denver” to see how awesome the location truly is! Download the RTD Mobile Ticketing on your phone and have even more inexpensive traveling options all over the city for rates such as 3 hours for 3 dollars via bus or train (day pass for 6$ and 10.50$ if you want to add airport travel)!

name: Stunning City + Mtn View Condo, King Bed, Patio
description:
Beautiful downtown condo on the 5th floor in a luxury building in the heart of the Golden Triangle!
+ King bed
+ Master bath, deep soak tub
+ Walk-in closet
+ Central heat & A/C
+ Washer/dryer in unit
+ Deck with breathtaking views
+ Garage parking
+ Concierge, security
+ Bike Score 95
+ Walk Score 92
+ Transit Score 84
+ New Smart TV with Netflix in living room and bedroom
+ 1 Gig Internet WiFi
neighborhood_overview: We are in the Golden Triangle, home to the Denver Art Museum and several other museums, as well as great restaurants, art galleries, coffee shops, and much more. We are just steps from the Cherry Creek path, which gets you onto miles of paved walking/running/biking. Three minute armor downtown, 2 minutes from the Capital Building, 8 minutes from the Cherry Creek Shopping District, this is the best neighborhood in Denver!

name: Trendy Berkeley Guest Home
description: The perfect walkable location in the heart of Berkeley. Guests love the accommodations of our 600sf second story carriage house, one block off the Tennyson St business district, amidst the tree tops of North Denver. Enjoy one of Denver's most walkable neighborhoods with a park across the street, great restaurants, bars, boutiques and cafés. Our newly built guesthouse has everything you need and is just 10 minutes from downtown Denver with easy access to I-70.
neighborhood_overview: This guest house is in one of Denver's most sought after neighborhoods. You are one block away from over 40 boutiques, restaurants, coffee shops and galleries, all located on Tennyson St. You are four blocks away from a beautiful city park with a lake, and another four blocks away from two different grocery stores. Close access to I-70. Our guest book has additional recommendations on coffee shops, restaurants and things to do in Denver.

name: Renovated Baker Loft w/private rooftop deck
description:
*This loft underwent a MAJOR renovation in 2022. ALL reviews prior to 2022 are before the renovation*

Renovated, modern penthouse loft in a mixed use live/work building with designer touches throughout. The loft sleeps 4 people between the 2 bedrooms with King and Queen Beds. Incredible views of the mountains, downtown, and Mile High Stadium from the huge windows and large private deck. Located two to three miles from downtown in the industrial part of the Historic Baker Neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: The Urbanist Magazine described the Baker neighborhood as Denver's hippest new neighborhood. You are one block away from Santa Fe Dr. and the Santa Fe Art District and less than a mile from all that South Broadway has to offer. Within a couple of blocks there are shops, restaurants, bars, breweries, distilleries, coffee shops, pot shops, yoga, bowling, movies, and light grocery shopping.  During the week most places are open late and on the weekends most bars and restaurants are open until 2am or later. There are three grocery stores (Safeway, Nooch Vegan Grocers and Natural Grocers).
