name: 222 Studio Baker Neighborhood
description: Located in the historical Baker Neighborhood in Denver CO. Walking distance to many restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. This Studio is located in the center of Downtown Denver; you can bike, scoot, or ride share to all the amazing attractions that Denver has to offer. We are in the center of all the amazing places to explore in Denver!
neighborhood_overview:
The Baker neighborhood is a diverse, dynamic neighborhood located in the urban core of Denver, Colorado. First plotted and developed in the 1870s, Baker has played a central role in the history of Denver.
Today Baker enjoys a number of qualities and characteristics that make it a vibrant urban neighborhood including a diverse urban population, preserved historic homes, proximity to Broadway’s Main Street development which promises diverse shopping, casual and fine dining, and an array of entertainment, as well as access to mass transit. -Baker Historic Neighborhood Association-

name: Wonderful Condo in the heart Downtown Denver!
description: The Best location in downtown Denver!! Easy access to just about anything you might want to enjoy in our wonderful city.  Just 2 blocks from the Denver Convention Center makes it a perfect location for business or pleasure. With access to both the light rail and the 16th Street Mall ride across the street you can get to just about anywhere in Denver you would like to go.
neighborhood_overview:
Denver central business district has everything you might ever need or want.
2 Blocks from the Colorado Convention Center, 1 block from the Denver Pavilions, 4 blocks to the Denver Performing Arts Complex.
Take the 16th Street Mall ride (free) to Union Station, Larimer Square, Coors Field, State Capital, University of Colorado Denver. Also a short light rail ride or uber to DIA (Denver International Airport) Mile High Stadium, Pepsi Center and Elitich Gardens.


Quick access to all of Denver's best restaurants including The Kitchen, Urban Farmer, Capital Grill, Giordano's, Ocean Prime, Jax, Guard and Grace, Citzen Grill, Sam's #3, Milk Market, Snooze, The Source and many more!

Love shopping?? We are just a hop skip and jump away from H&M, Sephora, Banana Republic, Express, Famous Footwear, TJ Max, Target and many more great stores!

name: Rain Shower - Natural Light - Close to City
description:
Beautiful private walkout next to the light rail. Lots of natural light and space in this apartment. The kitchenette has a microwave, toaster oven, induction cooktop, kettle and everything you need to cook a meal.
Bedroom has a comfortable queen bed and blackout blinds.
Bathroom is luxurious with a rain shower (everyone’s favorite!)
Living room has a comfortable pull out queen sofa bed and a new 55" SmartTV with Chromecast. You can request a monitor, keyboard and mouse for WFH.
Fiber WIFI.
neighborhood_overview:
15 minutes to downtown, Pepsi Center, Coors Field and Sports Authority Field, all accessible by light rail ($3).
Gulch Trail: 4.1 miles of pristine trails outside the door of this house. Bike and walk to get a sense of the area and the beautiful Colorado outdoors.
Red Rocks: 20 minutes

Try their blueberry pancakes, or biscuits topped with spicy pork sausage gravy. But if you go on a weekend, prepare to wait—this place is no secret. Just down the street, you’ll have better luck getting a seat for brunch at Lou’s Food Bar, which serves up authentic comfort food any time of day. Their brunch-time Bloody Mary bar allows you to build-your-own beverage (don’t skimp on the chicken tenders), or try a Man-Mosa, made with vodka, OJ, and Hefeweizen. During dinner hour we have two words for you: fried chicken. Lou’s does it right, with three flavor options (naked, medium, and hot), and delicious sides like mac-and-cheese, braised kale, and confit red bliss potatoes.

name: 420 Indoor Smoker Friendly Downtown Denver
description:
Welcome to the best 420 Smoker Friendly Airbnb in all of Downtown Denver. The neighborhood is downtown with easy access to all highways and transportation.
The indoor smoker-friendly home is a super unique place with killer vibes that allows indoor smoking. The 420 house is not just a place to stay, but a place to have a party, enjoy your herb and hang out with friends. neighborhood_overview: Great space in Denver that's walking distance to the Santa Fe Arts District (two blocks away), close to downtown (10-minute walk), Denver Health, speer, Broadway is nearby (10-minute walk). description: Enjoy your stay here in the SUNNYSIDE Neighborhood. We are conveniently located, with easy access to Sunnyside, the Highlands and downtown. The bathroom and kitchen were the main focus during building. Making them clean and comfortable were our #1 priorities. This makes a perfect and comfortable getaway spot! In unit Laundry and minimum stay of 30 days.
neighborhood_overview: If you are already looking in the Sunnyside area, I don't need to go into details explain why it is so amazing.  Some say this is the best neighborhood in Denver!  The restaurants nearby and access to everything make this the perfect spot for your stay.

name: Retreat @ Mayfair
description: The Retreat @ Mayfair is the perfect place to do just that...coming back to the condo after a a day in the hustle and bustle of the city makes you feel relaxed, inspired and tranquil..the location is superb, with all your major Markets such as Whole Foods[7 mins away], Natural Grocers [6 min away], Trader Joes  [3 min away] and others just minutes away. Restaurants are abundant, Cherry Creek, Denver Zoo, Botanical Gardens are also some of the attractions that surround the location.
neighborhood_overview: Mayfair/Hale Neighbor hood is a very central location with great access to all that Denver has to offer...The neighborhood has a 26 acre redevelopment which once completed will be a little city in itself [Completion around summer/fall 2020}. Rose medical is steps from the Retreat which is one of Denvers  top Hospitals. Mayfair is one of Denvers top neighborhoods with a very city like feel...and all the conveniences that come with that. Lindsley park is literally steps from the condo and has all the amenities [BBall court, Tennis Courts, kids area] and alot of lovely open green space...

host_about: I am in my early thirties and have a huge appetite for living LIFE. I love to travel, love food, family and adventure. New Orleans, Miami, Puerto Vallarta...and the Bay Area are all some of my favorite destinations. I think the world is an amazing place, with too many Beautiful places all over to list. I do read, not as much as I would like to but I can go without at times...I stay busy with Real Estate in many aspects, I describe myself as a Finish Carpenter(General Contractor) by trade, Associate Broker by profession and an entrepenuer by vision. I am a very open minded individual, I like all kinds of different music (love hip hop), and have acquired a great taste for all kinds of different art. "The food" has within the last few yrs become a pasion of mine and enjoy cooking and eating out. I love ceviche, bbq, Italian food, sushi etc.....) I love to have fun with friends, watch movies, go to concerts watch shows. I like my time to count and try at all times to stay in the moment with a positive outlook on the future.

name: Modern stylish guesthouse central to everything!
description: Indulge in the comfort of this bright, contemporary city-center guesthouse. The space features an open-concept layout with tasteful furnishings and decor.  This stylish house has everything to make you feel at home – WiFi, TV, washer/dryer, 2 queen-sized beds, well-equipped kitchen, lounge area, and outdoor patio with lush garden and grill. The house is perfectly located in a charming neighborhood where you will find local specialty stores, restaurants, and parks all within walking distance.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet yet fun centrally located neighborhood. Close to the light rail, bus stops, grocery stores, highways, bike path, Library, golf, concert venues, antique and vintage stores, best restaurants in town, fitness and yoga centers, parks, and historic old Pearl Street. Only a short walk to one of the best parks in Denver, Washington park. Great park for people watching, picnics, or exercising. Or take a quick 5 minute walk to Platt Park and visit the beautiful library and family friendly playground.  You can take the light rail from the airport to either Broadway or Louisiana station. From either station it's about a 10 minute walk to the house. I would recommend going to the Louisiana station and walking through the Platt Park neighborhood.

host_about:
Hello!  We are Tim and Johanna, 

We are a small family of 3 with a great passion for the peoples and cultures of the world, exploring new places, lounging on the beach or in the mountains, and eating great food.  I was born in Mbabane, Swaziland but grew up in Denver, Colorado from the age of one. I consider myself a Denver native.  Johanna is from Venezuela and has been in Denver for over 10 years.  I work for a vacation rental management company (I manage this property on my own) and Johanna is a clinical therapist. 

We are fun and easygoing and really love meeting new people. We’ve stayed in Airbnbs all over the world and have met some great people on our adventures. We love Airbnb and understand what is needed to make a rental special for guests. 

My favorite things in the world are music (I play the piano!), running, and reading non-fiction, and Johanna loves gardening, cooking, and home design.   Oh, and I love coffee!

Along with English, we both speak Spanish.  Whether we are staying at your place or sharing ours, we look forward to meeting you.  

Tim and Johanna

name: Wash Park lakeview home private spacious suite
description:
Enjoy one of Denver's most lovely neighborhoods, just steps from locals' favorite park.
Expansive unit on main level of home. Includes full kitchen & breakfast nook, living & dining room, 2 attached bedrooms and sunroom. 2nd Airbnb on lower level (Kiwi Suite). Each private with its own entry. Common areas are laundry room & side yard. Host lives in apartment-like quarters down hall from guests* and is available upon request.

* Denver Airbnb regulations require host to live on property .
neighborhood_overview: Classic Washington Park neighborhood.  Stately historic homes. Canopy of over 100 year old trees in a peaceful, quiet area.  Within walking distance to Old South Gaylord, South Pearl Street coffee shops and restaurants, including the Bonnie Brae Ice Cream. Park, lake, sports and leisure activities offered in Washington Park, including  swimming at "Wash Park" Recreation Center located 2 blocks away. Pedal  boat and canopy bike rentals available in spring and summer months at Smith Lake as viewed from your Airbnb. Easy access to I-25 and the Rocky Mountains.

name: Bright and Artsy Guest Suite in RiNo
description:
Ground level 1-bedroom guest suite in the heart of Denver, 10 blocks North of the Convention Center. Stay home and people watch from the front patio or cozy up inside among colorful original art. For those looking to explore, you'll be walking distance to Rockies stadium and the attractions in Five Points, RINO and Downtown. We take a lot of pride in our home and do all we can to make sure you have an awesome rental with us.

Business-Professional License: 2019-BFN-0006867
neighborhood_overview:
You'll be staying in a quickly developing neighborhood with the most popular restaurants, breweries, bars, and hipster shopping in town. Most of all we love the art - including the Crush Walls street art, Redline, and Temple Studios located just blocks away.

In such an urban area, you will see quite a bit of homelessness. Like many major cities, Denver has experienced a rise in homeless, transient population, and encampments during the pandemic. Homelessness is very visible. Loitering is discouraged and we do our best to keep it at bay, but it definitely happens and unfortunately sometimes spills across the street and into neighboring spaces. Most of the people experiencing homelessness are suffering and the last thing they want to do is involve you in their burdens. The proximity might push your comfort zone.

name: Private Unit-Full Kitchen,2 blocks from City Park!
description: Separate unit above garage that has it all!  Approx. 600 sq ft one bedroom apartment with one private off street parking spot. Two blocks from Denver City Park.  Denver Zoo and Nature and Science Museum located in City Park!  Short walk to numerous restaurants on 17th street.  Short cab/uber to downtown Denver, Coors field, Mile High Stadium, etc.
neighborhood_overview: Explore the beautiful neighborhood of City Park and Uptown! Grab an espresso at Cafe Miriam and go for a walk in City Park...Cafe Miriam also serves crepes and sandwiches.   Or go for a short walk to Syrup for a full breakfast!  Vine St Pub is a great brewery with great food (one of our favorites for lunch or dinner!).  There are a number of other restaurants further east on 17th (approx. 15 min walk).   White Pie, Humboldt Farm Fish&  Wine, and Dos Santos just to name a few of our other favorites.  The Thin Man is great local neighborhood bar for a late night drink! Scoops is the local ice cream shop on 22nd and Humboldt!

name: Spacious basement bedroom near I-25 & Meow Wolf!
description: You’ll love this large basement bedroom with a super comfy king bed. There is ample space to unpack, relax into a reclining chair, and small tables for your convenience. Think hostel vibes but shared with a young family. Great for a quick layover on your road trip or stay while looking for apartments as you move to the coolest city! We’d love to host you on your next adventure while in Denver. Quick snapshot- young kids, shared bathroom, quiet hours from 10pm-6am, and 4/20 friendly (outside).
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is relatively quiet but very close to several cute stretches of popular shops, restaurants, and parks. We live a mile from south broadway’s Baker neighborhood with music venues, restaurants, and a variety of shops. We are within a couple of miles from old South Pearl Street, Washington Park, and Tennyson Street.

Requesting Lyft and Uber is never an issue and you can be most places in about 15 minutes from our house. (Plan to wait at least 10-20 minutes before your ride will be available.) We are close to the highway and bike path for convenience to the mountains or downtown.

Since we do live in the city, if you’re planning to park, you should pay attention to street sweeping signs (April-November). The 2nd Thursday of each month they will ticket on our side of the street and the 2nd Friday of each month for the opposite side of the street.

name: A blend of the best of Denver in Berkley!
description: Want a blend of the best of Denver?  Stay in Berkley.  I offer a cozy and comfortable space with great access to all the best that Denver has to offer.  Walkable to great galleries, restaurants, bars and shopping.  Relaxing views of the Rockies at Rocky Mountain Lake Park. I-70 access for a trip to trek in the mountains or a quick 20 minute drive to catch a show at Red Rocks. More than the basic necessities and all you need for a weekend get away.
neighborhood_overview:
This charming spot has it all.

There are amazing restaurants and bars just a walk down the street including Cafe Brazil, Tocabe, The Ginger Pig, and Billy's Inn. Less than a mile walk are fabulous art galleries, concert venues, local shopping and more delicious restaurants on the trendy Tennyson street. Hop on a bike and hang in the Highlands. With I-70 access a block away you are moments away from the foothills of the Rockies and your mountain get away.

Two large parks in walking distance including Rocky Mountain Lake Park and Berkeley Lake Park.

Feel free to make yourself feel at home and spin some vinyl, cook a delicious meal, and play some board games.

name: Modern Townhome with Rooftop Deck and Lake Views
description:
This newly constructed home is in Sloan's Lake Park; stroll less than a block to enjoy over 3 miles of trails and acres of serene nature in the heart of Denver. Walk to local coffee shops, pubs, restaurants, and shops or lounge on the rooftop to watch a game on the outdoor TV, hang by the fire pit, or enjoy a dinner and views with friends!

Any questions, feel free to ask!
neighborhood_overview:
Sloan's Lake one of the best neighborhoods in Denver! It's been built out over the last few years to include a number of great shops, restaurants, bars and local attractions, but the best part about my spot is that you're just across the street from the lake and the park. It has an awesome 3 mile loop, great for a quick morning jog, and lots of green space to relax on a pretty day.

In the same complex, there is the Alamo Draft House where you can go for a meal, a cocktail, and/or a movie. We're also a stones throw from the Bronco's Stadium so it's a great place to crash for a game. Odell Brewery is now open which is a second tap house and there's a restaurant called "The Patio" that is also literally steps from the back door.

name: Private Suite with Theater in Southwest Denver
description:
Fully private guest apartment in Athmar Park!

Amenities include A/C, a full efficiency kitchen with sink, coffee maker, electric stovetop, microwave, and countertop oven. Entertainment includes wifi, movie projector w/apple tv, and several classic video game consoles.

Rental includes private patio with one of the area's largest yards, a playhouse, and a propane grill. 10 minutes to downtown, 20 minutes to mountains, 5 minutes to Levitt Pavilion.

BFN # 2019-BFN-0008114
neighborhood_overview:
Athmar Park is famous for its rich Vietnamese and Latin influences. Within walking distance (just a few blocks) is some of the best Vietnamese and Mexican cuisine that the city has to offer. We're happy to provide recommendations.

Outdoor recreation options include Huston Lake Park (3 blocks away) which has a lake with mountain views and a walking trail, as well as a full playground, basketball court, tennis courts, and pickleball courts.

Levitt Pavilion/Ruby Hill Park is a 5 minute drive away and includes a series of free concerts (and some paid concerts) in a beautiful outdoor venue, as well as the best sledding in the city throughout the winter.

The foothills of the Rockies, including Red Rocks (the BEST concert venue, as well as great hiking) is a short 20 minute drive away.

Blocks away from the South Platte Bike Trail. Broncos Stadium, The Children's Museum, and Santa Fe Arts District all easily accessible by bike or car.

name: Creekside Townhouse Downtown 2BR/3BA
description: Our townhouse is located in the Riverfront Park section of Lower Downtown, facing beautiful Cherry Creek and its running and bike paths. It is within walking distance of shops, restaurants, parks, light rail, and major attractions downtown, including the Ball Center,  Larimer Square, the Rockies ballpark, Mile High Stadium and Union Station. Stairs are required to access all levels.  A maximum of 4 people - our sofa is not designed for sleeping.
neighborhood_overview: A slice of mountain living in an urban area, our neighborhood includes Cherry Creek bikeway, Confluence Park and Riverfront Park.  REI and Starbucks are in a historic building on the riverfront. There are many excellent restaurants in and around the beautifully restored Union Station that range from grab and go, to sports pubs, to high-end dining. Bronco's Stadium is only one stop away on the light rail; Ball Center is a short walk away. Whole Foods market is also a short walk away.  Some of our favorite nearby bars and restaurants include Brider, JINYA Ramen Bar, Forest Room Five, the beautiful art deco Cruise Room, Machete Mexican restaurant, and Thirsty Lion's Pub.

host_about:
My partner Doug and I have been together 20 years.  We love to travel and enjoy skiing, hiking, cycling, reading, the arts, great food and wine, urban environments with frequent escapes to nature.  We're neat, quiet, non-smokers and both have technology careers in the technology and financial services industries. I'm originally from Colorado and my partner is originally from upstate New York.

After spending over 30 years in the Bay Area, we decided to "shake the tree" and ultimately purchased our home in Denver, right on Cherry Creek, and just love it.  We want to embrace the AirBNB view that lodging while traveling can be much more than a night's stay - it can be a bit more of a experience.  So we're striving to bring some of what we've seen when we travel to our guests when they rent our home on the days we're not there.  Special accommodations, and a quiet, but very well located place to stay downtown.

We've traveled so many places in the world, and throughout the US. We are familiar with a number of countries, languages, cultures, and we'd love to share our home with those who value the same.

This expansive, multifaceted park is Denver's version of New York City's Central Park. In City Park's 330 lovely, landscaped acres, you'll find a public golf course (closed in 2019 for renovations), colorful flower gardens, ornate fountains, placid lakes and rolling green lawns perfect for picnics. City Park is home to some of Denver's most popular attraction

name: Congress Park Carriage House
description: Welcome to your cozy carriage house in Denver's popular Congress Park neighborhood.  Perfect for a vacation or business trip.  Our private, fully furnished space offers comfortable amenities with restaurants and coffee shops just steps from the front door.  The space is minutes from Downtown Denver and just a few blocks to many famous Denver sites such as the restaurants and music venues of Colfax, City Park, Cheesman Park, Congress Park and Cherry Creek North neighborhood and shopping mall.
neighborhood_overview: Congress Park is a beautiful, established neighborhood in Denver.  The carriage house is close to so many Denver attractions.  City Park, the Natural History Museum, Denver Zoo,  Denver Botanic Gardens, Cheesman ParkThe Bluebird on Colfax, The Ogden, The Fillmore music venues and the Cherry Creek North shopping district and mall. neighborhood_overview:
"From its early beginnings during the Gold Rush era, The Mile High City has always been a gathering place for diverse and creative people. Today, Denver is an outdoor city with a vibrant, walkable downtown offering urban adventures for all ages. Within a one-mile radius, you can kayak on the Platte River; explore some of the city's best museums; shop at art galleries and boutiques; see a Broadway touring show; enjoy live music; ride a rollercoaster or cool off in a water park; and experience exciting professional sports. Downtown is also home to many of Denver's top farm-to-table restaurants and innovative craft breweries, and the Denver Beer Trail is a great guide to sampling those local brews.

neighborhood_overview:

It is home to Empower Field, where the Denver Broncos play and host other events, as well as the Denver Aquarium, and Children’s Museum. There is a scooter spot on the corner and the studio is one block away from major bus stops.
Less than a mile away from the Pepsi Center and 1.4 miles from Coors Field.
Two miles from the heart of downtown. Uber rides to downtown are about $5-$10 depending on the location and time.

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview: ELEGANT & HISTORIC, MONTCLAIR --  Denver's  Montclair neighborhood is lined with brick homes, tree-lined avenues, and eccentric local businesses. Montclair is the brainchild of Baron Walter von Richthofen, a Prussian aristocrat and the uncle of famed WWI German pilot "Red Baron" Manfred von Richthofen who wanted an "utopian community" built on what were at the time empty fields east of Denver.  He started in 1887 with building what is now known as the community's centerpiece, the 14,938-square-foot limestone Richthofen Castle, located at 7020 E. 12th Ave.  My husband and I feel lucky to live here in Montclair with its beautiful homes and quiet and peaceful neighborhood, but we acknowledge that our "Utopia" has to evolve to include all souls.

name: Modern Luxury Home W/ Rooftop City Views
description: Custom-built home is minutes from downtown Denver, Sloan's Lake, The Light Rail, Mile High Stadium, and Meow Wolf! There are stunning views of the city from a fully furnished, covered patio with firepit. The large windows with vaulted ceilings let in plenty of natural light. The gourmet kitchen has all JennAir and the living area has a propane fireplace. The fully finished basement is perfect for more space, and the home also has speedy wifi. Take a stroll in the park nearby with river views.
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the outdoors and explore Denver's vibrant downtown with ease!

Ride bikes into downtown Denver using the picturesque Lakewood Gulch Bike Path and immerse yourself in the city's lively atmosphere.

Or, if you're looking for a more leisurely activity, grab a frisbee and head to Dry Gulch Park for a game of frisbee golf

For a quick and convenient way to get downtown, hop on the Perry Street Light Rail, which is just a five-minute walk away.

Once in downtown Denver, you'll be within walking distance of iconic attractions like Mile High Stadium and the captivating Meow Wolf art museum.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the best of Denver in a fun and active way by staying at my home!

name: Sloan's Lake Garden Apartment
description:
This newly renovated apartment is the lower level of a 1940s brick Tudor house. Remarkably light and bright, with its own entrance, across the street from Sloan’s Lake park, it has everything you need for a home-away-from-home feeling.
Enjoy a stroll in the park, relax in the backyard, or head up toward 32nd Street in the Highlands for restaurants and nightlife. An easy three miles from downtown, with easy access to public transit (and plenty of street parking).
Please note: no pets.
neighborhood_overview: Sloan's Lake / West Highlands is a revitalized older community, with houses dating from the 1920s on. Quiet tree-lined streets and a family-oriented neighborhood lead to a peaceful vibe. Nearby restaurants and bars on 32nd Street provide easily walkable nightlife, while the park gives a 2.5-mile running/walking loop with stunning views of the Rockies.

name: Southwestern Hideaway - Cool + Cozy Living
description: Fellow adventurers! Come kick off your hiking and riding boots at our newly redesigned, well-lit, renovated 1920's bungalow -  close enough to enjoy all big city Denver has to offer and only a short drive from the escape of the mountains, downtown, the RiNo Art District, Bronco or Rockies stadiums, Red Rocks, Meow Wolf, the airport, and more.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quite diverse in many ways, both culturally and income, which is why I moved here. If you're only on foot, I recommend taking ride-shares or the bus.

River and Roads Coffee is a beautiful, friendly coffee shop that is literally just around the corner from the house. Next to coffee shop is Flux Studios, LLC. - a glass blowing and ceramics studio and gallery with classes. There is a laundromat, liquor store, and some fun restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Check out my neighborhood guide included on this listing for more details!

Perfectly situated, our location offers unparalleled access to all Denver has to offer!

Please reach out for special deals on midterm stays longer than 30 days!
neighborhood_overview:
Lower Highlands is one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in Denver for good reason - its proximity to downtown (10-minute walk) and to all the major highways is unlike any other neighborhood. Moreover, many of the new restaurants are within a very short walk from our place, including Union Station, pedestrian walkway to downtown, sports facilities, the two major highways to get you to the airport or to 1-70 for the mountains. We are literally not more than a mile away from most of the hot spots in Denver and for about a $7 Lyft/Uber ride you can get to most of the great spots near Downtown Denver!

host_about:
Hello! My name is Krista and I live in the United States with my husband and our two little boys, who are one and three. I was an early user of Airbnb and listed my first property (which was the house I lived in) in 2012. I rented that property out for seven years until I met my husband, Jeff, and then we rented our properties out together to pay for weekend getaways!

Fast forward to today --- one marriage and two kids later, Jeff and I have hosted thousands of guests in a handful of properties and have stayed at many Airbnb’s all over the world. We are both Superhosts and have even launched a Udemy course on how to be a terrific Airbnb host! 

If there is one website that has truly changed my life, it is Airbnb. 

Now we own properties in some of the places we love the most, including Denver, Colorado --- Steamboat Springs, Colorado --- and Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. We call all of these places “home” and work hard to create an experience for our guests that has all of the conveniences of home but all the pleasures of being on a holiday. 

The Airbnb community is so important to us and has helped us fulfill our dreams. We hope we can have the pleasure of hosting your family at one of our properties and help you create memories that last a lifetime! We can't wait to meet you.

name: Stunning, Private Capitol Hill Carriage House
description: Stunning contemporary architecture in a stand-alone carriage house in Quality Hill Historic District. Completely furnished down to Q-Tips for your comfort, it is a hidden gem in Capitol Hill, an area right next to downtown. Very private, sunny, open plan 1 bedroom 1 bath condo has its own private patio area and a reserved parking space less than to feet from its door. Wifi, cable, flat-screen TV, Blue tooth speaker, complete kitchen with breakfast fixings make it so comfortable for you.
neighborhood_overview: Capitol Hill was the first place people moved to when what is now Lower Downtown became crowded. It has many historic districts, stately homes dating from the late 1800s to the present day, large and small parks, and unique restaurants. It is very walkable and close to B-cycle stations and bus stops to downtown and Cherry Creek. We're a mile to downtown, museums and the Convention Center.

name: Den Zen Home - Mountain Views, Near Sloans Lake
description: A modern, yet boho-chic styled 4-story town home located in Sloan's Lake area of Denver, CO. The Light Rail is conveniently right outside your door with a 10 minute train ride to Downtown, stadiums, Red Rocks & more. Sloan's Lake is a happening area with scenic bike trails, outdoor activities, an array of restaurants, breweries, & more. Get outdoors in our amazing mountains or stay in & relax 420 style at our Zen inspired, comfy home with a rooftop deck and gorgeous views of the amazing Rockies!
neighborhood_overview: Just blocks away is the lovely Sloans Lake neighborhood with restaurants, bars, breweries, Alamo Theatre, coffee shops, ice cream, and yoga studios. host_about:
I'm a techie shaman with a nomadic spirit who loves to travel and see the world. I am conscious business consultant using technology tools and creativity to develop mission / road maps for entrepreneurs. name: A luxurious stay at modern 4-story Home (RiNo)
description: This astounding four story home has been furnished to a flawless standard. It’s the ideal retreat for an exquisite & upscale stay, located in the fabulous River North Art District. At only 10 minutes drive from Downtown Denver, we believe it’s the ultimate location to experience the area the way it should be. Get ready to get inspired! Very close to some fabulous sites. All in all, guaranteed enjoyment and relaxation. All day long.
neighborhood_overview:
This property is amazing all year round for a visit to Denver.

The River North Art District "where art is made" goes by the nickname of "RiNo" and has even adopted a rhino design for its official logo, so look for creative rhinos in art and signage all around the neighborhood! The district's interesting blend of urban charm and unique industrial revival makes it a great destination. Historic warehouses and factories now house jazz bars, restaurants, brewpubs, art galleries and working studios. RiNo boasts a diverse mix of creative businesses ranging from visual artists, designers and furniture makers, to craft distillers and brewers, winemakers, creators of unique outdoor gear and small-batch coffee roasters. The art definitely extends beyond gallery walls in this neighborhood, with its colorful and innovative street art murals in alleys and on buildings around almost every corner! Home to everything from music venues, restaurants, breweries, and a plethora of art galleries

host_about:
Welcome to our page! 

We are a hospitality and property management company dedicated to guest experience, fast response times, property cleanliness and an overall seamless and enjoyable stay for our guests. 

We manage everything from luxurious homes to affordable, yet value driven properties. Whether you want to explore the mountains in Colorado, soak up the sun in South Florida or look for longer term stays for business travels, our portfolio has a diverse set of properties in locations nationwide. 

Each property is fully stocked with items such as linens, kitchenware, everyday house hold items and more. Our team is constantly auditing our properties and performing quality control checks to ensure we have everything just right for your stay. Our cleaning partners dedicate themselves to thorough and detailed cleans that match the standard of 5-star hotels. 

Things do happen from time to time and when they do we are right here to answer any questions or concerns. We respond quickly and have a 24-hour response team in those rare emergencies. 

Lastly, hospitality is our number one focus. We are here to answer your questions, guide you through your stay and take care of anything you need.  We want you to have a memorable experience that keeps you choosing us for you next travel adventure!

host_about:
Scott Hemerda is a founding principal and owner of Vacation Rental Collective (VRC), offering premier vacation rentals along the Front Range, including the greater Denver metropolitan area.  As a native Coloradoan, Scott spent his childhood in Littleton, studied at Colorado State University in Fort Collins, and raised his family in Parker. His daily commute to downtown Denver led to a love of the city in addition to his established love of the surrounding suburbs and mountains. Scott worked in financial services as the Director of Institutional Relationships for 18 years at TIAA-CREF, where he managed relationships worth 20 billion in assets. In addition to leading the top performing relationship management team, Scott supported and retained clients through challenging service model and system changes all evidence of his superior relationship management skills.
Scott married his high school sweetheart and they have three children. A lover of sports, he instilled the values of collaboration, teamwork, and good sportsmanship as a role model participating in softball and basketball and then as a coach for all of his children in their numerous activities. Scott grew up skiing and now enjoys hiking and exploring the mountains with his wife. Business trips, family vacations, and romantic getaways have cultivated his love and expertise on the needs of vacationers.

neighborhood_overview: Close to I-25, Washington Park, and the Light Rail, the DU neighborhood is one of the best locations in Denver. The DU neighborhood's biggest claim to fame is the fact that it houses the University of Denver's sprawling, 125-acre campus. But, the neighborhood is also home to eclectic eateries, local coffee shops, dive bars, and of course, a brewery. Lots of breakfast, lunch, and dinner spots to choose from.

description:
Step into the comfort of the modern, spectacular 3 BR / 3.5 BATH oasis in the vibrant RiNo neighborhood. It offers a relaxing retreat with #instaworthy skyline views, a colorful mural painted by a local artist (Will Krieg), a hot tub, and a few mins away from Downtown Denver!

See more below!
neighborhood_overview:
The townhouse is nestled in a vibrant and rapidly evolving RiNo neighborhood, which stands for River North. Located just northeast of downtown Denver, RiNo is known for its vibrant arts scene, trendy restaurants, BREWERIES, and industrial architecture.

One of the main draws of RiNo is its numerous art galleries, studios, and street murals. Make sure to stroll through the neighborhood and admire the colorful street art, or attend one of the monthly art walks to meet local artists and see their work up close.

Foodies will also find plenty to love in RiNo, with various trendy restaurants and breweries. From upscale eateries to casual gastropubs, there's something for every taste and budget.

In addition to its artistic and culinary offerings, RiNo is also home to several unique shops and boutiques and a thriving nightlife scene. You'll be able to catch live music at one of the neighborhood's music venues or enjoy a cocktail at one of its many bars.

host_about:
We are lucky to professionally host many properties in the Capitol Hill/Uptown/City Park/LoHi/Wash Park/Stapleton areas. We are in our 7th year of hosting and have hosted over 6,000+ stays meeting 10s of thousands of guests from all over the world. We personally greet many of our guests.
Gretchen is an adopted Colorado native of 25 years - 12 years in Vail and 13 fabulous years living in Capitol Hill and Baker in Denver. Jim was born in Denver and his entire family lives here. We LOVE this city and this state - it has so much to offer visitors and residents. The culture, diversity, performing arts and culinary scene are just a few of the things that make us smile here every day.
We truly enjoy helping people connect to the best of the best local gems, whether it's one of our hidden comedy venues or to the newest and most innovative restaurants. Our food truck scene is out of this world, we have the most amazing bands locally and headliners that come from across the country and around the world to perform here.
Jim has an unbelievable wealth of knowledge of Colorado microbrews and can be booked to guide you through some of the best local craft breweries, tailored to your specific taste. Budtenders can be booked for an informative, fun and unique dispensary tour, to discover the truth behind the cannabis lifestyle in Denver. Gretchen can take you for a progressive happy hour, for "single bite" bests at some Denver's best restaurants off the beaten path.
Looking for comedy, spend an evening with both of us at hidden venues laughing with some of Denver's best local comics.
We are blessed to enjoy a great rapport with our guests and respect their privacy. Please communicate any special needs or concerns about your trip. It's our pleasure to be of service.
Please check out our other listings if your dates don't coincide with what you see available on the calendar. And feel free to contact us if you don't find availability when you need it, we might be able to help you find another Airbnb listing that works for your needs. 
On occasion, Gretchen can be of assistance in helping those who are relocating to the area, whether you are looking to rent or buy, contact me with your specifics and I'll see what I can do to help.

name: Art Oasis in the City (30 day minimum rental)
description:
Unique 2 story condo w/contemporary furniture and artwork, eastern sunrise sky view,
in a gentrified area of Denver (aka South City Park).

74 Walk Score/88 Bike Score.

1/2 block walk to CityPark and walking distance to Bluebird Theatre, Sprouts Grocery, many cafes, bars, and restaurants, bike shop, a sparkling City of Denver recreation and fitness center, Tattered Cover book store, record store, dispensaries, and 2m walk to RTD buses to downtown or 10 minute drive to airport train station.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is a gentrified area of Central Denver called The Bluebird District within the South City Park neighborhood. Plus, City Park is only a 1/2 block away. There is a combination of restored single family residences and private apartments in the neighborhood.

There are many restaurants, bars, and coffee shops nearby plus a Sprouts Grocery Store is several blocks away, which can be accessed by foot or a short three minute drive.

The renowned Denver Tattered Cover Book Store, a cinema, a record store, salons, and the almost new City of Denver Athletic Club are within walking distance of my building. Inexpensive Guest memberships are possible.

There is frequent and direct bus service to downtown Denver and the 16th Street Mall and/or Union Station from Colfax or 17th Avenue (preferred). From Union Station, there is light rail service to Denver International Airport (@40minutes). The best stations to access my condo going to the airport is the Co

name: Spacious private suite in prime Denver location!
description: Your room is a warm and inviting private suite with a full private bathroom in the heart of south Denver. High ceilings with intimate lighting give the room a cozy ambiance. Just 1 mile from the heart of downtown, and walking distance to some of the best dining, bars, breweries, dispensaries, art galleries, antique shops that Denver has to offer. Free street is parking available. Come visit Denver!
neighborhood_overview: The property is located just a short walk from some of Denver's best coffee shops, breweries, distilleries, and restaurants. Half mile to the north is the artsy Santa Fe arts district, which features a plethora of trendy art galleries exhibiting art from Denver's best independent artists. Downtown Denver is readily accessible by car, Uber, public transit, or even by bike if you're into that.

name: Downtown Wonderland Walk To Convention and Museums
description:
This home will wow you from beginning to end. The location is amazing and the decor will leave you wanting to stay forever! There is plenty of natural light if you want it, and blinds if don't. It is 2 blocks to the Converntion Center and 4 bloacks to the 16th Street Mall. Walk to 100s of restaurants and bars.

This home has hotel like amenities, from luxury linens and towels, to soaps, shampoos & conditioners.

Professionally cleaned and disinfected.
neighborhood_overview:
Golden Triangle boasts the city's best museums and art galleries, US Mint, civic institutions, civic park and plenty of quality spots to refuel.

To the north of Colfax Avenue is Denver Central Business District. Convention Center, Performing Art Complex and 16th Street Mall are all within walking distance.

5 minutes walking to the west there is a King Soopers super market and a Starbucks along the road.

If you love scooter or bike riding, to the west you find Cherry Creek Trail which spans 14 miles from the Confluence Park to Cherry Creek Reservoir. The Confluence Park is 1.5 miles to the north, where Cherry Creek meets South Platte River and is where Denver was founded. 4 miles down south you arrive at Cherry Creek Mall where many premium stores call it home.

name: Jeff Park Elegance • Remodeled • Walk to Stadium
description: Indulge in the best of Denver from the comfort of this beautifully designed three-bedroom home, centrally located just a 9-minute stroll from the iconic Broncos Stadium/Empower Field! Tastefully finished with elegant touches, this refined homestead features a sumptuous master suite and two recently updated bathrooms. Enjoy the best of both worlds–easy access to all that Denver has to offer, paired with a comfortable upgraded retreat that awaits you at day's end.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover Denver's hidden gem, Jefferson Park, just blocks from Mile High Stadium. Experience events at the stadium, like Broncos games and concerts, conveniently located minutes from your doorstep. Enjoy stunning Sloan's Lake views just a short drive away, perfect for sunset strolls.

Downtown Denver is a 5-minute drive, with quick access to 6th Ave for mountain day trips and I-25 for Front Range adventures. Walk to all you need, including a grocery store. Explore nearby neighborhoods on electric scooters or bikes. It's all here!

Enjoy the convenience of being just a block away from a variety of local amenities, including a brewery, fine dining, salons, pubs, pizza, liquor store, and the picturesque Jefferson Park.

DRIVING DISTANCES:
• Empower Field at Mile High: 9 min walk
• Downtown Denver: 7 min
• Denver Union Station: 8 mins
• Larimer Square: 9 mins
• Denver Performing Arts Complex: 10 mins
• Coors Field: 11 mins<

name: Avail Feb 2024 Bungalow in theTenn/Berkeley area
description: The current Tenant is moving out at the end of January. Available starting February 1st.  We love this safe neighborhood with friendly neighbors creating a fantastic community block. Lush gardens and parks, hip, independently owned shops, art galleries, and restaurants all make the Denver Highland neighborhood an excellent destination for visitors. The neighborhood borders three diverse districts: Highlands Square, Tennyson Street (adjacent to Berkeley), and Lower Highland (LoHi).
neighborhood_overview:
Boutiques, wine shops and bookstores, as well as popular restaurants and bars radiate out from Highlands Square on West 32nd Avenue and Lowell Boulevard. LoHi is characterized by a mix of old and ultra-modern architecture, some of the city's most innovative restaurants and bars and incredible views of the Highland Bridge and downtown Denver.

And, in the Tennyson Street Cultural District in the adjacent Berkeley neighborhood, you can spend an afternoon browsing antique prints, photographs and paintings from Colorado artists, plus find live music venues and great international foods.

Dining

Enjoy rooftop seating, craft beer and cocktails, innovative cuisine concepts and unique flavors!

name: Denver Proper Rooftop Deck with Mountain Views!
description:
Welcome to Denver! Enjoy a 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath, 4 Story town-home with its own private Rooftop deck offering mountain and beautiful neighborhood views!

If you are looking for an upscale, modern home with class and style, not far from Downtown, and only 10 miles from Red Rocks... You found it! We are conveniently located within a 10 minute walk to Sloans Lake, and a 10 minute train ride to downtown Denver and surrounding areas.
neighborhood_overview:
Villa Park is located in Denver County, just minutes away from downtown Denver. Take a 10 minute walk to the gorgeous Sloans Lake, bike on the trail with water that runs into the Platte River, or hop in the Light Rail right outside our door!

There are bars, restaurants, fitness gyms, yoga, and an awesome theater on West Colfax, just a few minutes away, so no need to go far if you have no car.

There are groceries stores nearby within a 5 minute car ride, and more restaurants and bars located in Edgewater about 7 minutes away.

For larger parties, there is a very nice, almost identical unit right next door, large 2/2 with rooftop views! Enjoy your vacation with your group together.

name: Sonder Zuni | Studio Apartment
description: Say hello to the Mile High City at Zuni. These contemporary studios have a fully equipped kitchen, in-suite laundry, and a Roku for streaming. And you can catch a glimpse of the mountains from the rooftop terrace. Centered in the LoHi neighborhood, you'll have all the excitement of Downtown while being just far enough for a restful sleep. Surround yourself with colorful murals, unique eateries, and hoppy breweries. For wood-fired pizza heaven, Cart Driver is just around the corner.
neighborhood_overview: Whatever your passion may be - buzzing restaurants, contemporary art galleries, cute boutiques, or open green spaces - you'll find it all in Denver's unique LoHi neighborhood. Just minutes from downtown, this area is a melting pot of eclectic restaurants that will please any palate. Grab a craft beer or cocktail at one of the endless captivating rooftops and enjoy gorgeous views of downtown. A short walk across the architectural Highland Arch Bridge will bring you to Commons Park where you can enjoy a day lounging in the grass or playing volleyball with friends. Don't miss a chance to stay in this inventive and innovative neighborhood.

Welcome to the furnished one-bedroom apartment located in the historic Baker neighborhood of Denver, Colorado. This charming and cozy apartment is perfect for long-term stays of one month or more, and comes fully furnished with everything you need to feel right at home.
Located in the heart of the Baker neighborhood, this apartment is just few blocks away from a wide variety of restaurants, bars, and shops.
neighborhood_overview:
The Baker neighborhood is a historic neighborhood located in Denver, Colorado, just south of downtown. The neighborhood is bounded by Broadway on the east, Mississippi Avenue on the south, the South Platte River on the West, and Sixth Avenue on the north.

Baker is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood with a mix of residential, commercial, and industrial properties. The area has undergone significant redevelopment in recent years, with many new restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops opening up in the area. The neighborhood is known for its unique and eclectic character, with a mix of historic and modern architecture, as well as a thriving arts scene.

Baker is home to several parks and green spaces, including the popular Baker Park and the Cherry Creek Trail, which runs along the South Platte River.

Overall, Baker is a popular destination for residents and visitors alike, offering a unique blend of history, culture, and modern amenities in a convenient locatio

description: Large, fully private suite with bedroom, full bath and living area in beautiful, sunny Regis/Berkeley Victorian home.  You have your own entrance that is separate from the rest of home and self-check in provides you with full privacy. The suite is located next to my garden. Help yourself to garden veggies, fruit from the trees when in season and rest in the hammock or on the deck. Local restaurants, coffee shops and lakes are walking distance. Easy access to I-70, mountain trails and Red Rocks.
neighborhood_overview: This is a very friendly, walkable  Northwest Denver neighborhood. Lots of great restaurants, shops and bars walking distance. Great breakfast spot and coffee shop (the Noshery) and fun local breweries (Goldspot is my favorite) are a few blocks walk. Most of the nearby restaurants have outdoor seating. Regis university is less than a half mile walk.  A mile walk up Tennyson Street leads you to all kinds of restaurants and shops (check out the Book Bar for fun cultural events). Two lakes in under a mile, along with public library and rec center.

name: Formal  Mansion,  Downtown Denver Capital Hill dis
description:
You'll feel relaxed in our luxurious mansion. Our 13,000-square-foot Georgian residence. If you are interested in hosting an event on the premises as a Birthday party and you are over 16 people, contact us first. We are happy to help if you arrange before booking your reservation.

Rule : because of our alcohol restriction If you are a a bachelor or bachelorette party you must contact us before you book so we can talk about you intention and quantity of consomption of alcohol we allow here
neighborhood_overview: Your stay at the mansion will position you in the heart of one of Denver’s most vibrant and original neighborhoods. You’ll be just a stroll away from many of Denver’s top attractions, including the Colorado State Capitol, the Denver Public Library, Civic Center Park, the Denver Art Museum, and the Molly Brown House Museum, where the famed Denver socialite and Titanic survivor used to live. You’ll also enjoy many tasty restaurants, coffee shops, and nightlife, including Hudson Hill, City O’ City for vegan lovers, Sassafras American Eatery, Pablo's Coffee, City Grille (home to Denver's best hamburgers), Bang Up to the Elephant and many more. You are also three blocks from downtown Denver’s 16th Street Mall, where a free trolley will take you through the length of downtown and its many attractions, including Union Station, Coors Field, the Denver Center for the Performing  Arts, nightlife, restaurants, and more. We are also within walking distance of Trader Joe's and Natural Grocers.

name: Sonder Osage | Studio Apartment
description: Say hello to the Mile High City at Osage. A stunning abstract silhouette of the Rocky Mountains covers the building's facade. Inside, the elegantly designed spaces will equally impress you. Refresh and relax in your bright apartment with a fully equipped kitchen, in-suite laundry, and Roku streaming. With private parking included, you can easily step out. In vibrant LoHi, you'll stroll past Victorian buildings, quaint art galleries, and wine shops. Discover the best of Denver at Osage.
neighborhood_overview: Whatever your passion may be — buzzing restaurants, contemporary art galleries, cute boutiques, or open green spaces — you'll find it all in Denver's unique LoHi neighborhood.  Just minutes from downtown, this area is a melting pot of eclectic restaurants that will please any palate. Grab a craft beer or cocktail at one of the endless captivating rooftops and enjoy gorgeous views of downtown. A short walk across the architectural Highland Arch Bridge will bring you to Commons Park where you can enjoy a day lounging in the grass or playing volleyball with friends.  Don't miss a chance to stay in this inventive and innovative neighborhood.

host_about:
Hi! I'm a Belgian native, and I've been living in the United States for nearly 15 years, calling Denver my home for the entirety of that run! Literally saw this 'cow town' put on her big girl boots... or better, her designer high heels, nowadays competing with other big metropolitan areas when it comes to vibrant city life! No lack of entertainment with unlimited access to delicious (chef-grade) foods and fancy (award-winning) drinks, coffee shops rivaling with Portland/Seattle, and culture and music around nearly every corner. 
That said, Denver/Colorado has not entirely lost its Western core (offering some serious 'time travel' depending on where you explore), and having the Rocky Mountains as your backdrop and outdoor playground, honestly, ain't too shabby! :)
I've loved living here for all these years (and still do!) and am excited to share my space with you so hopefully, you can fall in love with Denver and/or Colorado as well!
My ultimate goal is to offer you a cozy comfortable stay, away from home! Thank you for reading my profile and considering my little home!

name: Denver So. Park Hill Bungalow duplex

Perfect for groups coming in on contract or guests wanting to be lodging in same location.  These share a wall but do not have physical access inside property.   Shared back yard perfect for summer bbq and enjoying Colorado weather.  Location allows quick access to all of Denver.
neighborhood_overview: Denver zoo, imax theatre, and the natural history museum.  Denver golf course, the trendy dining area off colfax and Colorado Blvd.  Tons of hospitals in this area if you are a traveling nurse

name: Denver Urban Retreat - 3BR Rooftop w/ City Views
description: Welcome to the Golden Triangle neighborhood, home to more than 16 galleries & museums and dozens of restaurants and shops. neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Denver is a very eclectic neighborhood, you can find just about anything you are looking for. 

There are numerous activities to choose from, including:
• Amazing restaurants
• Comedy clubs
• Bars

name: Monthly Furnished Apt in Cap Hill + Free Parking
description: Looking for a comfortable and convenient living space in the heart of Denver's Capitol Hill neighborhood? Look no further than our cozy furnished one-bedroom apartment, available for long-term rent.
neighborhood_overview:
Capitol Hill is a vibrant, eclectic neighborhood located in Denver, Colorado, just southeast of downtown. It is known for its historic mansions, impressive architecture, and diverse population.

The neighborhood is bounded by Colfax Avenue to the north, Downing Street to the east, Seventh Avenue to the south, and Broadway to the west. Capitol Hill is a densely populated neighborhood with a mix of residential, commercial, and cultural offerings.

The neighborhood is home to many notable Denver landmarks, including the Colorado State Capitol building and the Molly Brown House Museum. It is also home to a variety of restaurants, bars, cafes, and shops, many of which are located along Colfax Avenue and Broadway.

Capitol Hill has a strong arts and cultural scene, with many galleries and performance venues throughout the neighborhood. It is also home to several parks and green spaces, including the popular Cheesman Park and Civic Center Park.

name: Monthly Furnished Apt Rental Near Downtown Denver

neighborhood_overview:
Few blocks west of Broadway, on Bayaud Ave, this apt has been beautifully remodeled. Few minutes drive to Downtown Denver, few blocks from shopping, dining and night life on Broadway street. Few blocks from Santa Fe Art District. Easy access to 6th Avenue, 8th Avenue, and i25.

Today, South Broadway and the Baker neighborhood offer an eclectic mix of neighborhood taverns, vintage clothing stores, unique eateries, bookstores, art galleries, international restaurants, craft shops, an arthouse movie theater and hip live music venues.

South of Alameda Street, Broadway becomes "Antique Row," a bargain hunter's dream with an amazing collection of nearly 100 antique stores packed into just 18 blocks. Whether you are looking for something to do or something to buy, there's a good chance you'll find it on South Broadway.

neighborhood_overview:
Capitol Hill is a vibrant, eclectic neighborhood located in Denver, Colorado, just southeast of downtown. It is known for its historic mansions, impressive architecture, and diverse population.

The neighborhood is bounded by Colfax Avenue to the north, Downing Street to the east, Seventh Avenue to the south, and Broadway to the west. Capitol Hill is a densely populated neighborhood with a mix of residential, commercial, and cultural offerings.

The neighborhood is home to many notable Denver landmarks, including the Colorado State Capitol building and the Molly Brown House Museum. It is also home to a variety of restaurants, bars, cafes, and shops, many of which are located along Colfax Avenue and Broadway.

Capitol Hill has a strong arts and cultural scene, with many galleries and performance venues throughout the neighborhood. It is also home to several parks and green spaces, including the popular Cheesman Park and Civic Center Park.

Very Urban, but safe and close to lots of city things. I've lived in this neighborhood for 23 years, this is real Denver in a real neighborhood, if you want an authentic experience in a mixed residential neighborhood, here ya go. My lady Cathy is like 5' tall (you'd never guess from talking to her on the phone, ahem) she loves walking around with me, exploring and meeting the neighbors near and far on a pleasant summer night. If it's cold she yells at me a lot lol.

It's amazing, very walkable (6-10 blocks depending on which direction) to dozens of restaurants and bars. My favorite bar is two blocks away. Light rail is a block and a half away, cheap RTD/ Uber to everything in the city. Denver Center for the Performing Arts is easily accessible from transit, as are a dozen concert and show venues like the Odgen, the Bluebird, Mission Ballroom and the Fillmore. host_about:
Hiya!!! I'm a traveler like you, and I'd love to have ya stay and make you smile :) I'm more the backpacker kinda guy but I've stayed in a bunch of airbnbs good and not so good (I promise I want you to say gooder lol), and I've been to 90-ish countries and counting. I've been in Denver for 24 years and I'm here to offer any lil advice I can about how to enjoy our cool lil city and the mountains. Join me and let's smile!

Thanks for considering my place, have safe and amazing travels!

name: ꙮ Cozy & Hip Flat | in Beautiful Capitol Hill ꙮ

neighborhood_overview: Our Capitol Hill neighborhood was originally the home of Denver's elite, who constructed elaborate mansions in the area back in the late 1800's and early 1900's and it is now considered one of the Top 10 Neighborhoods in the U.S. due to it's walkability, safety, parks, bars, and restaurants, and coffee shops, as well as it's close proximity to the downtown corridor. There is a grocery store right across the street, two coffee shops on the corner, and a number of bars and restaurants within two blocks. We love living here and we know you'll love staying in this historic part of Denver!

Hi,  I am a Colorado native  and my husband is from up-state NY.  We count  being out in nature, whatever the season, as pretty much, our favorite thing.   We also love to meet new people and exploring small towns, big cities, and trekking far off the beaten path.

name: 🌳Large treetop apt home w/ partial mountain views!
description: Upper flat nestled among the treetops in West Wash Park away from the street noise. 1 bedroom 1 bath in 12 unit apartment building. Great location .
neighborhood_overview: West Washington Park: This petite neighborhood is considered one of Denver’s most livable spaces. The area has a bubble effect—it sits barely south of Baker’s booming neighborhood and South Broadway dives, west of the ever-busy Washington Park, and walking distance to South Pearl Street, but maintains the air of quiet suburbia perfectly suited for families and professionals. Colloquially known as West Wash Park, the neighborhood is heavily residential, filled with early-20th century houses that have been turned into multi-unit rentals, and offers easy access to a variety of essential and just-for-fun amenities. (Think: grocery stores and fitness clubs, and watering holes and music venues.) Whether you’re a city dweller searching for a new date-night spot, or a Sunday volleyball player looking for a new place to fuel up and wind down after summer games, this residential stalwart offers many fun ways to recharge your routine.

neighborhood_overview:
The Whittier neighborhood is located approximately 2 miles northeast of downtown Denver. The neighborhood is mostly residential and old (1890's) by standards of cities of the American West. Most of the housing stock was built prior to the 1940's.
Today, the Whittier neighborhood is ethnically diverse with Blacks, Hispanics and Whites composing the population. A combination of proximity to downtown, parks, and a newly opened public golf course in addition to a housing stock of early twentieth century homes of craftsman architecture is driving an influx of young professional and their families to the Whittier neighborhood.

name: Western speakeasy❤of WashPark⚡Wi-Fi☀️outdoor space
description:
An Airbnb in Denver, Colorado like no other!

Step back in time while enjoying modern conveniences in a one-of-a-kind western-styled speakeasy getaway.

This is the Denver Airbnb you've been looking for.

Ready for a relaxing, peaceful staycation? Looking for a work from home alternative?

Need a comfortable workspace with fast wifi at an Airbnb in Denver that's suitable for children? And pups?

The historic Washington Park Speakeasy gives you all this. Plus unmatched cleanliness. Free parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Both Washington Park and Veterans Park are just around the corner—a huge plus if you’re bringing the family dog along. Or you’re craving an early morning run in the park, swim or game of tennis.
And the upscale restaurants and shops of Old South Gaylord—the second oldest shopping district in Denver—is within walking distance of your Denver Airbnb.

name: Denver Sunnyside Retreat - 3BR / 3BA
description:
Newly remodeled bungalow, perfect for couples, friends, and families. Our home provides the opportunity to experience a quiet Denver neighborhood, access the mountains, or get downtown quickly by car or bike! Close to restaurants and parks!
Whatever you enjoy in Denver, you will be sure to rest comfortably in your home-away-from home in our Sunnyside escape. Dedicated workspace and fast internet everywhere on the property. Private parking space for guests and plenty of street parking, as well.
neighborhood_overview: Denver’s Sunnyside neighborhood is walking distance to many trendy and family friendly restaurants and parks and conveniently close to everything Denver has to offer: LoHi, downtown, Union Station, LoDo, Coors Field, Mile High, Ball Arena, Wash Park, and Cherry Creek. Light rail, Lyft/Uber, scooter, bike, or drive around town easily. Hop on I-70 or I-25 and head to the mountains in 1-2 hours.

name: New modern home with beautiful view
description:
The house is a modern and spacious duplex with 2640 sq ft and 3 floors. It sleeps 8 comfortably. The place is conveniently situated in the northern part of the city with great outdoor spaces.

* Restaurants and bars nearby
*30-minute walk/8 minute drive to downtown Denver
* 20-minute walk to Little Man Ice Cream in the center of Lohi
* 30-minute drive from Boulder
* 1 hr and 30 minutes drive from Breckenridge

Great place to hang out and enjoy Denver!

A well trained dog will be considered.
neighborhood_overview: Sunnyside is a suburban neighborhood of Denver proper.  It has changed a lot over the years and was formerly called "the Northside" due to its location in Denver.  There are some spots that you can walk to for eating, and it's a short Uber/Lyft from the busier shopping and eating/drinking areas.  More than happy to provide recommendations!

name: Clean comfortable home in a great location
description: This clean, uncluttered  BNB  home is located in the Denver University neighborhood  within walking distance of the light rail to downtown and the tech center.  Washington Park is 4 blocks from the house.  There is a private fenced back yard for the enjoyment of guests and their dog (no cats).   The back yard is xeriscaped so there is little grass.  The neighborhood is safe and enjoyed by walkers, joggers and bicyclers.  The home is a few blocks from I-25 providing easy access to the mountains.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is an eclectic mix of bungalow homes built before 1950 and large homes that have recently replaced some of the older homes.  It provides a very  interesting walking experience to Washington Park, four blocks away.

name: Modern comfort,private entry, 1 bdrm, kitchen, DIA
description: New, modern apartment with designer finishes! 1 bedroom, 1 bath, kitchen, living & dining with a fireplace & private entrance! Fast Wi-Fi Inc. Close to all Denver has to offer. 15 mins from airport, 15 mins to Children's & Univ. Hospital, 10 min to The Gaylord Hotel, within 30 mins of downtown, zoo, aquarium, museums, convention center and sporting events. Light rail station and lots of food options and restaurants within 2 miles. You'll have everything you need in this home away from home!
neighborhood_overview:
We are just a few miles from Walmart and King Soopers (grocery store), Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, 3 liquor stores, as well as lots of fast food, including Chick-fil-A, Arby's, Taco Bell, McDonald's, Wendy's, Burger King, Jimmy John's (they deliver too!), KFC, Panda Express, Chipotle and more! There is a Domino's Pizza, Pizza Hut and Papa John's, all of which you can pick up from or have delivered. There is a Chili's within this 2 miles radius and Outback Steakhouse, Uno's Chicago Grill, Applebee's and Ted's Montana Grill just a few extra minutes away. The Beer Garden is a local favorite and a must try! This is far from an exhaustive list of what's fairly close. Let's just say, if you don't want to cook, you have lots of options!
There is a children's park within walking distance.

name: Mint House Denver : Studio Plus Apartment
description: Mint House Denver - Downtown Union Station is the perfect place to stay for just about any trip. Walking distance from Union Station, Coors Field, Central Business District and tons of restaurants and breweries. This apartment is located in a luxury style apartment building and has all the features you're looking for with a fully equipped modern stainless steel kitchen, floor to ceiling windows and in unit washer and dryer.
neighborhood_overview: Denver - Downtown Union Station is located in Denver’s oldest and trendiest neighborhood: LoDo. There is something for everyone in this historic neighborhood. You will be steps away from the city’s best known restaurants, bars and brewpubs. You will also find an abundance of galleries, shops and boutiques. With plenty of attractions and a wide range of businesses from finance to startups, LoDo is enticing to visitors and locals. Here for a sporting event? Coors field, Mile High Stadium and Pepsi Center are minutes away. Take it all in as you will be in the heart of the most vibrant neighborhood in Denver!

Washington (Wash) Park is one of the most desirable and safe neighborhoods in Denver, a few blocks away from my house. The neighborhood has a Rockwellian feel, with its lush landscaping, and awning covered storefronts.

Perfect for families, couples, friends, and those wanting to be within easy access to downtown, Rino District, South Broadway, Capitol Hill, and Cherry Creek.

Spacious and energetic, the park boasts paddle boats on a large duck pond, a playground, walking and running trails, picnic pavilion, and friendly games of flag football, volleyball and soccer in the summer. The park also has a recreation center where you can sigh up for yoga classes and other activities.

Nearby lively South Broadway - a vivacious street on warm summer nights, lined with hip restaurants, bars & the best ice cream in town! A perfect place for a Saturday night stroll.

name: Modern downtown home w/ rooftop deck & fire pit!!
description:
Our townhome is in the heart of Lincoln Park-literally across the street from the park, blocks away from the Santa Fe Art District, great restaurants and coffee shops, and a block from the Light Rail.

We have three bedrooms total, a king bed, a queen bed and a double bed, and each bedroom has a full bath. The main living space is great for relaxing with a gas fireplace and the roof top deck has comfy seating and a gas fire pit.

Our place is at the sunny SW end of a quiet courtyard. Perfect!

host_about:
I am a singer and voice specialist who is taking a hiatus work with my husband Mike to focus on being a professional adventurer and sailor. 

We both enjoy travel, cooking, hiking, biking, skiing, paddle boarding, sailing, and playing music/attending live concerts.  Check out Red Rocks Ampitheater! 

We are particularly enjoying exploring Mexico and learning Spanish.

We have really embraced the urban lifestyle and generally get around on our cruiser bikes.  We love exploring the Highlands and Hi-Lo areas of downtown for great eats, but we also enjoy frequenting our favorite coffee/wine bar a block away called The Molecule and our neighborhood brew-pub Renegade.
